symbols.name: sap.m.FlexDirection
symbols.description: Available directions for flex layouts.

properties.name: Column
properties.description: Flex items are laid out along the direction of the block axis (usually top to bottom).

properties.name: ColumnReverse
properties.description: Flex items are laid out along the reverse direction of the block axis (usually bottom to top).

properties.name: Inherit
properties.description: Inherits the value from its parent.

properties.name: Row
properties.description: Flex items are laid out along the direction of the inline axis (text direction).

properties.name: RowReverse
properties.description: Flex items are laid out along the reverse direction of the inline axis (against the text direction).

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexItemData
symbols.description: Holds layout data for a FlexBox|HBox|VBox

properties.name: alignSelf
properties.description: Determines cross-axis alignment of individual element (not currently supported in Internet Explorer)

properties.name: order
properties.description: Determines the display order of flex items independent of their source code order.

properties.name: growFactor
properties.description: Determines the flexibility of the flex item when allocatable space is remaining.

properties.name: shrinkFactor
properties.description: The shrink factor determines how much the flex item will shrink relative to the rest of the flex items in the flex container when negative free space is distributed.

properties.name: baseSize
properties.description: The base size is the initial main size of the item for the flex algorithm. If set to "auto", this will be the computed size of the item.

properties.name: minHeight
properties.description: The minimum height of the flex item.

properties.name: maxHeight
properties.description: The maximum height of the flex item.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: The minimum height of the flex item.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: The maximum height of the flex item.

properties.name: styleClass
properties.description: The style class will be applied to the flex item and can be used for CSS selectors

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description: Defines the background style of the flex item.

parameters.description: id for the new element, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.description: initial settings for the new element

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexJustifyContent
symbols.description: Available options for the layout of elements along the main axis of the flexbox layout.

properties.name: Center
properties.description: Flex items are packed toward the center of the line.

properties.name: End
properties.description: Flex items are packed toward the end of the line.

properties.name: Inherit
properties.description: Inherits the value from its parent.

properties.name: SpaceAround
properties.description: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end. Note: This value behaves like SpaceBetween in Internet Explorer 10.

properties.name: SpaceBetween
properties.description: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line.

properties.name: Start
properties.description: Flex items are packed toward the start of the line.

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexRendertype
symbols.description: Determines the type of HTML elements used for rendering controls.

properties.name: Bare
properties.description: The UI5 controls are not wrapped in an additional HTML element, the surrounding Flex Box is a DIV element.

properties.name: Div
properties.description: The UI5 controls are wrapped in DIV elements.

properties.name: List
properties.description: The UI5 controls are wrapped in LI elements, the surrounding Flex Box is an unordered list (UL).

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexWrap
symbols.description: Available options for the wrapping behavior of a flex container.

properties.name: NoWrap
properties.description: The flex container is single-line.

properties.name: Wrap
properties.description: The flex container is multi-line.

properties.name: WrapReverse
properties.description: The flex container is multi-line with the cross-axis start and end being swapped.

symbols.name: sap.m.FormattedText
symbols.description: The FormattedText control allows the usage of a limited set of tags for inline display of formatted text in HTML format.

properties.name: htmlText
properties.description:
Text in HTML format. The following tags are supported:
  • a
  • abbr
  • blockquote
  • br
  • cite
  • code
  • em
  • h1
  • h2
  • h3
  • h4
  • h5
  • h6
  • p
  • pre
  • strong
  • span
  • u
  • dl
  • dt
  • dl
  • ul
  • ol
  • li

class, style, and target attributes are allowed. If target is not set, links open in a new window by default.

Only safe href attributes can be used. See {@link jQuery.sap.validateUrl}.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Optional width of the control in CSS units.

properties.name: convertLinksToAnchorTags
properties.description:
Determines whether strings that appear to be links will be converted to HTML anchor tags,
and what are the criteria for recognizing them.

properties.name: convertedLinksDefaultTarget
properties.description: Determines the target attribute of the generated HTML anchor tags. Note: Applicable only if ConvertLinksToAnchorTags property is used with a value other than sap.m.LinkConversion.None. Options are the standard values for the target attribute of the HTML anchor tag: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Optional height of the control in CSS units.

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.m.GenericTileMode
symbols.description: Defines the mode of GenericTile.

properties.name: ContentMode
properties.description: Default mode (Two lines for the header and one line for the subtitle).

properties.name: HeaderMode
properties.description: Header mode (Four lines for the header and one line for the subtitle).

properties.name: LineMode
properties.description: Line mode (Only header and subtitle are rendered continuously spanning multiple lines).

symbols.name: sap.m.GroupHeaderListItem
symbols.description: sap.m.GroupHeaderListItem is used to display the title of a group and act as separator between groups in sap.m.List and sap.m.Table. Note: The inherited properties unread, selected, counter and press event from sap.m.ListItemBase are not supported.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Defines the title of the group header.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Defines the count of items in the group, but it could also be an amount which represents the sum of all amounts in the group. Note: Will not be displayed if not set.

symbols.name: sap.m.GrowingList
symbols.description: sap.m.GrowingList control is the container for all list items and inherits from sap.m.List control. Everything like the selection, deletion, unread states and inset style are also maintained here. In addition the control provides a loading mechanism to request data from the model and append the list items to the list. The request is started manually by tapping on the trigger at the end of the list.

deprecated.text: Instead use "List" or "Table" control with setting "growing" property to "true"

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Number of items requested from the server. To activate this you should set growing property to "true"

properties.name: triggerText
properties.description:
Text which is displayed on the trigger at the end of the list. The default is a translated text ("Load More Data") coming from the messagebundle properties.
This property can be used only if growing property is set "true" and scrollToLoad property is set "false".

properties.name: scrollToLoad
properties.description:
If you set this property to true then user needs to scroll end to trigger loading a new page. Default value is false which means user needs to scroll end and then click button to load new page.
NOTE: This property can be set true, if growing property is set "true" and if you only have one instance of this control inside the scroll container(e.g Page).

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.m.HeaderContainer
symbols.description:
The container that provides a horizontal layout. It provides a horizontal scrolling on the mobile devices.
On the desktop, it provides scroll left and scroll right buttons. This control supports keyboard navigation.
You can use left and right arrow keys to navigate through the inner content. The Home key puts focus on the first control and the End key puts focus on the last control.
Use Enter or Space key to choose the control.

properties.name: scrollStep
properties.description: Number of pixels to scroll when the user chooses Next or Previous buttons. Relevant only for desktop.

properties.name: scrollTime
properties.description: Scroll animation time in milliseconds.

properties.name: showDividers
properties.description: If set to true, it shows dividers between the different content controls.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description:
The orientation of the HeaderContainer. There are two orientation modes: horizontal and vertical. In horizontal mode
the content controls are displayed next to each other, in vertical mode the content controls are displayed
on top of each other.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description: Specifies the background color of the content. The visualization of the different options depends on the used theme.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the whole HeaderContainer. If not specified, it is rendered as '100%' in horizontal orientation and as 'auto' in vertical orientation.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the whole HeaderContainer. If not specified, it is rendered as 'auto' in horizontal orientation and as '100%' in vertical orientation.

aggregations.description: Content to add to HeaderContainer.

aggregations.description: Scroll container for smooth scrolling on different platforms.

aggregations.name: _prevButton
aggregations.description: Button that allows to scroll to previous section.

aggregations.name: _nextButton
aggregations.description: Button that allows to scroll to next section.

symbols.name: sap.m.IconTab
symbols.description:
Represents an interface for controls, which are suitable as items for the sap.m.IconTabBar.
The classes which implement this interface are:
- sap.m.IconTabFilter
- sap.m.IconTabSeparator

symbols.name: sap.m.IconTabBar
symbols.description:
The IconTabBar control represents a collection of tabs with associated content.

IconTabBar covers the following use cases:
- Filter – There is only one main content for all tabs. The main content can be filtered, based on the selected tab.
- Normal tab bar - The contents of each tab are independent from each other.
- Combination of the above - There can be both filtered and independent contents.

properties.name: showSelection
properties.description: Defines whether the current selection should be visualized.

deprecated.text: Regarding to changes of this control this property is not needed anymore.

properties.name: expandable
properties.description: Defines if the tabs are collapsible and expandable.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Indicates if the actual tab content is expanded or not.

properties.name: selectedKey
properties.description:
Key of the selected tab item.

If the key has no corresponding aggregated item, no changes will apply.
If duplicate keys exists the first item matching the key is used.

properties.name: upperCase
properties.description: Determines whether the text of the icon tab filter (not the count) is displayed in uppercase.

properties.name: stretchContentHeight
properties.description:
Determines whether the IconTabBar height is stretched to the maximum possible height
of its parent container. As a prerequisite, the height of the parent container must be
defined as a fixed value.

properties.name: applyContentPadding
properties.description:
Determines whether the IconTabBar content fits to the full area.
The paddings are removed if it's set to false.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description:
Specifies the background color of the IconTabBar.

Depending on the theme, you can change the state of
the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent".
Default is "Solid".

properties.name: headerMode
properties.description: Specifies the header mode. Note: The Inline mode works only if no icons are set.

properties.name: showOverflowSelectList
properties.description:
Specifies if the overflow select list is displayed.

The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed,
so the user can select specific tab filter easier.

properties.name: headerBackgroundDesign
properties.description:
Specifies the background color of the header.

Depending on the theme, you can change the state of
the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent".
Default is "Solid".

properties.name: enableTabReordering
properties.description: Specifies whether tab reordering is enabled. Relevant only for desktop devices.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: The items displayed in the IconTabBar.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description:
Represents the contents displayed below the IconTabBar.
If there are multiple contents, they are rendered after each other.
The developer has to manage to display the right one or use the content aggregation
inside the IconTabFilter (which will be displayed instead if it is set).

methods.name: getApplyContentPadding

returnValue.description: Value of property applyContentPadding

methods.description: Gets current value of property applyContentPadding. Determines whether the IconTabBar content fits to the full area. The paddings are removed if it's set to false. Default value is true.

methods.name: getBackgroundDesign

returnValue.description: Value of property backgroundDesign

methods.description: Gets current value of property backgroundDesign. Specifies the background color of the IconTabBar. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent". Default is "Solid". Default value is Solid.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation content. Represents the contents displayed below the IconTabBar. If there are multiple contents, they are rendered after each other. The developer has to manage to display the right one or use the content aggregation inside the IconTabFilter (which will be displayed instead if it is set).

methods.name: getEnableTabReordering

returnValue.description: Value of property enableTabReordering

methods.description: Gets current value of property enableTabReordering. Specifies whether tab reordering is enabled. Relevant only for desktop devices. Default value is false.

methods.name: getExpandable

returnValue.description: Value of property expandable

methods.description: Gets current value of property expandable. Defines if the tabs are collapsible and expandable. Default value is true.

methods.name: getExpanded

returnValue.description: Value of property expanded

methods.description: Gets current value of property expanded. Indicates if the actual tab content is expanded or not. Default value is true.

methods.name: getHeaderBackgroundDesign

returnValue.description: Value of property headerBackgroundDesign

methods.description: Gets current value of property headerBackgroundDesign. Specifies the background color of the header. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent". Default is "Solid". Default value is Solid.

methods.name: getHeaderMode

returnValue.description: Value of property headerMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property headerMode. Specifies the header mode. Note: The Inline mode works only if no icons are set. Default value is Standard.

methods.name: getItems
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation items. The items displayed in the IconTabBar.

returnValue.description: The current property value

methods.name: getShowOverflowSelectList

returnValue.description: Value of property showOverflowSelectList

methods.description: Gets current value of property showOverflowSelectList. Specifies if the overflow select list is displayed. The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed, so the user can select specific tab filter easier. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property showSelection

methods.description: Gets current value of property showSelection. Defines whether the current selection should be visualized. Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.m.IconTabFilter
symbols.description: Represents a selectable item inside an IconTabBar.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Represents the "count" text, which is displayed in the tab filter.

properties.name: showAll
properties.description: Enables special visualization for disabled filter (show all items).

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Specifies the icon to be displayed for the tab filter.

properties.name: iconColor
properties.description:
Specifies the icon color.

If an icon font is used, the color can be chosen from the icon colors (sap.ui.core.IconColor).
Possible semantic colors are: Neutral, Positive, Critical, Negative.
Instead of the semantic icon color the brand color can be used, this is named Default.
Semantic colors and brand colors should not be mixed up inside one IconTabBar.

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description:
If set to true, it sends one or more requests,
trying to get the density perfect version of the image if this version of
the image doesn't exist on the server. Default value is set to true.

If bandwidth is key for the application, set this value to false.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Specifies whether the tab filter is rendered.

properties.name: design
properties.description: Specifies whether the icon and the texts are placed vertically or horizontally.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description:
The content displayed for this item (optional).

If this content is set, it is displayed instead of the general content inside the IconTabBar.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

properties.name: Horizontal
properties.description: A horizontally layouted design providing more space for texts.

properties.name: Vertical
properties.description: A vertically layouted design using minimum horizontal space.

symbols.name: sap.m.IconTabHeader
symbols.description:
This control displays a number of IconTabFilters and IconTabSeparators. If the available horizontal
space is exceeded, a horizontal scrolling appears.

properties.name: showSelection
properties.description: Defines whether the current selection is visualized.

deprecated.text: Regarding to changes of this control this property is not needed anymore.

properties.name: selectedKey
properties.description:
Key of the selected item.

If the key has no corresponding aggregated item, no changes will apply.
If duplicate keys exists the first item matching, the key is used.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Specifies whether the control is rendered.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Specifies the header mode. Note: The Inline mode works only if no icons are set.

properties.name: showOverflowSelectList
properties.description:
Specifies if the overflow select list is displayed.

The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed,
so the user can select specific tab filter easier.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description:
Specifies the background color of the header.

Depending on the theme, you can change the state of
the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent".
Default is "Solid".

properties.description: Specifies whether tab reordering is enabled. Relevant only for desktop devices.

symbols.name: sap.m.Image
symbols.description:
A wrapper around the IMG tag. The image can be loaded from a remote or local server.

Density related image will be loaded if image with density awareness name in format [imageName]@[densityValue].[extension] is provided. The valid desity values are 1, 1.5, 2. If the original devicePixelRatio isn't one of the three valid numbers, it's rounded up to the nearest one.

There are various size setting options available, and the images can be combined with actions.

From version 1.30, new image mode sap.m.ImageMode.Background is added. When this mode is set, the src property is set using the css style 'background-image'. The properties 'backgroundSize', 'backgroundPosition', 'backgroundRepeat' have effect only when image is in sap.m.ImageMode.Background mode. In order to make the high density image correctly displayed, the 'backgroundSize' should be set to the dimension of the normal density version.

properties.name: src
properties.description: Relative or absolute path to URL where the image file is stored. The path will be adapted to the density aware format according to the density of the device following the convention that [imageName]@[densityValue].[extension]

properties.name: width
properties.description: When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the original ratio between width/height is maintained. When 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background, this property always needs to be set. Otherwise the output DOM element has a 0 size.

properties.name: height
properties.description: When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the original ratio between width/height is maintained. When 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background, this property always needs to be set. Otherwise the output DOM element has a 0 size.

properties.name: decorative
properties.description:
A decorative image is included for design reasons. Accessibility tools will ignore decorative images.

Note: If the Image has an image map (useMap is set), this property will be overridden (the image will not be rendered as decorative).
A decorative image has no ALT attribute, so the Alt property is ignored if the image is decorative.

properties.name: alt
properties.description:
The alternative text that is displayed in case the Image is not available, or cannot be displayed.
If the image is set to decorative this property is ignored.

properties.name: useMap
properties.description: The name of the image map that defines the clickable areas

properties.name: densityAware
properties.description:
If this is set to false, the src image will be loaded directly without attempting to fetch the density perfect image for high density device.

By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server.

If bandwidth is the key for the application, set this value to false.

properties.name: activeSrc
properties.description: The source property which is used when the image is pressed.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Defines how the src and the activeSrc is output to the Dom Element. When set to sap.m.ImageMode.Image which is the default value, the src (activeSrc) is set to the 'src' attribute of the 'img' tag. When set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background, the src (activeSrc) is set to the CSS style 'background-image' and the root DOM element is rendered as a 'span' tag instead of an 'img' tag.

properties.name: backgroundSize
properties.description: Defines the size of the image in sap.m.ImageMode.Background mode. This property is set on the output DOM element using CSS style 'background-size'. This property takes effect only when the 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background.

properties.name: backgroundPosition
properties.description: Defines the position of the image in sap.m.ImageMode.Background mode. This property is set on the output DOM element using CSS style 'background-position'. This property takes effect only when the 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background.

properties.name: backgroundRepeat
properties.description: Defines whether the source image is repeated when the output DOM element is bigger than the source. This property is set on the output DOM element using CSS style 'background-repeat'. This property takes effect only when the 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background.

aggregations.name: detailBox
aggregations.description:
Aggregation which holds data about the LightBox's image and its description. Although multiple LightBoxItems
may be added to this aggregation only the first one in the list will be taken into account.

symbols.name: sap.m.Input
symbols.description:
Overview

A text input field allows you to enter and edit text or numeric values in one line. To easily enter a valid value, you can enable the autocomplete suggestion feature and the value help option.

Guidelines:
  • Always provide a meaningful label for any input field
  • Limit the length of the input field. This will visually emphasise the constraints for the field.
  • Do not use the placeholder property as a label.
  • Use the description property only for small fields with no placeholders (i.e. for currencies).
Structure

The controls inherits from {@link sap.m.InputBase} which controls the core properties like:
  • editable / read-only
  • enabled / disabled
  • placeholder
  • text direction
  • value states
To aid the user during input, you can enable value help (showValueHelp) or autocomplete (showSuggestion). Value help will open a new dialog where you can refine your input. Autocomplete has three types of suggestions:
  • Single value - a list of suggestions of type sap.ui.core.Item or sap.ui.core.ListItem
  • Two values - a list of two suggestions (ID and description) of type sap.ui.core.Item or sap.ui.core.ListItem
  • Tabular suggestions of type sap.m.ColumnListItem
The suggestions are stored in two aggregations suggestionItems (for single and double values) and suggestionRows (for tabular values).

Usage

When to use: Use the control for short inputs like emails, phones, passwords, fields for assisted value selection. When not to use: Don't use the control for long texts, dates, designated search fields, fields for multiple selection.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates.

properties.name: maxLength
properties.description: Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off. This parameter is not compatible with the input type sap.m.InputType.Number. If the input type is set to Number, the maxLength value is ignored.

properties.name: dateFormat
properties.description:
Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available.
The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format.
NOTE: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd).

deprecated.text: sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicher or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.

properties.name: showValueHelp
properties.description: If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the control. When clicked the event "valueHelpRequest" will be fired.

properties.name: showSuggestion
properties.description: If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input.

properties.name: valueHelpOnly
properties.description: If set to true, direct text input is disabled and the control will trigger the event "valueHelpRequest" for all user interactions. The properties "showValueHelp", "editable", and "enabled" must be set to true, otherwise the property will have no effect

properties.name: filterSuggests
properties.description: Defines whether to filter the provided suggestions before showing them to the user.

properties.name: maxSuggestionWidth
properties.description:
If set, the value of this parameter will control the horizontal size of the suggestion list to display more data. This allows suggestion lists to be wider than the input field if there is enough space available. By default, the suggestion list is always as wide as the input field.
Note: The value will be ignored if the actual width of the input field is larger than the specified parameter value.

properties.name: startSuggestion
properties.description: Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus.

properties.name: showTableSuggestionValueHelp
properties.description:
For tabular suggestions, this flag will show/hide the button at the end of the suggestion table that triggers the event "valueHelpRequest" when pressed. The default value is true.

NOTE: If suggestions are not tabular or no suggestions are used, the button will not be displayed and this flag is without effect.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description is a text after the input field, e.g. units of measurement, currencies.

properties.name: fieldWidth
properties.description: This property only takes effect if the description property is set. It controls the distribution of space between the input field and the description text. The default value is 50% leaving the other 50% for the description.

properties.name: valueLiveUpdate
properties.description: Indicates when the value gets updated with the user changes: At each keystroke (true) or first when the user presses enter or tabs out (false).

properties.name: selectedKey
properties.description: Defines the key of the selected item. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used.

properties.name: textFormatMode
properties.description: Defines the display text format mode.

properties.name: textFormatter
properties.description: Defines the display text formatter function.

properties.name: suggestionRowValidator
properties.description: Defines the validation callback function called when a suggestion row gets selected.

aggregations.name: suggestionItems
aggregations.description: SuggestItems are the items which will be shown in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, destroySuggestionItems) after input is rendered will open/close the suggestion popup. o display suggestions with two text values, it is also possible to add sap.ui.core/ListItems as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field.

aggregations.name: suggestionColumns
aggregations.description: The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table columns; for more details see the aggregation "suggestionRows".

aggregations.name: suggestionRows
aggregations.description:
The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table cells.
The items of this aggregation are to be bound directly or to set in the suggest event method.
Note: If this aggregation is filled, the aggregation suggestionItems will be ignored.

associations.name: selectedItem
associations.description: Sets or retrieves the selected item from the suggestionItems.

associations.name: selectedRow
associations.description: Sets or retrieves the selected row from the suggestionRows.

events.name: liveChange
events.description: This event is fired when the value of the input is changed - e.g. at each keypress

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the input.

events.name: valueHelpRequest
events.description: When the value help indicator is clicked, this event will be fired.

fromSuggestions.name: fromSuggestions
fromSuggestions.description: The event parameter is set to true, when the button at the end of the suggestion table is clicked, otherwise false. It can be used to determine whether the "value help" trigger or the "show all items" trigger has been pressed.

events.name: suggest
events.description: This event is fired when user types in the input and showSuggestion is set to true. Changing the suggestItems aggregation will show the suggestions within a popup.

suggestValue.name: suggestValue
suggestValue.description: The current value which has been typed in the input.

suggestionColumns.name: suggestionColumns
suggestionColumns.description: The suggestion list is passed to this event for convenience. If you use list-based or tabular suggestions, fill the suggestionList with the items you want to suggest. Otherwise, directly add the suggestions to the "suggestionItems" aggregation of the input control.

events.name: suggestionItemSelected
events.description: This event is fired when suggestionItem shown in suggestion popup are selected. This event is only fired when showSuggestion is set to true and there are suggestionItems shown in the suggestion popup.

selectedItem.name: selectedItem
selectedItem.description: This is the item selected in the suggestion popup for one and two-value suggestions. For tabular suggestions, this value will not be set.

selectedRow.name: selectedRow
selectedRow.description:
This is the row selected in the tabular suggestion popup represented as a ColumnListItem. For one and two-value suggestions, this value will not be set.

Note: The row result function to select a result value for the string is already executed at this time. To pick different value for the input field or to do follow up steps after the item has been selected.

events.name: submit
events.description: This event is fired when user presses the Enter key on the input. Note: The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If a change was performed the event is fired after the change event. The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected via Enter. The event is only fired on an input which allows text input (editable, enabled and not valueHelpOnly).

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the input.

methods.description: Gets current value of property selectedKey. Defines the key of the selected item. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used. Default value is .

methods.name: getSelectedRow
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association selectedRow, or null.

methods.name: getShowSuggestion

returnValue.description: Value of property showSuggestion

methods.description: Gets current value of property showSuggestion. If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowTableSuggestionValueHelp

returnValue.description: Value of property showTableSuggestionValueHelp

methods.description: Gets current value of property showTableSuggestionValueHelp. For tabular suggestions, this flag will show/hide the button at the end of the suggestion table that triggers the event "valueHelpRequest" when pressed. The default value is true. NOTE: If suggestions are not tabular or no suggestions are used, the button will not be displayed and this flag is without effect. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowValueHelp

returnValue.description: Value of property showValueHelp

methods.description: Gets current value of property showValueHelp. If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the control. When clicked the event "valueHelpRequest" will be fired. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowValueStateMessage

returnValue.description: the value of property showValueStateMessage

methods.description: Getter for property showValueStateMessage. Whether the value state message should be shown. This property is already available for sap.m.Input since 1.16.0. Default value is true

methods.name: getStartSuggestion

returnValue.description: Value of property startSuggestion

methods.description: Gets current value of property startSuggestion. Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus. Default value is 1.

methods.name: getSuggestionColumns
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation suggestionColumns. The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table columns; for more details see the aggregation "suggestionRows".

methods.name: getSuggestionItemByKey

parameters.name: sKey
parameters.description: An item key that specifies the item to retrieve.

methods.description: Gets the item with the given key from the aggregation suggestionItems. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is returned.

methods.name: getSuggestionItems
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation suggestionItems. SuggestItems are the items which will be shown in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, destroySuggestionItems) after input is rendered will open/close the suggestion popup. o display suggestions with two text values, it is also possible to add sap.ui.core/ListItems as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field.

methods.name: getSuggestionRows
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation suggestionRows. The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table cells. The items of this aggregation are to be bound directly or to set in the suggest event method. Note: If this aggregation is filled, the aggregation suggestionItems will be ignored.

methods.name: getSuggestionRowValidator

returnValue.description: Value of property suggestionRowValidator

methods.description: Gets current value of property suggestionRowValidator. Defines the validation callback function called when a suggestion row gets selected. Default value is .

methods.name: getTextFormatMode

returnValue.description: Value of property textFormatMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property textFormatMode. Defines the display text format mode. Default value is Value.

methods.name: getTextFormatter

returnValue.description: Value of property textFormatter

methods.description: Gets current value of property textFormatter. Defines the display text formatter function. Default value is .

methods.name: getType

returnValue.description: Value of property type

methods.description:
Gets current value of property type. HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates. Default value is Text.

methods.name: getValueHelpOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property valueHelpOnly

methods.description: Gets current value of property valueHelpOnly. If set to true, direct text input is disabled and the control will trigger the event "valueHelpRequest" for all user interactions. The properties "showValueHelp", "editable", and "enabled" must be set to true, otherwise the property will have no effect Default value is false.

methods.name: getValueLiveUpdate

returnValue.description: Value of property valueLiveUpdate

methods.description: Gets current value of property valueLiveUpdate. Indicates when the value gets updated with the user changes: At each keystroke (true) or first when the user presses enter or tabs out (false). Default value is false.

methods.name: getValueStateText

returnValue.description: the value of property valueStateText

methods.description: Getter for property valueStateText. The text which is shown in the value state message popup. If not specfied a default text is shown. This property is already available for sap.m.Input since 1.16.0. Default value is empty/undefined

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: The current width or 100% as default

methods.description: Returns the width of the input.

methods.name: indexOfSuggestionColumn

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oSuggestionColumn
parameters.description: The suggestionColumn whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.m.Column in the aggregation suggestionColumns. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: indexOfSuggestionItem

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oSuggestionItem

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Item in the aggregation suggestionItems. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: indexOfSuggestionRow

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oSuggestionRow
parameters.description: The suggestionRow whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.m.ColumnListItem in the aggregation suggestionRows. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertSuggestionColumn

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oSuggestionColumn
parameters.description: the suggestionColumn to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: the 0-based index the suggestionColumn should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the suggestionColumn is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the suggestionColumn is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a suggestionColumn into the aggregation suggestionColumns.

methods.name: insertSuggestionItem

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oSuggestionItem
parameters.description: the suggestionItem to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: the 0-based index the suggestionItem should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the suggestionItem is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the suggestionItem is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a suggestionItem into the aggregation suggestionItems.

methods.name: insertSuggestionRow

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oSuggestionRow
parameters.description: the suggestionRow to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: the 0-based index the suggestionRow should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the suggestionRow is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the suggestionRow is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a suggestionRow into the aggregation suggestionRows.

methods.name: ontap
methods.description: Fire valueHelpRequest event on tap

methods.name: removeAllSuggestionColumns

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description: Removes all the controls from the aggregation suggestionColumns. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeAllSuggestionItems

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description: Removes all the controls from the aggregation suggestionItems. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeAllSuggestionRows

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description: Removes all the controls from the aggregation suggestionRows. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

returnValue.description: The removed suggestionColumn or null

parameters.description: The suggestionColumn to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a suggestionColumn from the aggregation suggestionColumns.

methods.name: removeSuggestionItem

returnValue.description: The removed suggestionItem or null

methods.description: Removes a suggestionItem from the aggregation suggestionItems.

methods.name: removeSuggestionRow

returnValue.description: The removed suggestionRow or null

parameters.name: vSuggestionRow
parameters.description: The suggestionRow to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a suggestionRow from the aggregation suggestionRows.

methods.name: setDateFormat

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDateFormat
parameters.description: New value for property dateFormat

methods.description: Sets a new value for property dateFormat. Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available. The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format. NOTE: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is YYYY-MM-dd.

deprecated.text: sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicher or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.

methods.name: setDescription

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDescription
parameters.description: New value for property description

methods.description: Sets a new value for property description. The description is a text after the input field, e.g. units of measurement, currencies. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setFieldWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sFieldWidth
parameters.description: New value for property fieldWidth

methods.description: Sets a new value for property fieldWidth. This property only takes effect if the description property is set. It controls the distribution of space between the input field and the description text. The default value is 50% leaving the other 50% for the description. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 50%.

methods.name: setFilterFunction

returnValue.description: this pointer for chaining

parameters.name: fnFilter
parameters.description: The filter function is called when displaying suggestion items and has two input parameters: the first one is the string that is currently typed in the input field and the second one is the item that is being filtered. Returning true will add this item to the popup, returning false will not display it.

methods.description: Sets a custom filter function for suggestions. The default is to check whether the first item text begins with the typed value. For one and two-value suggestions this callback function will operate on sap.ui.core.Item types, for tabular suggestions the function will operate on sap.m.ColumnListItem types.

methods.name: setFilterSuggests

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bFilterSuggests
parameters.description: New value for property filterSuggests

methods.description: Sets a new value for property filterSuggests. Defines whether to filter the provided suggestions before showing them to the user. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setMaxLength

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iMaxLength
parameters.description: New value for property maxLength

methods.description: Sets a new value for property maxLength. Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off. This parameter is not compatible with the input type sap.m.InputType.Number. If the input type is set to Number, the maxLength value is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

methods.name: setMaxSuggestionWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sMaxSuggestionWidth
parameters.description: New value for property maxSuggestionWidth

methods.description: Sets a new value for property maxSuggestionWidth. If set, the value of this parameter will control the horizontal size of the suggestion list to display more data. This allows suggestion lists to be wider than the input field if there is enough space available. By default, the suggestion list is always as wide as the input field. Note: The value will be ignored if the actual width of the input field is larger than the specified parameter value. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setRowResultFunction

returnValue.description: this pointer for chaining

parameters.name: fnFilter
parameters.description: The result function is called with one parameter: the sap.m.ColumnListItem that is selected. The function must return a result string that will be displayed as the input field's value.

methods.description: Sets a custom result filter function for tabular suggestions to select the text that is passed to the input field. Default is to check whether the first cell with a "text" property begins with the typed value. For one value and two-value suggestions this callback function is not called.

methods.name: setSelectedItem

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: oItem
parameters.description: New value for the selectedItem association. If an ID of a sap.ui.core.Item is given, the item with this ID becomes the selectedItem association. Alternatively, a sap.ui.core.Item instance may be given or null to clear the selection.

methods.description: Sets the selectedItem association. Default value is null.

methods.name: setSelectedKey

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: sKey
parameters.description: New value for property selectedKey. If the provided sKey is an empty string "" or undefined, the selection is cleared. If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is selected.

methods.description: Sets the selectedKey property. Default value is an empty string "" or undefined.

methods.name: setSelectedRow

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: oListItem
parameters.description: New value for the selectedRow association. If an ID of a sap.m.ColumnListItem is given, the item with this ID becomes the selectedRow association. Alternatively, a sap.m.ColumnListItem instance may be given or null to clear the selection.

methods.description: Sets the selectedRow association. Default value is null.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property showSuggestion. If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowTableSuggestionValueHelp

methods.description: Sets a new value for property showTableSuggestionValueHelp. For tabular suggestions, this flag will show/hide the button at the end of the suggestion table that triggers the event "valueHelpRequest" when pressed. The default value is true. NOTE: If suggestions are not tabular or no suggestions are used, the button will not be displayed and this flag is without effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowValueHelp

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowValueHelp
parameters.description: New value for property showValueHelp

methods.description: Sets a new value for property showValueHelp. If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the control. When clicked the event "valueHelpRequest" will be fired. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowValueStateMessage

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowValueStateMessage
parameters.description: new value for property showValueStateMessage

methods.description: Setter for property showValueStateMessage. Default value is true

methods.name: setStartSuggestion

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iStartSuggestion
parameters.description: New value for property startSuggestion

methods.description: Sets a new value for property startSuggestion. Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

methods.name: setSuggestionRowValidator

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oSuggestionRowValidator
parameters.description: New value for property suggestionRowValidator

methods.description: Sets a new value for property suggestionRowValidator. Defines the validation callback function called when a suggestion row gets selected. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTextFormatMode
parameters.description: New value for property textFormatMode

methods.description: Sets a new value for property textFormatMode. Defines the display text format mode. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Value.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oTextFormatter
parameters.description: New value for property textFormatter

methods.description: Sets a new value for property textFormatter. Defines the display text formatter function. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sType
parameters.description: New value for property type

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property type. HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Text.

symbols.name: sap.m.InputBase
symbols.description: The sap.m.InputBase control provides a basic functionality for input controls.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Defines the value of the control.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab-chain.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Defines the name of the control for the purposes of form submission.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Defines whether the control can be modified by the user or not. Note: A user can tab to non-editable control, highlight it, and copy the text from it.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description: Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. If this is not specified, a default text is shown from the resource bundle.

properties.name: showValueStateMessage
properties.description: Indicates whether the value state message should be shown or not.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Defines the text directionality of the input field, e.g. RTL, LTR

properties.name: required
properties.description: Indicates that user input is required. This property is only needed for accessibility purposes when a single relationship between the field and a label (see aggregation labelFor of sap.m.Label) cannot be established (e.g. one label should label multiple fields).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: change
events.description: Is fired when the text in the input field has changed and the focus leaves the input field or the enter key is pressed.

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the control.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new sap.m.InputBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

properties.name: bShowLabelAsPlaceholder
properties.description:
Use labels as placeholder configuration.
It can be necessary for the subclasses to overwrite this when
native placeholder usage causes undesired input events or when
placeholder attribute is not supported for the specified type.
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/forms.html#input-type-attr-summary

events.name: change

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the control.

events.description: Is fired when the text in the input field has changed and the focus leaves the input field or the enter key is pressed.

methods.name: addAriaLabelledBy

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: the ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association ariaLabelledBy.

methods.name: applyFocusInfo
methods.description:
Applies the focus info.
To be overwritten by subclasses.

methods.name: attachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.InputBase itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the change event of this sap.m.InputBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.InputBase itself. Is fired when the text in the input field has changed and the focus leaves the input field or the enter key is pressed.

methods.name: bindToInputEvent

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: Function to be called when the value of the input element is changed.

methods.description: Registers an event listener to the browser input event.

deprecated.text: Instead, use event delegation(oninput) to listen input event.

methods.name: bindValue

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oBindingInfo
parameters.description: The binding information

methods.description: Binds property value to model data. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#bindProperty ManagedObject.bindProperty} for a detailed description of the possible properties of oBindingInfo

methods.name: closeValueStateMessage
methods.description: Close value state message popup.

methods.name: detachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the change event of this sap.m.InputBase. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.m.InputBase with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.

methods.name: fireChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event change to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • value of type stringThe new value of the control.

methods.name: fireChangeEvent

parameters.name: sValue
parameters.description: value of the input.

parameters.name: oParams
parameters.description: extra event parameters.

methods.description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association ariaLabelledBy.

returnValue.description: The DOM element reference where the message popup is attached

methods.description: Gets the DOM element reference where the message popup is attached.

methods.name: getEditable

returnValue.description: Value of property editable

methods.description: Gets current value of property editable. Defines whether the control can be modified by the user or not. Note: A user can tab to non-editable control, highlight it, and copy the text from it. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property enabled

methods.description: Gets current value of property enabled. Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab-chain. Default value is true.

methods.name: getFocusInfo

returnValue.description: An object representing the serialized focus information.

methods.description:
Returns an object representing the serialized focus information.
To be overwritten by subclasses.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.InputBase.

methods.name: getName

returnValue.description: Value of property name

methods.description: Gets current value of property name. Defines the name of the control for the purposes of form submission.

methods.name: getPlaceholder

returnValue.description: Value of property placeholder

methods.description: Gets current value of property placeholder. Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value.

methods.name: getRequired

returnValue.description: Value of property required

methods.description: Gets current value of property required. Indicates that user input is required. This property is only needed for accessibility purposes when a single relationship between the field and a label (see aggregation labelFor of sap.m.Label) cannot be established (e.g. one label should label multiple fields). Default value is false.

methods.name: getSelectedText

returnValue.description: The selected text.

methods.description:
Retrieves the selected text.
Only supported for input control's type of Text, Url, Tel and Password.

methods.name: getShowValueStateMessage

symbols.name: sap.m.InputODataSuggestProvider
symbols.description:
Suggestion helper for sap.m.Input fields: Creates a multi column suggest list for a sap.m.Input field based on a ValueList
annotation. The ValueList annotation will be resolved via the binding information of the Input field.

If the annotation describes multiple input parameter the suggest provider will resolve all of these relative to the
context of the Input filed and use them for the suggestion query. The suggest provider will write all values that are
described as output parameters back to the model (relative to the context of the Input field). This can only be done if
the model runs in "TwoWay" binding mode. Both features can be switched of via the bResolveInput/bResolveOutput parameter
of the suggest function:

symbols.name: sap.m.LightBox
symbols.description:
Overview

A {@link sap.m.LightBox} control represents a popup containing an image and a footer. The purpose of the control is to display an image in its original size as long as this is possible. On smaller screens, images are scaled down to fit.

Notes:
  • If the image doesn't load in 10 seconds an error is displayed.
  • Setting the imageContent aggregation of the control as well as the source of the image and the title of the image is mandatory. If the image source is not set, the control will not open.
Structure

Each LightBox holds a {@link sap.m.LightBoxItem LightBoxItem} which keeps the properties of the image:
  • imageSrc - The source URI of the image
  • title - The title of the image
  • subtitle - The subtitle of the image
  • alt - The alt text of the image
Usage

The most common usecase is to click on an image thumbnail to view it in bigger size. When the image that should be displayed in the control cannot be loaded, an error is displayed in the popup.

Responsive Behavior

On a mobile device, flipping the device to landscape will flip the lightbox and the image will be adjusted to fit the new dimensions.

Additional Information

Check out the API Reference.

aggregations.name: imageContent
aggregations.description:
Aggregation which holds data about the image and its description. Although multiple LightBoxItems
may be added to this aggregation only the first one in the list will be taken into account.

aggregations.description: The close button aggregation inside the LightBox control. This button has to have text in it.

aggregations.description: The error icon displayed when the image could not be loaded in time.

aggregations.name: _errorTitle
aggregations.description: The main error message displayed when the image could not be loaded.

aggregations.name: _errorSubtitle
aggregations.description: The detailed error message displayed when the image could not be loaded.

aggregations.name: _verticalLayout
aggregations.description: A layout control used to display the error texts when the image could not be loaded.

symbols.name: sap.m.Link
symbols.description: A hyperlink control which can be used to trigger actions or to navigate to other applications or web pages.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Link text to be displayed.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Determines whether the link can be triggered by the user.

properties.name: target
properties.description: Options are the standard values for window.open() supported by browsers: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered. This property is only used when the href property is set.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the link (CSS-size such as % or px). When it is set, this is the exact size. When left blank, the text defines the size.

properties.name: href
properties.description: The link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If a JavaScript action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the "press" event should be registered.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description: Determines whether the link text is allowed to wrap when there is not sufficient space.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the text.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: This property specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the parent DOM.

properties.name: subtle
properties.description: Subtle links look more like standard text than like links. They should only be used to help with visual hierarchy between large data lists of important and less important links. Subtle links should not be used in any other use case.

properties.name: emphasized
properties.description: Emphasized links look visually more important than regular links.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: press
events.description: Event is fired when the user triggers the link control.

parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.m.List
symbols.description:
The List control provides a container for all types of list items.
For mobile devices, the recommended limit of list items is 100 to assure proper performance. To improve initial rendering of large lists, use the "growing" feature. Please refer to the SAPUI5 Developer Guide for more information..

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description: Sets the background style of the list. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background from Solid to Translucent or to Transparent.

aggregations.name: columns
aggregations.description: Defines columns of the list.

deprecated.text: Instead, use the sap.m.Table control.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.
