symbols.name: sap.m.ListBase
symbols.description: The sap.m.ListBase control provides a base functionality of the sap.m.List and sap.m.Table controls. Selection, deletion, unread states and inset style are also maintained in sap.m.ListBase. Note: The ListBase including all contained items may be completely re-rendered when the data of a bound model is changed. Due to the limited hardware resources of mobile devices this can lead to longer delays for lists that contain many items. As such the usage of a list is not recommended for these use cases.

properties.name: inset
properties.description: Defines the indentation of the container. Setting it to true indents the list.

properties.name: headerText
properties.description: Defines the header text that appears in the control. Note: If headerToolbar aggregation is set, then this property is ignored.

properties.name: headerDesign
properties.description: Defines the header style of the control. Possible values are Standard and Plain.

deprecated.text: No longer has any functionality.

properties.name: footerText
properties.description: Defines the footer text that appears in the control.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Defines the mode of the control (e.g. None, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, Delete).

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets the width of the control.

properties.name: includeItemInSelection
properties.description: Defines whether the items are selectable by clicking on the item itself (true) rather than having to set the selection control first. Note: The SingleSelectMaster mode also provides this functionality by default.

properties.name: showUnread
properties.description: Activates the unread indicator for all items, if set to true.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: This text is displayed when the control contains no items.

properties.name: showNoData
properties.description: Defines whether or not the text specified in the noDataText property is displayed.

properties.name: enableBusyIndicator
properties.description: When this property is set to true, the control will automatically display a busy indicator when it detects that data is being loaded. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until data loading is finished. By default, the busy indicator will be shown after one second. This behavior can be customized by setting the busyIndicatorDelay property.

properties.name: modeAnimationOn
properties.description: Defines if animations will be shown while switching between modes.

properties.name: showSeparators
properties.description: Defines which item separator style will be used.

properties.name: swipeDirection
properties.description: Defines the direction of the swipe movement (e.g LeftToRight, RightToLeft, Both) to display the control defined in the swipeContent aggregation.

properties.name: growing
properties.description: If set to true, enables the growing feature of the control to load more items by requesting from the model. Note:: This feature only works when an items aggregation is bound. Growing must not be used together with two-way binding.

properties.name: growingThreshold
properties.description: Defines the number of items to be requested from the model for each grow. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

properties.name: growingTriggerText
properties.description: Defines the text displayed on the growing button. The default is a translated text ("More") coming from the message bundle. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

properties.name: growingScrollToLoad
properties.description: If set to true, the user can scroll down/up to load more items. Otherwise a growing button is displayed at the bottom/top of the control. Note: This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true and only if there is one instance of sap.m.List or sap.m.Table inside the scrollable scroll container (e.g sap.m.Page).

properties.name: growingDirection
properties.description: Defines the direction of the growing feature. If set to Downwards the user has to scroll down to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the bottom. If set to Upwards the user has to scroll up to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the top.

properties.name: rememberSelections
properties.description: If set to true, this control remembers and retains the selection of the items after a binding update has been performed (e.g. sorting, filtering). Note: This feature works only if two-way data binding for the selected property of the item is not used. It also needs to be turned off if the binding context of the item does not always point to the same entry in the model, for example, if the order of the data in the JSONModel is changed.

properties.name: keyboardMode
properties.description: Defines keyboard handling behavior of the control.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Defines the items contained within this control.

aggregations.name: swipeContent
aggregations.description: User can swipe to bring in this control on the right hand side of an item. Note: For non-touch devices, this functionality is ignored.

aggregations.name: headerToolbar
aggregations.description: The header area can be used as a toolbar to add extra controls for user interactions. Note: When set, this overwrites the headerText property.

aggregations.name: infoToolbar
aggregations.description: A toolbar that is placed below the header to show extra information to the user.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: select
events.description: Fires when selection is changed via user interaction. In MultiSelect mode, this event is also fired on deselection.

deprecated.text: Use the selectionChange event instead.

listItem.name: listItem
listItem.description: The item which fired the select event.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: Fires when selection is changed via user interaction inside the control.

listItem.name: listItem
listItem.description: The item whose selection has changed. In MultiSelect mode, only the up-most selected item is returned. This parameter can be used for single-selection modes.

listItems.name: listItems
listItems.description: Array of items whose selection has changed. This parameter can be used for MultiSelect mode.

selected.name: selected
selected.description: Indicates whether the listItem parameter is selected or not.

events.description: Fires when delete icon is pressed by user.

listItem.description: The item which fired the delete event.

events.description: Fires after user's swipe action and before the swipeContent is shown. On the swipe event handler, swipeContent can be changed according to the swiped item. Calling the preventDefault method of the event cancels the swipe action.

listItem.description: The item which fired the swipe.

swipeContent.description: Aggregated swipeContent control that is shown on the right hand side of the item.

total.description: The total count of bound items. This can be used if the growing property is set to true.

reason.description: The reason of the update, e.g. Binding, Filter, Sort, Growing, Change, Refresh, Context.

total.description: The total count of bound items. This can be used if the growing property is set to true.

methods.name: getAriaLabelledBy
methods.description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association ariaLabelledBy.

methods.name: getEnableBusyIndicator

returnValue.description: Value of property enableBusyIndicator

methods.description: Gets current value of property enableBusyIndicator. When this property is set to true, the control will automatically display a busy indicator when it detects that data is being loaded. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until data loading is finished. By default, the busy indicator will be shown after one second. This behavior can be customized by setting the busyIndicatorDelay property. Default value is true.

methods.name: getFooterText

returnValue.description: Value of property footerText

methods.description: Gets current value of property footerText. Defines the footer text that appears in the control.

methods.name: getGrowing

returnValue.description: Value of property growing

methods.description: Gets current value of property growing. If set to true, enables the growing feature of the control to load more items by requesting from the model. Note:: This feature only works when an items aggregation is bound. Growing must not be used together with two-way binding. Default value is false.

methods.name: getGrowingDirection

returnValue.description: Value of property growingDirection

methods.description: Gets current value of property growingDirection. Defines the direction of the growing feature. If set to Downwards the user has to scroll down to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the bottom. If set to Upwards the user has to scroll up to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the top. Default value is Downwards.

methods.name: getGrowingInfo
methods.description:
Returns growing information as object with "actual" and "total" keys.
Note: This function returns "null" if "growing" feature is disabled.

methods.name: getGrowingScrollToLoad

returnValue.description: Value of property growingScrollToLoad

methods.description: Gets current value of property growingScrollToLoad. If set to true, the user can scroll down/up to load more items. Otherwise a growing button is displayed at the bottom/top of the control. Note: This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true and only if there is one instance of sap.m.List or sap.m.Table inside the scrollable scroll container (e.g sap.m.Page). Default value is false.

methods.name: getGrowingThreshold

returnValue.description: Value of property growingThreshold

methods.description: Gets current value of property growingThreshold. Defines the number of items to be requested from the model for each grow. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true. Default value is 20.

methods.name: getGrowingTriggerText

returnValue.description: Value of property growingTriggerText

methods.description: Gets current value of property growingTriggerText. Defines the text displayed on the growing button. The default is a translated text ("More") coming from the message bundle. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

methods.name: getHeaderDesign

returnValue.description: Value of property headerDesign

methods.description: Gets current value of property headerDesign. Defines the header style of the control. Possible values are Standard and Plain. Default value is Standard.

deprecated.text: No longer has any functionality.

methods.name: getHeaderText

returnValue.description: Value of property headerText

methods.description: Gets current value of property headerText. Defines the header text that appears in the control. Note: If headerToolbar aggregation is set, then this property is ignored.

methods.name: getHeaderToolbar
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation headerToolbar. The header area can be used as a toolbar to add extra controls for user interactions. Note: When set, this overwrites the headerText property.

methods.name: getIncludeItemInSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property includeItemInSelection

methods.description: Gets current value of property includeItemInSelection. Defines whether the items are selectable by clicking on the item itself (true) rather than having to set the selection control first. Note: The SingleSelectMaster mode also provides this functionality by default. Default value is false.

methods.name: getInfoToolbar
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation infoToolbar. A toolbar that is placed below the header to show extra information to the user.

methods.name: getInset

returnValue.description: Value of property inset

methods.description: Gets current value of property inset. Defines the indentation of the container. Setting it to true indents the list. Default value is false.

methods.name: getItemNavigation
methods.description: Returns ItemNavigation for controls uses List

methods.name: getItems
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation items. Defines the items contained within this control.

methods.name: getKeyboardMode

returnValue.description: Value of property keyboardMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property keyboardMode. Defines keyboard handling behavior of the control. Default value is Navigation.

methods.name: getLastMode
methods.description:
Returns the last list mode, the mode that is rendered
This can be used to detect mode changes during rendering

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.ListBase.

methods.name: getMode

returnValue.description: Value of property mode

methods.description: Gets current value of property mode. Defines the mode of the control (e.g. None, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, Delete). Default value is None.

methods.name: getModeAnimationOn

returnValue.description: Value of property modeAnimationOn

methods.description: Gets current value of property modeAnimationOn. Defines if animations will be shown while switching between modes. Default value is true.

methods.name: getNoDataText

returnValue.description: Value of property noDataText

methods.description: Gets current value of property noDataText. This text is displayed when the control contains no items.

methods.name: getRememberSelections

returnValue.description: Value of property rememberSelections

methods.description: Gets current value of property rememberSelections. If set to true, this control remembers and retains the selection of the items after a binding update has been performed (e.g. sorting, filtering). Note: This feature works only if two-way data binding for the selected property of the item is not used. It also needs to be turned off if the binding context of the item does not always point to the same entry in the model, for example, if the order of the data in the JSONModel is changed. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSelectedContexts

parameters.name: bAll
parameters.description:
Set true to include even invisible selected items(e.g. the selections from the previous filters).
        Note: In single selection modes, only the last selected item's binding context is returned in array.

methods.description:
Returns the binding contexts of the selected items.
Note: This method returns an empty array if no databinding is used.

methods.name: getSelectedItem
methods.description: Returns selected list item. When no item is selected, "null" is returned. When "multi-selection" is enabled and multiple items are selected, only the up-most selected item is returned.

methods.name: getSelectedItems
methods.description: Returns an array containing the selected list items. If no items are selected, an empty array is returned.

methods.name: getShowNoData

returnValue.description: Value of property showNoData

methods.description: Gets current value of property showNoData. Defines whether or not the text specified in the noDataText property is displayed. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowSeparators

returnValue.description: Value of property showSeparators

methods.description: Gets current value of property showSeparators. Defines which item separator style will be used. Default value is All.

methods.name: getShowUnread

returnValue.description: Value of property showUnread

methods.description: Gets current value of property showUnread. Activates the unread indicator for all items, if set to true. Default value is false.

methods.name: getSwipeContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation swipeContent. User can swipe to bring in this control on the right hand side of an item. Note: For non-touch devices, this functionality is ignored.

methods.name: getSwipeDirection

returnValue.description: Value of property swipeDirection

methods.description: Gets current value of property swipeDirection. Defines the direction of the swipe movement (e.g LeftToRight, RightToLeft, Both) to display the control defined in the swipeContent aggregation. Default value is Both.

methods.name: getSwipedItem
methods.description: Returns swiped list item. When no item is swiped, "null" is returned.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description: Gets current value of property width. Sets the width of the control. Default value is 100%.

parameters.description: The item whose index is looked for

methods.name: selectAll

methods.name: setEnableBusyIndicator

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableBusyIndicator
parameters.description: New value for property enableBusyIndicator

methods.description: Sets a new value for property enableBusyIndicator. When this property is set to true, the control will automatically display a busy indicator when it detects that data is being loaded. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until data loading is finished. By default, the busy indicator will be shown after one second. This behavior can be customized by setting the busyIndicatorDelay property. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setFooterText

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sFooterText
parameters.description: New value for property footerText

methods.description: Sets a new value for property footerText. Defines the footer text that appears in the control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setGrowing

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bGrowing
parameters.description: New value for property growing

methods.description: Sets a new value for property growing. If set to true, enables the growing feature of the control to load more items by requesting from the model. Note:: This feature only works when an items aggregation is bound. Growing must not be used together with two-way binding. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setGrowingDirection

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sGrowingDirection
parameters.description: New value for property growingDirection

methods.description: Sets a new value for property growingDirection. Defines the direction of the growing feature. If set to Downwards the user has to scroll down to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the bottom. If set to Upwards the user has to scroll up to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the top. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Downwards.

methods.name: setGrowingScrollToLoad

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bGrowingScrollToLoad
parameters.description: New value for property growingScrollToLoad

methods.description: Sets a new value for property growingScrollToLoad. If set to true, the user can scroll down/up to load more items. Otherwise a growing button is displayed at the bottom/top of the control. Note: This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true and only if there is one instance of sap.m.List or sap.m.Table inside the scrollable scroll container (e.g sap.m.Page). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 20.

This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Defines the visual indication and behavior of the list items, e.g. Active, Navigation, Detail.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control.

properties.name: unread
properties.description: Activates the unread indicator for the list item, if set to true. Note: This flag is ignored when the showUnread property of the parent is set to false.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the selected state of the list items. Note: Binding the selected property in single selection modes may cause unwanted results if you have more than one selected items in your binding.

properties.name: counter
properties.description: Defines the counter value of the list items.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description:
Defines the highlight state of the list items.
The highlight state provides a visual indication that can be related to a value state or as a general highlighting which can vary depending on the application use-case.

symbols.name: sap.m.ListKeyboardMode
symbols.description: Defines the keyboard handling behavior of the sap.m.List or sap.m.Table.

properties.name: Edit
properties.description: This mode is suitable if the number of items is limited and if there are editable fields within the item. While the last/first interactive element within an item has the focus, pressing tab/shift+tab moves the focus to the next/previous element in the tab chain after/before the item .

properties.name: Navigation
properties.description: This default mode is suitable if the number of items is unlimited or if there is no editable field within the item. While the last/first interactive element within an item has the focus, pressing tab/shift+tab moves the focus to the next/previous element in the tab chain after/before the sap.m.List or sap.m.Table.

symbols.name: sap.m.ListMode
symbols.description: Defines the mode of the list.

properties.name: Delete
properties.description: Delete mode (only one list item can be deleted via provided delete button)

properties.name: MultiSelect
properties.description: Multi selection mode (more than one list item can be selected).

properties.name: None
properties.description: Default mode (no selection).

properties.name: SingleSelect
properties.description: Right-positioned single selection mode (only one list item can be selected).

properties.name: SingleSelectLeft
properties.description: Left-positioned single selection mode (only one list item can be selected).

properties.name: SingleSelectMaster
properties.description: Selected item is highlighted but no selection control is visible (only one list item can be selected).

symbols.name: sap.m.ListSeparators
symbols.description: Defines which separator style will be applied for the items.

properties.name: All
properties.description: Separators between the items including the last and the first one.

properties.name: Inner
properties.description: Separators between the items. Note: This enumeration depends on the theme.

properties.name: None
properties.description: No item separators.

symbols.name: sap.m.ListType
symbols.description: Defines the visual indication and behaviour of the list items.

properties.name: Active
properties.description: Indicates that the item is clickable via active feedback when item is pressed.

properties.name: Detail
properties.description: Enables detail button of the list item that fires detailPress event. Also see {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#attachDetailPress}.

properties.name: DetailAndActive
properties.description: Enables {@link sap.m.ListType.Detail} and {@link sap.m.ListType.Active} enumerations together.

properties.name: Inactive
properties.description: Indicates the list item does not have any active feedback when item is pressed. Note: Inactive type cannot be used to disable list items.

properties.name: Navigation
properties.description: Indicates the list item is navigable to show extra information about the item.

symbols.name: sap.m.LoadState
symbols.description: Enumeration of possible load statuses.

properties.name: Disabled
properties.description: The control is disabled.

properties.name: Failed
properties.description: The control failed to load.

properties.name: Loaded
properties.description: The control has loaded.

properties.name: Loading
properties.description: The control is loading.

symbols.name: sap.m.MaskInput
symbols.description: The sap.m.MaskInput control allows users to easily enter data in a certain format and in a fixed-width input (for example: date, time, phone number, credit card number, currency, IP address, MAC address, and others).

properties.name: placeholderSymbol
properties.description: Defines a placeholder symbol. Shown at the position where there is no user input yet.

properties.name: mask
properties.description: Mask defined by its characters type (respectively, by its length). You should consider the following important facts: 1. The mask characters normally correspond to an existing rule (one rule per unique char). Characters which don't, are considered immutable characters (for example, the mask '2099', where '9' corresponds to a rule for digits, has the characters '2' and '0' as immutable). 2. Adding a rule corresponding to the placeholderSymbol is not recommended and would lead to an unpredictable behavior. 3. You can use the special escape character '^' called "Caret" prepending a rule character to make it immutable. Use the double escape '^^' if you want to make use of the escape character as a immutable one.

aggregations.description: A list of validation rules (one rule per mask character).

methods.description:
Gets a replacement string for the character being placed in the input.
Subclasses may override this method in order to get some additional behavior. For instance, switching current input
character with other for time input purposes. As an example, if the user enters "2" (in 12-hour format), the consumer may use
this method to replace the input from "2" to "02".

methods.description: Gets current value of property mask. Mask defined by its characters type (respectively, by its length). You should consider the following important facts: 1. The mask characters normally correspond to an existing rule (one rule per unique char). Characters which don't, are considered immutable characters (for example, the mask '2099', where '9' corresponds to a rule for digits, has the characters '2' and '0' as immutable). 2. Adding a rule corresponding to the placeholderSymbol is not recommended and would lead to an unpredictable behavior. 3. You can use the special escape character '^' called "Caret" prepending a rule character to make it immutable. Use the double escape '^^' if you want to make use of the escape character as a immutable one.

symbols.name: sap.m.MenuButton
symbols.description: The sap.m.MenuButton control enables the user to show a hierarchical menu.

properties.name: text
properties.description:
Defines the text of the MenuButton.
Note: In Split buttonMode with useDefaultActionOnly set to false, the text is changed to display the last selected item's text, while in Regular buttonMode the text stays unchanged.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Defines the type of the MenuButton (for example, Default, Accept, Reject, Back, etc.)

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the MenuButton.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
Boolean property to enable the control (default is true).
Note: Depending on custom settings, the buttons that are disabled have other colors than the enabled ones.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the button.
It can be an image or an icon from the icon font.

properties.name: activeIcon
properties.description: The source property of an alternative icon for the active (pressed) state of the button. Both active and default icon properties should be defined and of the same type - image or icon font. If the icon property is not set or has a different type, the active icon is not displayed.

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description: When set to true (default), one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server. If only one version of image is provided, set this value to false to avoid the attempt of fetching density perfect image.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description:
Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options.
By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

properties.name: buttonMode
properties.description: Defines whether the MenuButton is set to Regular or Split mode.

properties.name: useDefaultActionOnly
properties.description: Controls whether the default action handler is invoked always or it is invoked only until a menu item is selected. Usable only if buttonMode is set to Split.

aggregations.name: menu
aggregations.description: Defines the menu that opens for this button.

aggregations.name: _button
aggregations.description: Internal aggregation that contains the button part.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageBox

methods.name: alert

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: Message to be displayed in the alert dialog. The usage of sap.core.Control as vMassage is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

parameters.name: mOptions

onClose.name: onClose
onClose.description: callback function to be called when the user closes the dialog

title.name: title
title.description: Title to be displayed in the alert dialog

id.name: id
id.description: ID to be used for the alert dialog. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

styleClass.name: styleClass
styleClass.description: Added since version 1.21.2. CSS style class which is added to the alert dialog's root DOM node. The compact design can be activated by setting this to "sapUiSizeCompact"

initialFocus.name: initialFocus
initialFocus.description:
Added since version 1.28.0. initialFocus, this option sets the action name, the text of the button or the control that gets the focus as first focusable element after the MessageBox is opened.
The usage of sap.ui.core.Control to set initialFocus is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

textDirection.name: textDirection
textDirection.description: Added since version 1.28. Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

parameters.description: Other options (optional)

methods.description:
Displays an alert dialog with the given message and an OK button (no icons). 
sap.m.MessageBox.alert("This message should appear in the alert", {
    title: "Alert",                                      // default
    onClose: null,                                       // default
    styleClass: ""                                       // default
    initialFocus: null                                   // default
    textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit     // default
});
If a callback is given, it is called after the alert dialog has been closed by the user via the OK button. The callback is called with the following signature: 
  function (oAction)
where oAction can be either sap.m.MessageBox.Action.OK when the alert dialog is closed by tapping on the OK button or null when the alert dialog is closed by calling sap.m.InstanceManager.closeAllDialogs(). The alert dialog opened by this method is processed asynchronously. Applications have to use fnCallback to continue work after the user closed the alert dialog.

methods.name: confirm

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: Message to be displayed in the alert dialog. The usage of sap.core.Control as vMassage is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

parameters.name: mOptions

onClose.name: onClose
onClose.description: Callback to be called when the user closes the dialog

title.name: title
title.description: Title to display in the confirmation dialog

id.name: id
id.description: ID to be used for the confirmation dialog. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

styleClass.name: styleClass
styleClass.description: Added since version 1.21.2. CSS style class which is added to the confirmation dialog's root DOM node. The compact design can be activated by setting this to "sapUiSizeCompact"

initialFocus.name: initialFocus
initialFocus.description:
Added since version 1.28.0. initialFocus, this option sets the action name, the text of the button or the control that gets the focus as first focusable element after the MessageBox is opened.
The usage of sap.ui.core.Control to set initialFocus is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

textDirection.name: textDirection
textDirection.description: Added since version 1.28. Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

parameters.description: Other options (optional)

methods.description:
Displays a confirmation dialog with the given message, a QUESTION icon, an OK button and a Cancel button. If a callback is given, it is called after the confirmation box has been closed by the user with one of the buttons. 
sap.m.MessageBox.confirm("This message should appear in the confirmation", {
    title: "Confirm",                                    // default
    onClose: null                                        // default
    styleClass: ""                                       // default
    initialFocus: null                                   // default
    textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit     // default
    });
The callback is called with the following signature 
  function(oAction)
where oAction is set by one of the following three values: 1. sap.m.MessageBox.Action.OK: OK (confirmed) button is tapped. 2. sap.m.MessageBox.Action.Cancel: Cancel (unconfirmed) button is tapped. 3. null: Confirm dialog is closed by calling sap.m.InstanceManager.closeAllDialogs() The confirmation dialog opened by this method is processed asynchronously. Applications have to use fnCallback to continue work after the user closed the confirmation dialog

methods.name: show

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: Message to be displayed in the alert dialog. The usage of sap.core.Control as vMassage is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

parameters.name: mOptions

title.name: title
title.description: The title of the message box.

actions.name: actions
actions.description:
Either a single action, or an array of two actions.
     If no action(s) are given, the single action MessageBox.Action.OK is taken as a default for the parameter. From UI5 version 1.21, more than 2 actions are supported.
     For the former versions, if more than two actions are given, only the first two actions are taken. Custom action string(s) can be provided, and then the translation
     of custom action string(s) needs to be done by the application.

onClose.name: onClose
onClose.description: Function to be called when the user taps a button or closes the message box.

id.name: id
id.description: ID to be used for the dialog. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

styleClass.name: styleClass
styleClass.description: Added since version 1.21.2. CSS style class which is added to the dialog's root DOM node. The compact design can be activated by setting this to "sapUiSizeCompact"

initialFocus.name: initialFocus
initialFocus.description:
Added since version 1.28.0. initialFocus, this option sets the action name, the text of the button or the control that gets the focus as first focusable element after the MessageBox is opened.
The usage of sap.ui.core.Control to set initialFocus is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

textDirection.name: textDirection
textDirection.description: Added since version 1.28. Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

details.name: details
details.description: Added since version 1.28.0. If 'details' is set in the MessageBox, a 'Show detail' link is added. When you click the link, it is set to visible = false and the text area containing 'details' information is then displayed.

parameters.description: Other options (optional)

methods.description:
Creates and displays a sap.m.Dialog with type sap.m.DialogType.Message with the given text and buttons, and optionally other parts. After the user has tapped a button, the onClose function is invoked when given. The only mandatory parameter is vMessage. Either a string with the corresponding text or even a layout control could be provided. 
sap.m.MessageBox.show("This message should appear in the message box", {
    icon: sap.m.MessageBox.Icon.NONE,                    // default
    title: "",                                           // default
    actions: sap.m.MessageBox.Action.OK                  // default
    onClose: null                                        // default
    styleClass: ""                                       // default
    initialFocus: null                                   // default
    textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit     // default
});
The created dialog is executed asynchronously. When it has been created and registered for rendering, this function returns without waiting for a user reaction. When applications have to react on the users choice, they have to provide a callback function and postpone any reaction on the user choice until that callback is triggered. The signature of the callback is function (oAction); where oAction is the button that the user has tapped. For example, when the user has pressed the close button, a sap.m.MessageBox.Action.Close is returned.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageBox.Action
symbols.description:
Enumeration of supported actions in a MessageBox.

Each action is represented as a button in the message box. The values of this enumeration are used for both,
specifying the set of allowed actions as well as reporting back the user choice.

properties.name: ABORT
properties.description: Adds an "Abort" button to the message box.

properties.name: CANCEL
properties.description: Adds a "Cancel" button to the message box.

properties.name: CLOSE
properties.description: Adds a "Close" button to the message box.

properties.name: DELETE
properties.description: Adds a "Delete" button to the message box.

properties.name: IGNORE
properties.description: Adds an "Ignore" button to the message box.

properties.name: NO
properties.description: Adds a "No" button to the message box.

properties.name: OK
properties.description: Adds an "OK" button to the message box.

properties.name: RETRY
properties.description: Adds a "Retry" button to the message box.

properties.name: YES
properties.description: Adds a "Yes" button to the message box.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageBox.Icon
symbols.description: Enumeration of the pre-defined icons that can be used in a MessageBox.

properties.name: ERROR
properties.description: Shows the error icon in the message box.

properties.name: INFORMATION
properties.description: Shows the information icon in the message box.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: Shows no icon in the message box.

properties.name: QUESTION
properties.description: Shows the question icon in the message box.

properties.name: SUCCESS
properties.description: Shows the success icon in the message box.

properties.name: WARNING
properties.description: Shows the warning icon in the message box.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessagePage
symbols.description:
MessagePage is displayed when there is no data or matching content. There are different use cases where a MessagePage might be visualized, for example: - The search query returned no results - The app contains no items - There are too many items - The application is loading The layout is unchanged but the text varies depending on the use case.
Note: The MessagePage is not intended to be used as a top-level control, but rather used within controls such as NavContainer, App, Shell or other container controls.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Determines the main text displayed on the MessagePage.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Determines the detailed description that shows additional information on the MessagePage.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Determines the title in the header of MessagePage.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description:
Determines the visibility of the MessagePage header.
Can be used to hide the header of the MessagePage when it's embedded in another page.

properties.name: showNavButton
properties.description: Determines the visibility of the navigation button in MessagePage header.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Determines the icon displayed on the MessagePage.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Determines the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

aggregations.name: customText
aggregations.description:
The (optional) custom Text control of this page.
Use this aggregation when the "text" (sap.m.Text) control needs to be replaced with a sap.m.Link control.
"text" and "textDirection" setters can be used for this aggregation.

aggregations.name: customDescription
aggregations.description:
The (optional) custom description control of this page.
Use this aggregation when the "description" (sap.m.Text) control needs to be replaced with a sap.m.Link control.
"description" and "textDirection" setters can be used for this aggregation.

aggregations.name: _page
aggregations.description: A Page control which is managed internally by the MessagePage control.

associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

symbols.name: sap.m.MessagePopover
symbols.description:
Overview

A {@link sap.m.MessagePopover} is used to display a summarized list of different types of messages (errors, warnings, success and information). It provides a handy and systemized way to navigate and explore details for every message.

Notes:
  • Messages can have descriptions pre-formatted with HTML markup. In this case, the markupDescription has to be set to true.
  • If the message cannot be fully displayed or includes a long description, the message popover provides navigation to the detailed description.
Structure

The message popover stores all messages in an association of type {@link sap.m.MessagePopoverItem} named items.
A set of properties determines how the items are rendered:
  • counter - An integer that is used to indicate the number of errors for each type
  • type - The type of message
  • title/subtitle - The title and subtitle of the message
  • description - The long text description of the message
Usage

With the message concept, MessagePopover provides a way to centrally manage messages and show them to the user without additional work for the developer. The message popover is triggered from a messaging button in the footer toolbar. If an error has occurred at any validation point, the total number of messages should be incremented, but the user's work shouldn't be interrupted.

Responsive Behavior

On mobile phones, the message popover is automatically shown in full screen mode.

properties.name: placement
properties.description:
Determines the position, where the control will appear on the screen. Possible values are: sap.m.VerticalPlacementType.Top, sap.m.VerticalPlacementType.Bottom and sap.m.VerticalPlacementType.Vertical.
The default value is sap.m.VerticalPlacementType.Vertical. Setting this property while the control is open, will not cause any re-rendering and changing of the position. Changes will only be applied with the next interaction.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageStrip
symbols.description:
MessageStrip is a control that enables the embedding of application-related messages in the application.
There are 4 types of messages: Information, Success, Warning and Error.
Each message can have a close button, so that it can be removed from the UI if needed.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Determines the text of the message.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Determines the type of messages that are displayed in the MessageStrip.
Possible values are: Information (default), Success, Warning, Error.
If None is passed, the value is set to Information and a warning is displayed in the console.

properties.name: customIcon
properties.description:
Determines a custom icon which is displayed.
If none is set, the default icon for this message type is used.

properties.name: showIcon
properties.description: Determines if an icon is displayed for the message.

properties.name: showCloseButton
properties.description: Determines if the message has a close button in the upper right corner.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageToast
symbols.description:
A small, non-disruptive popup for messages.

Overview

A message toast is a small, non-disruptive popup for success or information messages that disappears automatically after a few seconds. Toasts automatically disappear after a timeout unless the user moves the mouse over the toast or taps on it.

Notes:

  • If the configured message contains HTML code or script tags, those will be escaped.
  • Line breaks (\r\n, \n\r, \r, \n) will be visualized.
  • Only one message toast can be shown at a time in the same place.

Example:

Here is an example of a MessageToast with all default options: 
sap.m.MessageToast.show("This message should appear in the message toast", {
    duration: 3000,                  // default
    width: "15em",                   // default
    my: "center bottom",             // default
    at: "center bottom",             // default
    of: window,                      // default
    offset: "0 0",                   // default
    collision: "fit fit",            // default
    onClose: null,                   // default
    autoClose: true,                 // default
    animationTimingFunction: "ease", // default
    animationDuration: 1000,         // default
    closeOnBrowserNavigation: true   // default
});

Usage

When to use:

  • You want to display a short success of information message.
  • You do not want to interrupt users while they are performing an action.
  • You want to confirm a successful action.

When not to use:

  • You want to display an error or warning message.
  • You want to interrupt users while they are performing an action.
  • You want to make sure that users read the message before they leave the page.
  • You want users to be able to copy some part of the message text. (In this case, show a success {@link sap.m.Dialog Message Dialog}.)

Responsive Behavior

The message toast has the same behavior on all devices. However, you can adjust the width of the control, for example, for use on a desktop device.

methods.name: show

parameters.name: sMessage
parameters.description: The message to be displayed.

parameters.name: mOptions

duration.name: duration
duration.description: Time in milliseconds before the close animation starts. Needs to be a finite positive nonzero integer.

width.name: width
width.description: The width of the message toast, this value can be provided in %, em, px and all possible CSS measures.

my.name: my
my.description: Specifies which point of the message toast should be aligned.

at.name: at
at.description: Specifies the point of the reference element to which the message toast should be aligned.

of.name: of
of.description: Specifies the reference element to which the message toast should be aligned, by default it is aligned to the browser visual viewport.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The offset relative to the docking point, specified as a string with space-separated pixel values (e.g. "0 10" to move the message toast 10 pixels to the right).

collision.name: collision
collision.description: Specifies how the position of the message toast should be adjusted in case it overflows the screen in some direction. Possible values “fit”, “flip”, “none”, or a pair for horizontal and vertical e.g. "fit flip”, "fit none".

onClose.name: onClose
onClose.description: Function to be called when the message toast closes.

autoClose.name: autoClose
autoClose.description: Specify whether the message toast should close as soon as the end user touches the screen.

animationTimingFunction.name: animationTimingFunction
animationTimingFunction.description: Describes how the close animation will progress. Possible values "ease", "linear", "ease-in", "ease-out", "ease-in-out". This feature is not supported in android and ie9 browsers.

animationDuration.name: animationDuration
animationDuration.description: Time in milliseconds that the close animation takes to complete. Needs to be a finite positive integer. For not animation set to 0. This feature is not supported in android and ie9 browsers.

closeOnBrowserNavigation.name: closeOnBrowserNavigation
closeOnBrowserNavigation.description: Specifies if the message toast closes on browser navigation.

parameters.description: Object which can contain all other options. Not all entries in this object are required. This property is optional.

methods.description: Creates and displays a simple message toast notification message with the given text, and optionally other options. The only mandatory parameter is sMessage.

symbols.name: sap.m.NavContainer
symbols.description:
The NavContainer control handles hierarchic navigation between Pages or other fullscreen controls.

All children of this control will receive navigation events like {@link sap.m.NavContainerChild#beforeShow beforeShow}, they are documented in the pseudo interface {@link sap.m.NavContainerChild sap.m.NavContainerChild}

properties.name: autoFocus
properties.description:
Determines whether the initial focus is set automatically on first rendering and after navigating to a new page.
This is useful when on touch devices the keyboard pops out due to the focus being automatically set on an input field.
If necessary the "afterShow" event can be used to focus another element.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the NavContainer. Can be changed when the NavContainer should not cover the whole available area.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the NavContainer. Can be changed when the NavContainer should not cover the whole available area.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the NavContainer is visible.

properties.name: defaultTransitionName
properties.description: The type of the transition/animation to apply when "to()" is called without defining a transition type to use. The default is "slide". Other options are: "fade", "flip" and "show" - and the names of any registered custom transitions.

aggregations.name: pages
aggregations.description:
The content entities between which this NavContainer navigates. These can be of type sap.m.Page, sap.ui.core.View, sap.m.Carousel or any other control with fullscreen/page semantics.

These aggregated controls will receive navigation events like {@link sap.m.NavContainerChild#beforeShow beforeShow}, they are documented in the pseudo interface {@link sap.m.NavContainerChild sap.m.NavContainerChild}

associations.name: initialPage
associations.description:
This association can be used to define which page is displayed initially. If the given page does not exist or no page is given, the first page which has been added is considered as initial page.
This value should be set initially and not set/modified while the application is running.

This could be used not only for the initial display, but also if the user wants to navigate "up to top", so this page serves as a sort of "home/root page".

events.name: navigate
events.description:
The event is fired when navigation between two pages has been triggered. The transition (if any) to the new page has not started yet.
This event can be aborted by the application with preventDefault(), which means that there will be no navigation.

from.name: from
from.description: The page which was shown before the current navigation.

fromId.name: fromId
fromId.description: The ID of the page which was shown before the current navigation.

to.name: to
to.description: The page which will be shown after the current navigation.

toId.name: toId
toId.description: The ID of the page which will be shown after the current navigation.

firstTime.name: firstTime
firstTime.description: Whether the "to" page (more precisely: a control with the ID of the page which is currently navigated to) has not been shown/navigated to before.

isTo.name: isTo
isTo.description: Whether this is a forward navigation, triggered by "to()".

isBack.name: isBack
isBack.description: Whether this is a back navigation, triggered by "back()".

isBackToTop.name: isBackToTop
isBackToTop.description: Whether this is a navigation to the root page, triggered by "backToTop()".

isBackToPage.name: isBackToPage
isBackToPage.description: Whether this was a navigation to a specific page, triggered by "backToPage()".

direction.name: direction
direction.description: How the navigation was triggered, possible values are "to", "back", "backToPage", and "backToTop".

events.name: afterNavigate
events.description: The event is fired when navigation between two pages has completed. In case of animated transitions this event is fired with some delay after the "navigate" event.

from.description: The page which had been shown before navigation.

events.description:
The event is fired when navigation between two pages has been triggered. The transition (if any) to the new page has not started yet.
This event can be aborted by the application with preventDefault(), which means that there will be no navigation.

methods.name: addCustomTransition

parameters.name: sName
parameters.description:
The name of the transition. This name can be used by the application to choose this transition when navigating "to()" or "back()": the "transitionName" parameter of "NavContainer.to()" corresponds to this name, the back() navigation will automatically use the same transition.

        Make sure to only use names that will not collide with transitions which may be added to the NavContainer later. A suggestion is to use the prefix "c_" or "_" for your custom transitions to ensure this.

parameters.name: oTo
parameters.description:
The function which will be called by the NavContainer when the application navigates "to()", using this animation's name. The NavContainer instance is the "this" context within the animation function.

        See the documentation of NavContainer.addCustomTransitions for more details about this function.

parameters.name: oBack
parameters.description:
The function which will be called by the NavContainer when the application navigates "back()" from a page where it had navigated to using this animation's name. The NavContainer instance is the "this" context within the animation function.

        See the documentation of NavContainer.addCustomTransitions for more details about this function.

methods.description:
Adds a custom transition to the NavContainer type (not to a particular instance!). The transition is identified by a "name". Make sure to only use names that will not collide with transitions which may be added to the NavContainer later. A suggestion is to use the prefix "c_" or "_" for your custom transitions to ensure this.

"to" and "back" are the transition functions for the forward and backward navigation.
Both will be called with the following parameters:
- oFromPage: the Control which is currently being displayed by the NavContainer
- oToPage: the Control which should be displayed by the NavContainer after the transition
- fCallback: a function which MUST be called when the transition has completed
- oTransitionParameters: a data object that can be given by application code when triggering the transition by calling to() or back(); this object could give additional information to the transition function, like the DOM element which triggered the transition or the desired transition duration

The contract for "to" and "back" is that they may do an animation of their choice, but it should not take "too long". At the beginning of the transition the target page "oToPage" does have the CSS class "sapMNavItemHidden" which initially hides the target page (visibility:hidden). The transition can do any preparation (e.g. move that page out of the screen or make it transparent) and then should remove this CSS class.
After the animation the target page "oToPage" should cover the entire screen and the source page "oFromPage" should not be visible anymore. This page should then have the CSS class "sapMNavItemHidden".
For adding/removing this or other CSS classes, the transition can use the addStyleClass/removeStyleClass method:
oFromPage.addStyleClass("sapMNavItemHidden");
When the transition is complete, it MUST call the given fCallback method to inform the NavContainer that navigation has finished!

Hint: if the target page of your transition stays black on iPhone, try wrapping the animation start into a
setTimeout(..., 0)
block (delayed, but without waiting).

This method can be called on any NavContainer instance or statically on the sap.m.NavContainer type. However, the transition will always be registered for the type (and ALL instances), not for the single instance on which this method was invoked.

Returns the sap.m.NavContainer type if called statically, or "this" (to allow method chaining) if called on a particular NavContainer instance.

parameters.name: oData

parameters.name: fnFunction

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.NavContainer itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the navigate event of this sap.m.NavContainer. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.NavContainer itself. The event is fired when navigation between two pages has been triggered. The transition (if any) to the new page has not started yet. This event can be aborted by the application with preventDefault(), which means that there will be no navigation.

methods.name: back

parameters.name: oBackData
parameters.description:
Since version 1.7.1. This optional object can carry any payload data which should be made available to the target page of the back navigation. The event on the target page will contain this data object as "backData" property. (The original data from the "to()" navigation will still be available as "data" property.)

        In scenarios where the entity triggering the navigation can or should not directly initialize the target page, it can fill this object and the target page itself (or a listener on it) can take over the initialization, using the given data.
        For back navigation this can be used e.g. when returning from a detail page to transfer any settings done there.

        When the "transitionParameters" object is used, this "data" object must also be given (either as object or as null) in order to have a proper parameter order.

parameters.name: oTransitionParameters
parameters.description:
Since version 1.7.1. This optional object can give additional information to the transition function, like the DOM element which triggered the transition or the desired transition duration.
        The animation type can NOT be selected here - it is always the inverse of the "to" navigation.

        In order to use the "transitionParameters" property, the "data" property must be used (at least "null" must be given) for a proper parameter order.

        NOTE: it depends on the transition function how the object should be structured and which parameters are actually used to influence the transition.

methods.description:
Navigates back one level. If already on the initial page and there is no place to go back, nothing happens.

Calling this navigation method triggers first the (cancelable) "navigate" event on the NavContainer, then the "beforeHide" pseudo event on the source page and "beforeFirstShow" (if applicable) and"beforeShow" on the target page. Later - after the transition has completed - the "afterShow" pseudo event is triggered on the target page and "afterHide" on the page which has been left. The given backData object is available in the "beforeFirstShow", "beforeShow" and "afterShow" event object as "data" property. The original "data" object from the "to" navigation is also available in these event objects.

methods.name: backToPage

parameters.name: sPageId
parameters.description: The ID of the screen to which back navigation should happen. The ID or the control itself can be given. The nearest such page among the previous pages in the history stack will be used.

parameters.name: oBackData
parameters.description:
This optional object can carry any payload data which should be made available to the target page of the "backToPage" navigation. The event on the target page will contain this data object as "backData" property.

        When the "transitionParameters" object is used, this "data" object must also be given (either as object or as null) in order to have a proper parameter order.

parameters.name: oTransitionParameters
parameters.description:
This optional object can give additional information to the transition function, like the DOM element which triggered the transition or the desired transition duration.
        The animation type can NOT be selected here - it is always the inverse of the "to" navigation.

        In order to use the "transitionParameters" property, the "data" property must be used (at least "null" must be given) for a proper parameter order.

        NOTE: it depends on the transition function how the object should be structured and which parameters are actually used to influence the transition.

methods.description:
Navigates back to the nearest previous page in the NavContainer history with the given ID. If there is no such page among the previous pages, nothing happens.
The transition effect which had been used to get to the current page is inverted and used for this navigation.

Calling this navigation method triggers first the (cancelable) "navigate" event on the NavContainer, then the "beforeHide" pseudo event on the source page and "beforeFirstShow" (if applicable) and"beforeShow" on the target page. Later - after the transition has completed - the "afterShow" pseudo event is triggered on the target page and "afterHide" on the page which has been left. The given backData object is available in the "beforeFirstShow", "beforeShow" and "afterShow" event object as "data" property. The original "data" object from the "to" navigation is also available in these event objects.

methods.name: backToTop

parameters.name: oBackData
parameters.description:
This optional object can carry any payload data which should be made available to the target page of the "backToTop" navigation. The event on the target page will contain this data object as "backData" property.

        When the "transitionParameters" object is used, this "data" object must also be given (either as object or as null) in order to have a proper parameter order.

parameters.name: oTransitionParameters
parameters.description:
This optional object can give additional information to the transition function, like the DOM element which triggered the transition or the desired transition duration.
        The animation type can NOT be selected here - it is always the inverse of the "to" navigation.

        In order to use the "transitionParameters" property, the "data" property must be used (at least "null" must be given) for a proper parameter order.

        NOTE: it depends on the transition function how the object should be structured and which parameters are actually used to influence the transition.

methods.description:
Navigates back to the initial/top level (this is the element aggregated as "initialPage", or the first added element). If already on the initial page, nothing happens.
The transition effect which had been used to get to the current page is inverted and used for this navigation.

Calling this navigation method triggers first the (cancelable) "navigate" event on the NavContainer, then the "beforeHide" pseudo event on the source page and "beforeFirstShow" (if applicable) and"beforeShow" on the target page. Later - after the transition has completed - the "afterShow" pseudo event is triggered on the target page and "afterHide" on the page which has been left. The given backData object is available in the "beforeFirstShow", "beforeShow" and "afterShow" event object as "data" property.

methods.name: currentPageIsTopPage
methods.description:
Returns whether the current page is the top/initial page.

Note: going to the initial page again with a row of "to" navigations causes the initial page to be displayed again, but logically one is not at the top level, so this method returns "false" in this case.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event afterNavigate to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • from of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe page which had been shown before navigation.
  • fromId of type stringThe ID of the page which had been shown before navigation.
  • to of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe page which is now shown after navigation.
  • toId of type stringThe ID of the page which is now shown after navigation.
  • firstTime of type booleanWhether the "to" page (more precisely: a control with the ID of the page which has been navigated to) had not been shown/navigated to before.
  • isTo of type booleanWhether was a forward navigation, triggered by "to()".
  • isBack of type booleanWhether this was a back navigation, triggered by "back()".
  • isBackToTop of type booleanWhether this was a navigation to the root page, triggered by "backToTop()".
  • isBackToPage of type booleanWhether this was a navigation to a specific page, triggered by "backToPage()".
  • direction of type stringHow the navigation was triggered, possible values are "to", "back", "backToPage", and "backToTop".

methods.name: fireNavigate

returnValue.description: Whether or not to prevent the default action

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event navigate to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • from of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe page which was shown before the current navigation.
  • fromId of type stringThe ID of the page which was shown before the current navigation.
  • to of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe page which will be shown after the current navigation.
  • toId of type stringThe ID of the page which will be shown after the current navigation.
  • firstTime of type booleanWhether the "to" page (more precisely: a control with the ID of the page which is currently navigated to) has not been shown/navigated to before.
  • isTo of type booleanWhether this is a forward navigation, triggered by "to()".
  • isBack of type booleanWhether this is a back navigation, triggered by "back()".
  • isBackToTop of type booleanWhether this is a navigation to the root page, triggered by "backToTop()".
  • isBackToPage of type booleanWhether this was a navigation to a specific page, triggered by "backToPage()".
  • direction of type stringHow the navigation was triggered, possible values are "to", "back", "backToPage", and "backToTop".

methods.name: getAutoFocus

returnValue.description: Value of property autoFocus

methods.description: Gets current value of property autoFocus. Determines whether the initial focus is set automatically on first rendering and after navigating to a new page. This is useful when on touch devices the keyboard pops out due to the focus being automatically set on an input field. If necessary the "afterShow" event can be used to focus another element. Default value is true.

Returns undefined if no page has been added yet.

        This parameter can be omitted; then the default is "slide" (horizontal movement from the right).

methods.description:
Inserts the page/control with the specified ID into the navigation history stack of the NavContainer.

This can be used for deep-linking when the user directly reached a drilldown detail page using a bookmark and then wants to navigate up in the drilldown hierarchy. Normally such a back navigation would not be possible because there is no previous page in the NavContainer's history stack.

methods.name: to

parameters.name: sPageId
parameters.description: The screen to which drilldown should happen. The ID or the control itself can be given.

parameters.name: sTransitionName
parameters.description:
The type of the transition/animation to apply. This parameter can be omitted; then the default is "slide" (horizontal movement from the right).
        Other options are: "fade", "flip", and "show" and the names of any registered custom transitions.

        None of the standard transitions is currently making use of any given transition parameters.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description:
Since version 1.7.1. This optional object can carry any payload data which should be made available to the target page. The "beforeShow" event on the target page will contain this data object as "data" property.

        Use case: in scenarios where the entity triggering the navigation can or should not directly initialize the target page, it can fill this object and the target page itself (or a listener on it) can take over the initialization, using the given data.

        When the "transitionParameters" object is used, this "data" object must also be given (either as object or as null) in order to have a proper parameter order.

parameters.name: oTransitionParameters
parameters.description:
Since version 1.7.1. This optional object can contain additional information for the transition function, like the DOM element which triggered the transition or the desired transition duration.

        For a proper parameter order, the "data" parameter must be given when the "transitionParameters" parameter is used. (it can be given as "null")

        NOTE: it depends on the transition function how the object should be structured and which parameters are actually used to influence the transition.
        The "show", "slide" and "fade" transitions do not use any parameter.

methods.description:
Navigates to the next page (with drill-down semantic) with the given (or default) animation. This creates a new history item inside the NavContainer and allows going back.

Note that any modifications to the target page (like setting its title, or anything else that could cause a re-rendering) should be done BEFORE calling to(), in order to avoid unwanted side effects, e.g. related to the page animation.

Available transitions currently include "slide" (default), "fade", "flip", and "show". None of these is currently making use of any given transitionParameters.

Calling this navigation method triggers first the (cancelable) "navigate" event on the NavContainer, then the "beforeHide" pseudo event on the source page and "beforeFirstShow" (if applicable) and"beforeShow" on the target page. Later - after the transition has completed - the "afterShow" pseudo event is triggered on the target page and "afterHide" on the page which has been left. The given data object is available in the "beforeFirstShow", "beforeShow" and "afterShow" event object as "data" property.

symbols.name: sap.m.NavContainerChild

events.name: AfterHide
events.description:
This event is fired every time when the NavContainer has made this child control invisible. In case of animated transitions this
event is fired after the transition finishes. This control is now no longer being displayed and not animated anymore.

events.name: AfterShow
events.description:
This event is fired every time when the NavContainer has made this child control visible. In case of animated transitions this
event is fired after the transition finishes. This control is now being displayed and not animated anymore.

events.name: BeforeFirstShow
events.description: This event is fired before the NavContainer shows this child control for the first time.

events.name: BeforeHide
events.description:
This event is fired every time before the NavContainer hides this child control. In case of animated transitions this
event is fired before the transition starts.

events.name: BeforeShow
events.description:
This event is fired every time before the NavContainer shows this child control. In case of animated transitions this
event is fired before the transition starts.

symbols.name: sap.m.NumericContent
symbols.description: Shows numeric values used for example in tiles colored according to their meaning and displays deviations.

properties.name: animateTextChange
properties.description: If set to true, the change of the value will be animated.

properties.name: formatterValue
properties.description: If set to true, the value parameter contains a numeric value and scale. If set to false (default), the value parameter contains a numeric value only.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the control. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font.

properties.name: iconDescription
properties.description: Description of an icon that is used in the tooltip.

properties.name: indicator
properties.description: The indicator arrow that shows value deviation.

properties.name: nullifyValue
properties.description: If set to true, the omitted value property is set to 0.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: The scaling prefix. Financial characters can be used for currencies and counters. The SI prefixes can be used for units. If the scaling prefix contains more than three characters, only the first three characters are displayed.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Updates the size of the control. If not set then the default size is applied based on the device tile.

deprecated.text: The NumericContent control has now a fixed size, depending on the used media (desktop, tablet or phone).

properties.name: truncateValueTo
properties.description: The number of characters to display for the value property.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The actual value.

properties.name: valueColor
properties.description: The semantic color of the value.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the control. If it is not set, the size of the control is defined by the 'size' property.

properties.name: withMargin
properties.description: If the value is set to false, the content will fit to the whole size of the control.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Indicates the load status.

events.description: The event is fired when the user chooses the numeric content.

symbols.name: sap.m.ObjectAttribute
symbols.description: The ObjectAttribute control displays a text field that can be normal or active. The ObjectAttribute fires a press event when the user selects active text.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Defines the ObjectAttribute title.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the ObjectAttribute text.

properties.name: active
properties.description: Indicates if the ObjectAttribute text is selectable for the user.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description:
Determines the direction of the text, not including the title.
Available options for the text direction are LTR (left-to-right) and RTL (right-to-left). By default the control inherits the text direction from its parent control.

aggregations.name: customContent
aggregations.description: When the aggregation is set, it replaces the text, active and textDirection properties. This also ignores the press event. The provided control is displayed as an active link. Note: It will only allow sap.m.Text and sap.m.Link controls.
