symbols.name: sap.m.ObjectHeader
symbols.description: ObjectHeader is a display control that enables the user to easily identify a specific object. The object header title is the key identifier of the object and additional text and icons can be used to further distinguish it from other objects.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Determines the title of the ObjectHeader.

properties.name: number
properties.description: Determines the displayed number of the ObjectHeader number field.

properties.name: numberUnit
properties.description: Determines the units qualifier of the ObjectHeader number. Note: The value of the numberUnit is not displayed if the number property is set to null.

properties.name: intro
properties.description: Determines the introductory text for the ObjectHeader.

properties.name: introActive
properties.description: Determines whether the introductory text of the ObjectHeader is clickable.

properties.name: titleActive
properties.description: Determines whether the title of the ObjectHeader is clickable and is set only if a title is provided.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Defines the icon of the ObjectHeader. Note: Recursive resolution of binding expressions is not supported by the framework. It works only in ObjectHeader, since it is a composite control and creates an Image control internally.

properties.name: iconActive
properties.description: Determines whether the ObjectHeader icon is clickable.

properties.name: iconAlt
properties.description: Determines the alternative text of the ObjectHeader icon. The text is displayed if the image for the icon is not available, or cannot be displayed.

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description: By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server. If bandwidth is the key for the application, set this value to false.

properties.name: markFavorite
properties.description: Sets the favorite state for the ObjectHeader. The showMarkers property must be set to true for this property to take effect. Note: As this property is deprecated, we recommend that you use the markers aggregation - add sap.m.ObjectMarker with type sap.m.ObjectMarkerType.Favorite. You should use either this property or the markers aggregation, using both may lead to unpredicted behavior.

properties.name: markFlagged
properties.description: Sets the flagged state for the ObjectHeader. The showMarkers property must be set to true for this property to take effect. Note: As this property is deprecated, we recommend that you use the markers aggregation - add sap.m.ObjectMarker with type sap.m.ObjectMarkerType.Flagged. You should use either this property or the markers aggregation, using both may lead to unpredicted behavior.

properties.name: showMarkers
properties.description: If set to true, the ObjectHeader can be marked with icons such as favorite and flag. Note: This property is valid only if you are using the already deprecated properties - markFlagged and markFavorite. If you are using the markers aggregation, the visibility of the markers depends on what is set in the aggregation itself.

properties.name: showTitleSelector
properties.description: Determines whether the selector arrow icon/image is displayed and can be pressed.

properties.name: numberState
properties.description: Determines the value state of the <code>number<code> and <code>numberUnit<code> properties.

properties.name: condensed
properties.description: ObjectHeader with title, one attribute, number, and number unit. Note: Only applied if the responsive property is set to false.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description:
Determines the background color of the ObjectHeader. Note: The different types of ObjectHeader come with different default background:
  • non responsive - Transparent
  • responsive - Translucent
  • condensed - Solid

properties.name: responsive
properties.description: Determines whether the ObjectHeader is rendered with a different design that reacts responsively to the screen sizes. Note: Be aware that the design and behavior of the responsive ObjectHeader could change without further notification.

properties.name: fullScreenOptimized
properties.description:
Optimizes the display of the elements of the ObjectHeader. Set this property to true if your app uses a fullscreen layout (as opposed to a master-detail or other split-screen layout). Note: Only applied if the responsive property is also set to true. If set to true, the following situations apply:
  • On desktop, 1-3 attributes/statuses - positioned as a third block on the right side of the Title/Number group
  • On desktop, 4+ attributes/statuses - 4 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (portrait mode), always in 2 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (landscape mode), 1-2 attributes/statuses - 2 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (landscape mode), 3+ attributes/statuses - 3 columns below the Title/Number
On phone, the attributes and statuses are always positioned in 1 column below the Title/Number of the ObjectHeader. If set to false, the attributes and statuses are being positioned below the Title/Number of the ObjectHeader in 2 or 3 columns depending on their number:
  • On desktop, 1-4 attributes/statuses - 2 columns
  • On desktop, 5+ attributes/statuses - 3 columns
  • On tablet, always in 2 columns

properties.name: titleHref
properties.description: Defines the title link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. Note: If an action should be triggered, this property should not be set, but instead an event handler for the titlePress event should be registered.

properties.name: titleTarget
properties.description: Determines the target attribute for the title link. Options are _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered.

properties.name: introHref
properties.description: Determines the intro link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If an action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the introPress event should be registered.

properties.name: introTarget
properties.description: Determines the target attribute for the intro link. Options are _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered.

properties.name: titleTextDirection
properties.description: Specifies the title text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

properties.name: introTextDirection
properties.description: Specifies the intro text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

properties.name: numberTextDirection
properties.description: Specifies the number and unit text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

properties.name: titleSelectorTooltip
properties.description: Determines a custom text for the tooltip of the select title arrow. If not set, a default text of the tooltip will be displayed.

properties.name: titleLevel
properties.description:
Defines the semantic level of the title.

This information is used by assistive technologies, such as screen readers to create a hierarchical site map for faster navigation.
Depending on this setting an HTML h1-h6 element is used.

aggregations.name: attributes
aggregations.description: The list of Object Attributes

aggregations.name: firstStatus
aggregations.description:
First status shown on the right side of the attributes above the second status.
If it is not set the first attribute will expand to take the entire row.

deprecated.text: Use the statuses aggregation instead.

aggregations.name: secondStatus
aggregations.description:
Second status shown on the right side of the attributes below the first status.
If it is not set the second attribute will expand to take the entire row.

deprecated.text: Use the statuses aggregation instead.

aggregations.name: statuses
aggregations.description: The list of Object sap.ui.core.Control. It will only allow sap.m.ObjectStatus and sap.m.ProgressIndicator controls.

aggregations.name: _objectNumber
aggregations.description: The object number and unit are managed in this aggregation

aggregations.name: additionalNumbers
aggregations.description:
NOTE: Only applied if you set "responsive=false".
Additional object numbers and units are managed in this aggregation.
The numbers are hidden on tablet and phone size screens.
When only one number is provided, it is rendered with additional separator from the main ObjectHeader number.

aggregations.name: headerContainer
aggregations.description:
This aggregation takes only effect when you set "responsive" to true.
It can either be filled with an sap.m.IconTabBar or a sap.suite.ui.commons.HeaderContainer control. Overflow handling must be taken care of by the inner control. If used with an IconTabBar control, only the header will be displayed inside the object header, the content will be displayed below the ObjectHeader.

aggregations.name: markers
aggregations.description:
List of markers (icon and/or text) that can be displayed for the ObjectHeader, such as favorite and flagged.

Note: You should use either this aggregation or the already deprecated properties - markFlagged and markFavorite. Using both can lead to unexpected results.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

Gets current value of property fullScreenOptimized. Optimizes the display of the elements of the ObjectHeader. Set this property to true if your app uses a fullscreen layout (as opposed to a master-detail or other split-screen layout). Note: Only applied if the responsive property is also set to true. If set to true, the following situations apply:
  • On desktop, 1-3 attributes/statuses - positioned as a third block on the right side of the Title/Number group
  • On desktop, 4+ attributes/statuses - 4 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (portrait mode), always in 2 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (landscape mode), 1-2 attributes/statuses - 2 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (landscape mode), 3+ attributes/statuses - 3 columns below the Title/Number
On phone, the attributes and statuses are always positioned in 1 column below the Title/Number of the ObjectHeader. If set to false, the attributes and statuses are being positioned below the Title/Number of the ObjectHeader in 2 or 3 columns depending on their number:
  • On desktop, 1-4 attributes/statuses - 2 columns
  • On desktop, 5+ attributes/statuses - 3 columns
  • On tablet, always in 2 columns
Default value is false.

You should use either this property or the markers aggregation, using both may lead to unpredicted behavior. Default value is false.

methods.description: Gets current value of property numberUnit. Determines the units qualifier of the ObjectHeader number. Note: The value of the numberUnit is not displayed if the number property is set to null.

returnValue.description: Value of property responsive

methods.description: Gets current value of property responsive. Determines whether the ObjectHeader is rendered with a different design that reacts responsively to the screen sizes. Note: Be aware that the design and behavior of the responsive ObjectHeader could change without further notification. Default value is false.

methods.description: Gets content of aggregation secondStatus. Second status shown on the right side of the attributes below the first status. If it is not set the second attribute will expand to take the entire row.

deprecated.text: Use the statuses aggregation instead.

methods.name: getShowMarkers

returnValue.description: Value of property showMarkers

methods.description: Gets current value of property showMarkers. If set to true, the ObjectHeader can be marked with icons such as favorite and flag. Note: This property is valid only if you are using the already deprecated properties - markFlagged and markFavorite. If you are using the markers aggregation, the visibility of the markers depends on what is set in the aggregation itself. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowTitleSelector

methods.description: Gets current value of property showTitleSelector. Determines whether the selector arrow icon/image is displayed and can be pressed. Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Value of property titleLevel

methods.description: Gets current value of property titleLevel. Defines the semantic level of the title. Default value is H1.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property backgroundDesign. Determines the background color of the ObjectHeader. Note: The different types of ObjectHeader come with different default background:
  • non responsive - Transparent
  • responsive - Translucent
  • condensed - Solid
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setFullScreenOptimized

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bFullScreenOptimized
parameters.description: New value for property fullScreenOptimized

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property fullScreenOptimized. Optimizes the display of the elements of the ObjectHeader. Set this property to true if your app uses a fullscreen layout (as opposed to a master-detail or other split-screen layout). Note: Only applied if the responsive property is also set to true. If set to true, the following situations apply:
  • On desktop, 1-3 attributes/statuses - positioned as a third block on the right side of the Title/Number group
  • On desktop, 4+ attributes/statuses - 4 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (portrait mode), always in 2 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (landscape mode), 1-2 attributes/statuses - 2 columns below the Title/Number
  • On tablet (landscape mode), 3+ attributes/statuses - 3 columns below the Title/Number
On phone, the attributes and statuses are always positioned in 1 column below the Title/Number of the ObjectHeader. If set to false, the attributes and statuses are being positioned below the Title/Number of the ObjectHeader in 2 or 3 columns depending on their number:
  • On desktop, 1-4 attributes/statuses - 2 columns
  • On desktop, 5+ attributes/statuses - 3 columns
  • On tablet, always in 2 columns
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.m.ObjectHeaderContainer
symbols.description: Marker interface for controls which are suitable as items for the ObjectHeader.

symbols.name: sap.m.ObjectIdentifier
symbols.description: The ObjectIdentifier is a display control that enables the user to easily identify a specific object. The ObjectIdentifier title is the key identifier of the object and additional text and icons can be used to further distinguish it from other objects.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Defines the object title.

properties.name: titleActive
properties.description: Indicates if the ObjectIdentifier's title is clickable.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

symbols.name: sap.m.ObjectListItem
symbols.description: ObjectListItem is a display control that provides summary information about an object as a list item. The ObjectListItem title is the key identifier of the object. Additional text and icons can be used to further distinguish it from other objects. Attributes and statuses can be used to provide additional meaning about the object to the user.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Defines the ObjectListItem title.

properties.name: number
properties.description: Defines the ObjectListItem number.

properties.name: numberUnit
properties.description: Defines the number units qualifier of the ObjectListItem.

properties.name: intro
properties.description: Defines the introductory text for the ObjectListItem.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: ObjectListItem icon displayed to the left of the title.

properties.name: activeIcon
properties.description: Icon displayed when the ObjectListItem is active.

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description:
By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image (in case this version of image dоesn't exist on the server).

If bandwidth is key for the application, set this value to false.

properties.name: markFavorite
properties.description:
Sets the favorite state for the ObjectListItem.

Note: As this property is deprecated, we recommend you use the markers aggregation - add sap.m.ObjectMarker with type sap.m.ObjectMarkerType.Favorite. You should use either this property or the markers aggregation, using both may lead to unpredicted behavior.

properties.name: markFlagged
properties.description:
Sets the flagged state for the ObjectListItem.

Note: As this property is deprecated, we recommend you use the markers aggregation - add sap.m.ObjectMarker with type sap.m.ObjectMarkerType.Flagged. You should use either this property or the markers aggregation, using both may lead to unpredicted behavior.

properties.name: showMarkers
properties.description:
If set to true, the ObjectListItem can be marked with icons such as favorite and flag.

Note: This property is valid only if you are using the already deprecated properties - markFlagged, markFavorite, and markLocked. If you are using the markers aggregation, the visibility of the markers depends on what is set in the aggregation itself.

properties.name: numberState
properties.description: Defines the ObjectListItem number and numberUnit value state.

properties.name: titleTextDirection
properties.description:
Determines the text direction of the item title.
Available options for the title direction are LTR (left-to-right) and RTL (right-to-left).
By default the item title inherits the text direction from its parent.

properties.name: introTextDirection
properties.description:
Determines the text direction of the item intro.
Available options for the intro direction are LTR (left-to-right) and RTL (right-to-left).
By default the item intro inherits the text direction from its parent.

properties.name: numberTextDirection
properties.description:
Determines the text direction of the item number.
Available options for the number direction are LTR (left-to-right) and RTL (right-to-left).
By default the item number inherits the text direction from its parent.

properties.name: markLocked
properties.description:
Sets the locked state of the ObjectListItem.

Note: As this property is deprecated, we recommend you use the markers aggregation - add sap.m.ObjectMarker with type sap.m.ObjectMarkerType.Locked. You should use either this property or the markers aggregation, using both may lead to unpredicted behavior.

aggregations.name: attributes
aggregations.description: List of attributes displayed below the title to the left of the status fields.

aggregations.name: firstStatus
aggregations.description: First status text field displayed on the right side of the attributes.

aggregations.name: secondStatus
aggregations.description: Second status text field displayed on the right side of the attributes.

aggregations.name: markers
aggregations.description:
List of markers (icon and/or text) that can be displayed for the ObjectListItems, such as favorite and flagged.

Note: You should use either this aggregation or the already deprecated properties - markFlagged, markFavorite, and markLocked. Using both can lead to unexpected results.

symbols.name: sap.m.ObjectMarker
symbols.description:
The sap.m.ObjectMarker control represents one of the following predefined types:
  • Flagged
  • Favorite
  • Draft
  • Locked
  • LockedBy
  • Unsaved
  • UnsavedBy
Note: Use the LockedBy/UnsavedBy type along with the additionalInfo property to display the name of the user who locked/changed the object. If additionalInfo property is not set when using LockedBy/UnsavedBy types, the string "Locked by another user"/"Unsaved changes by another user" will be displayed. If you don't want to display name of the user, simply use the Locked/Unsaved types.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Sets one of the predefined types. Note: If the visibility property is not specified explicitly, every type comes with predefined one as follows:
  • For Flagged and Favorite the icon is visible and the text is not displayed
  • For Draft the text is visible and the icon is not displayed
  • For Locked, LockedBy, Unsaved and UnsavedBy - on screens larger than 600px both icon and text are visible, otherwise only the icon

properties.name: visibility
properties.description:
Sets one of the visibility states. Visibility states are as follows:
  • IconOnly - displays only icon, regardless of the screen size
  • TextOnly - displays only text, regardless of the screen size
  • IconAndText - displays both icon and text, regardless of the screen size

properties.name: additionalInfo
properties.description: Sets additional information to the displayed type. Note: If no type is set, the additional information will not be displayed.

aggregations.name: _innerControl
aggregations.description: Internal control that should be sap.m.Link for interactive and sap.m.Text for non-interactive ObjectMarker.

  • For Locked, LockedBy, Unsaved and UnsavedBy - on screens larger than 600px both icon and text are visible, otherwise only the icon

symbols.name: sap.m.ObjectNumber
symbols.description:
The ObjectNumber control displays number and number unit properties for an object. The number can be displayed using semantic
colors to provide additional meaning about the object to the user.

properties.name: number
properties.description: Defines the number field.

properties.name: numberUnit
properties.description: Defines the number units qualifier.

deprecated.text: Replaced by unit property due to the number before unit is redundant.

properties.name: emphasized
properties.description: Indicates if the object number should appear emphasized.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Determines the object number's value state. Setting this state will cause the number to be rendered in state-specific colors (only blue-crystal theme).

properties.name: unit
properties.description: Defines the number units qualifier. If numberUnit and unit are both set, the unit value is used.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Available options for the number and unit text direction are LTR(left-to-right) and RTL(right-to-left). By default, the control inherits the text direction from its parent control.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the number and unit.

properties.description:
By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server.

If bandwidth is key for the application, set this value to false.

symbols.name: sap.m.OverflowToolbar
symbols.description:
The OverflowToolbar control is a container based on sap.m.Toolbar, that provides overflow when its content does not fit in the visible area.

Note: It is recommended that you use OverflowToolbar over {@link sap.m.Toolbar}, unless you want to avoid overflow in favor of shrinking.

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: closeOverflow
methods.description:
Closes the overflow area.
Useful to manually close the overflow after having suppressed automatic closing with "closeOverflowOnInteraction=false".

symbols.description: Holds layout data for the OverflowToolbar items.

properties.name: moveToOverflow
properties.description: The OverflowToolbar item can or cannot move to the overflow area

properties.name: stayInOverflow
properties.description: The OverflowToolbar item can or cannot stay in the overflow area

properties.name: priority
properties.description: Defines OverflowToolbar items priority, Available priorities ate NeverOverflow, High, Low, Disappear and AlwaysOverflow

properties.name: group
properties.description:
Defines OverflowToolbar items group number.
Default value is 0, which means that the control does not belong to any group.
Elements that belong to a group overflow together. The overall priority of the group is defined by the element with highest priority.
Elements that belong to a group are not allowed to have AlwaysOverflow or NeverOverflow priority.

properties.name: closeOverflowOnInteraction
properties.description: Defines whether the overflow area is automatically closed when interacting with a control in it

symbols.name: sap.m.OverflowToolbarPriority
symbols.description: Defines the priorities of the controls within sap.m.OverflowToolbar

properties.name: AlwaysOverflow
properties.description: AlwaysOverflow priority forces OverflowToolbar items to remain always in the overflow area

properties.name: Disappear
properties.description: Disappear priority  OverflowToolbar items overflow before the items with higher priority such as Low and High priority items and remain hidden in the overflow area

properties.name: High
properties.description: High priority OverflowToolbar items overflow after the items with lower priority

properties.name: Low
properties.description: Low priority  OverflowToolbar items overflow before the items with higher priority such as High priority items

properties.name: NeverOverflow
properties.description: NeverOverflow priority forces OverflowToolbar items to remain always in the toolbar

methods.name: setVisibleItemsThreshold

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iVisibleItemsThreshold
parameters.description: New value for property visibleItemsThreshold

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property visibleItemsThreshold. Specifies a threshold of visible items. If the end user makes a lot of columns visible, this might cause performance to slow down. When this happens, the user can receive a corresponding warning triggered by the visibleItemsThreshold property. The property needs to be activated and set to the required value by the consuming application to ensure that the warning message is shown when the threshold has been exceeded. In the following example the message will be shown if more than 100 visible columns are selected: 
customData>
core:CustomData key="p13nDialogSettings"
value='\{"columns":\{"visible": true, "payload": \{"visibleItemsThreshold": 3\}\}\}' />
/customData>
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is -1.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description: defines the max number of conditions on the ConditionPanel

properties.description:
defines if the mediaQuery or a ContainerResize will be used for layout update. When the P13nConditionPanel is used on a dialog the
property should be set to true!

properties.name: autoAddNewRow
properties.description: adds initial a new empty condition row

properties.name: disableFirstRemoveIcon
properties.description: makes the remove icon on the first condition row disabled when only one condition exist.

properties.name: alwaysShowAddIcon
properties.description:
makes the Add icon visible on each condition row. If is set to false the Add is only visible at the end and you can only append a
new condition.

properties.name: usePrevConditionSetting
properties.description: new added condition use the settings from the previous condition as default.

properties.name: autoReduceKeyFieldItems
properties.description:
KeyField value can only be selected once. When you set the property to true the ConditionPanel will automatically offers on the
KeyField drop down only the keyFields which are not used. The default behavior is that in each keyField dropdown all keyfields are
listed.

properties.name: layoutMode
properties.description:
can be used to control the layout behavior. Default is "" which will automatically change the layout. With "Desktop", "Table"
or"Phone" you can set a fixed layout.

properties.name: showLabel
properties.description: show additional labels in the condition

properties.name: displayFormat
properties.description:
This represents the displayFormat of the condition Values. With the value "UpperCase" the entered value of the condition will be
converted to upperCase.

properties.name: validationExecutor
properties.description: Calls the validation listener tbd...

symbols.name: sap.m.P13nDialog
symbols.description:
The P13nDialog control provides a dialog that contains one or more panels. On each of the panels, one or more changes with regards to a
       table can be processed. For example, a panel to set a column to invisible, change the order of the columns or a panel to sort or filter
       tables.

properties.name: initialVisiblePanelType
properties.description: This property determines which panel is initially shown when dialog is opened. Due to extensibility reason the type should be string. So it is feasible to add a custom panel without expanding the type.

properties.name: showReset
properties.description: This property determines whether the 'Restore' button is shown inside the dialog. If this property is set to true, clicking the 'Reset' button will trigger the reset event sending a notification that model data must be reset.

properties.name: showResetEnabled
properties.description: This property determines whether the 'Restore' button is enabled and is taken into account only if showReset is set to true.

properties.name: validationExecutor
properties.description:
Calls the validation listener once all panel-relevant validation checks have been done. This callback function is called in order
to perform cross-model validation checks.

aggregations.name: panels
aggregations.description: The dialog panels displayed in the dialog.

or"Phone" you can set a fixed layout.

symbols.name: sap.m.P13nGroupPanel
symbols.description: The P13nGroupPanel control is used to define group-specific settings for table personalization.

properties.name: maxGroups
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of groups.

properties.name: containerQuery
properties.description: Defines if mediaQuery or ContainerResize is used for a layout update. If ConditionPanel is used in a dialog, the property must be set to true.

properties.name: layoutMode
properties.description:
Can be used to control the layout behavior. Default is "" which will automatically change the layout. With "Desktop", "Table"
or"Phone" you can set a fixed layout.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Contains content for include and exclude panels.

aggregations.name: groupItems
aggregations.description: Defined group items.

methods.name: getContainerQuery

methods.description: Gets content of aggregation groupItems. Defined group items.

methods.name: getLayoutMode

returnValue.description: Value of property layoutMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property layoutMode. Can be used to control the layout behavior. Default is "" which will automatically change the layout. With "Desktop", "Table" or"Phone" you can set a fixed layout.

returnValue.description: Value of property maxGroups

methods.description: Gets current value of property maxGroups. Defines the maximum number of groups. Default value is -1.

parameters.description: The groupItem whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.m.P13nGroupItem in the aggregation groupItems. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertGroupItem

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oGroupItem
parameters.description: the groupItem to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: the 0-based index the groupItem should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the groupItem is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the groupItem is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a groupItem into the aggregation groupItems.

methods.name: removeAllGroupItems

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description: Removes all the controls from the aggregation groupItems. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

returnValue.description: The removed groupItem or null

parameters.name: vGroupItem
parameters.description: The groupItem to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a groupItem from the aggregation groupItems.

methods.name: removeInvalidConditions
methods.description: Removes all invalid group conditions.

methods.name: removeValidationErrors
methods.description: Removes all errors/warning states from of all group conditions.

methods.name: setContainerQuery

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bContainerQuery
parameters.description: New value for property containerQuery

methods.description: Sets a new value for property containerQuery. Defines if mediaQuery or ContainerResize is used for a layout update. If ConditionPanel is used in a dialog, the property must be set to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setLayoutMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sLayoutMode
parameters.description: New value for property layoutMode

methods.description: Sets a new value for property layoutMode. Can be used to control the layout behavior. Default is "" which will automatically change the layout. With "Desktop", "Table" or"Phone" you can set a fixed layout. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setMaxGroups

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sMaxGroups
parameters.description: New value for property maxGroups

methods.description: Sets a new value for property maxGroups. Defines the maximum number of groups. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is -1.

methods.name: setOperations

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: of operations [sap.m.P13nConditionOperation.BT, sap.m.P13nConditionOperation.EQ]

methods.description: Setter for the supported operations array.

methods.name: unbindGroupItems

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Unbinds aggregation groupItems from model data.

methods.name: validateConditions
methods.description:
Checks if the entered or modified conditions are correct, marks invalid fields yellow (Warning) and opens a popup message dialog to let the
user know that some values are not correct or missing.

symbols.name: sap.m.P13nItem
symbols.description: Base type for items aggregation in P13nPanel control.

properties.name: columnKey
properties.description: Can be used as input for subsequent actions.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text to be displayed for the item.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Defines visibility of column

properties.name: type
properties.description: data type of the column (text, numeric or date is supported)

properties.name: precision
properties.description: if type==numeric the precision will be used to format the entered value (maxIntegerDigits of the used Formatter)

properties.name: scale
properties.description: if type==numeric the scale will be used to format the entered value (maxFractionDigits of the used Formatter)

properties.name: maxLength
properties.description: specifies the number of characters which can be entered in the value fields of the condition panel

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines column width

properties.name: isDefault
properties.description: the column with isDefault==true will be used as the selected column item on the conditionPanel

properties.name: values
properties.description:
the array of values for type bool. e.g. ["", "Off", "On"]. The first entry can be empty (used to blank the value field). Next value
represent the false value, last entry the true value.

properties.name: role
properties.description: Defines role. The role is reflected in the manner how the dimension will influence the chart layout.

properties.name: aggregationRole
properties.description: Defines aggregation role

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.m.P13nPanel
symbols.description: Base type for panels aggregation in P13nDialog control.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title text appears in the panel.

properties.name: titleLarge
properties.description: Large title text appears e.g. in dialog header in case that only one panel is shown.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Panel type for generic use. Due to extensibility reason the type of type property should be string. So it is feasible to add a custom panel without expanding the type.

properties.name: verticalScrolling
properties.description: Enables the vertical Scrolling on the P13nDialog when the panel is shown.

properties.name: validationExecutor
properties.description: Callback method which is called in order to validate end user entry.

properties.name: validationListener
properties.description: Callback method which is called in order to register for validation result.

properties.name: changeNotifier
properties.description: Callback which notifies a change on this panel.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Aggregation of items

events.name: beforeNavigationTo
events.description: Due to performance the data of the panel can be requested in lazy mode e.g. when the panel is displayed

symbols.name: sap.m.Page
symbols.description: A container control that holds one whole screen of an application.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title text appearing in the page header bar.

properties.name: titleLevel
properties.description:
Defines the semantic level of the title. Using "Auto" no explicit level information is written.
Used for accessibility purposes only.

properties.name: showNavButton
properties.description: A nav button will be rendered on the left area of header bar if this property is set to true.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description:
Whether this page shall have a header.
If set to true, either the control under the "customHeader" aggregation is used, or if there is no such control, a Header control is constructed from the properties "title", "showNavButton", "navButtonText" and "icon" depending on the platform.

properties.name: showSubHeader
properties.description: Whether this page shall show the subheader.

properties.name: navButtonText
properties.description: The text of the nav button when running in iOS (if shown) in case it deviates from the default, which is "Back". This property is mvi-theme-dependent and will not have any effect in other themes.

deprecated.text: Deprecated since the MVI theme is removed now. This property only affected the NavButton in that theme.

properties.name: navButtonTooltip
properties.description:
The tooltip of the nav button

Since version 1.34

properties.name: enableScrolling
properties.description:
Enable vertical scrolling of page contents. Page headers and footers are fixed and do not scroll.
If set to false, there will be no scrolling at all.

The Page only allows vertical scrolling because horizontal scrolling is discouraged in general for full-page content. If it still needs to be achieved, disable the Page scrolling and use a ScrollContainer as full-page content of the Page. This allows you to freely configure scrolling. It can also be used to create horizontally-scrolling sub-areas of (vertically-scrolling) Pages.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: the icon that is rendered in the page header bar in non-iOS phone/tablet platforms. This property is theme-dependent and only has an effect in the MVI theme.

deprecated.text: Deprecated since the MVI theme is removed now. This property only affected the NavButton in that theme.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description: This property is used to set the background color of a page. When a list is placed inside a page, the value "List" should be used to display a gray background. "Standard", with the value white, is used as default if not specified.

properties.name: navButtonType
properties.description: This property is used to set the appearance of the NavButton. By default when showNavButton is set to true, a back button will be shown in iOS and an up button in other platforms. In case you want to show a normal button in the left header area, you can set the value to "Default".

deprecated.text: Deprecated since the MVI theme is removed now. This property is only usable with a Button text in that theme.

properties.name: showFooter
properties.description: Whether this page shall have a footer

properties.name: contentOnlyBusy
properties.description: Decides which area is covered by the local BusyIndicator when page.setBusy() is called. By default the entire page is covered, including headers and footer. When this property is set to "true", only the content area is covered (not header/sub header and footer), which is useful e.g. when there is a SearchField in the sub header and live search continuously updates the content area while the user is still able to type.

properties.name: floatingFooter
properties.description:
Decides whether the floating footer behavior should be enabled.
When the floating footer behavior is used, the content is visible when it's underneath the footer.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: The content of this page

aggregations.name: customHeader
aggregations.description:
The (optional) custom header of this page.
Use this aggregation only when a custom header is constructed where the default header consisting of title text + nav button is not sufficient.
If this aggregation is set, the simple properties "title", "showNavButton", "NavButtonText" and "icon" are not used.

aggregations.name: footer
aggregations.description: The (optional) footer of this page. It is always located at the bottom of the page

aggregations.name: subHeader
aggregations.description: a subHeader will be rendered directly under the header

aggregations.name: headerContent
aggregations.description:
Controls to be added to the right side of the page header. Usually an application would use Button controls and limit the number to one when the application needs to run on smartphones. There is no automatic overflow handling when the space is insufficient.
When a customHeader is used, this aggregation will be ignored.

aggregations.name: landmarkInfo
aggregations.description: Accessible landmark settings to be applied on the containers of the sap.m.Page control. If not set, no landmarks will be written.

aggregations.name: _internalHeader
aggregations.description: A header bar which is managed internally by the Page control

methods.description: Gets current value of property enableScrolling. Enable vertical scrolling of page contents. Page headers and footers are fixed and do not scroll. If set to false, there will be no scrolling at all. The Page only allows vertical scrolling because horizontal scrolling is discouraged in general for full-page content. If it still needs to be achieved, disable the Page scrolling and use a ScrollContainer as full-page content of the Page. This allows you to freely configure scrolling. It can also be used to create horizontally-scrolling sub-areas of (vertically-scrolling) Pages. Default value is true.

methods.name: getFloatingFooter

returnValue.description: Value of property floatingFooter

methods.description: Gets current value of property floatingFooter. Decides whether the floating footer behavior should be enabled. When the floating footer behavior is used, the content is visible when it's underneath the footer. Default value is false.

methods.name: getFooter
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation footer. The (optional) footer of this page. It is always located at the bottom of the page

methods.name: getHeaderContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation headerContent. Controls to be added to the right side of the page header. Usually an application would use Button controls and limit the number to one when the application needs to run on smartphones. There is no automatic overflow handling when the space is insufficient. When a customHeader is used, this aggregation will be ignored.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Value of property icon

methods.description: Gets current value of property icon. the icon that is rendered in the page header bar in non-iOS phone/tablet platforms. This property is theme-dependent and only has an effect in the MVI theme.

deprecated.text: Deprecated since the MVI theme is removed now. This property only affected the NavButton in that theme.

methods.name: getLandmarkInfo
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation landmarkInfo. Accessible landmark settings to be applied on the containers of the sap.m.Page control. If not set, no landmarks will be written.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.Page.

methods.name: getNavButtonText

returnValue.description: Value of property navButtonText

methods.description: Gets current value of property navButtonText. The text of the nav button when running in iOS (if shown) in case it deviates from the default, which is "Back". This property is mvi-theme-dependent and will not have any effect in other themes.

deprecated.text: Deprecated since the MVI theme is removed now. This property only affected the NavButton in that theme.

methods.name: getNavButtonTooltip

returnValue.description: Value of property navButtonTooltip

methods.description: Gets current value of property navButtonTooltip. The tooltip of the nav button Since version 1.34

methods.name: getNavButtonType

returnValue.description: Value of property navButtonType

methods.description: Gets current value of property navButtonType. This property is used to set the appearance of the NavButton. By default when showNavButton is set to true, a back button will be shown in iOS and an up button in other platforms. In case you want to show a normal button in the left header area, you can set the value to "Default". Default value is Back.

deprecated.text: Deprecated since the MVI theme is removed now. This property is only usable with a Button text in that theme.

methods.name: getShowFooter

returnValue.description: Value of property showFooter

methods.description: Gets current value of property showFooter. Whether this page shall have a footer Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property showHeader

methods.description: Gets current value of property showHeader. Whether this page shall have a header. If set to true, either the control under the "customHeader" aggregation is used, or if there is no such control, a Header control is constructed from the properties "title", "showNavButton", "navButtonText" and "icon" depending on the platform. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowNavButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showNavButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property showNavButton. A nav button will be rendered on the left area of header bar if this property is set to true. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowSubHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property showSubHeader

methods.description: Gets current value of property showSubHeader. Whether this page shall show the subheader. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSubHeader
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation subHeader. a subHeader will be rendered directly under the header

methods.name: getTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property title

methods.description: Gets current value of property title. The title text appearing in the page header bar.

methods.name: getTitleLevel

returnValue.description: Value of property titleLevel

methods.description: Gets current value of property titleLevel. Defines the semantic level of the title. Using "Auto" no explicit level information is written. Used for accessibility purposes only. Default value is Auto.

methods.name: setBackgroundDesign

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sBackgroundDesign
parameters.description: New value for property backgroundDesign

methods.description: Sets a new value for property backgroundDesign. This property is used to set the background color of a page. When a list is placed inside a page, the value "List" should be used to display a gray background. "Standard", with the value white, is used as default if not specified. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Standard.

methods.name: setContentOnlyBusy

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bContentOnlyBusy
parameters.description: New value for property contentOnlyBusy

methods.description: Sets a new value for property contentOnlyBusy. Decides which area is covered by the local BusyIndicator when page.setBusy() is called. By default the entire page is covered, including headers and footer. When this property is set to "true", only the content area is covered (not header/sub header and footer), which is useful e.g. when there is a SearchField in the sub header and live search continuously updates the content area while the user is still able to type. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

It can also be used to create horizontally-scrolling sub-areas of (vertically-scrolling) Pages. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. symbols.name: sap.m.PageAccessibleLandmarkInfo
symbols.description: Settings for accessible landmarks which can be applied to the container elements of a sap.m.Page control. These landmarks are e.g. used by assistive technologies (like screenreaders) to provide a meaningful page overview.

properties.name: rootRole
properties.description: Landmark role of the root container of the corresponding sap.m.Page control. If set to sap.ui.core.AccessibleLandmarkRole.None, no landmark will be added to the container.

properties.name: rootLabel
properties.description: Texts which describes the landmark of the root container of the corresponding sap.m.Page control. If not set (and a landmark different than sap.ui.core.AccessibleLandmarkRole.None is defined), a predefined text is used.

properties.description: Landmark role of the content container of the corresponding sap.m.Page control. If set to sap.ui.core.AccessibleLandmarkRole.None, no landmark will be added to the container.

symbols.name: sap.m.Panel
symbols.description:
A container control which has a header and content.

Overview

The panel is a container for grouping and displaying information. It can be collapsed to save space on the screen.

Guidelines:

  • Nesting two or more panels is not recommended.
  • Do not stack too many panels on one page.

Structure

A panel consists of a title bar with a header text or header toolbar, an info toolbar (optional), and a content area. Using the headerToolbar aggregation, you can add a toolbar with any toolbar content (i.e. custom buttons, spacers, titles) inside the title bar. There are two types of panels: fixed and expandable. Expendable panels are enabled by the expandable property. Furthermore you can define an expand animation with the property expandAnimation.

Usage

When to use:

  • You need to group or display information and want to give users the option of hiding this information.
  • You want to show additional information on demand (for example, a panel could show optional input fields for an advanced search).

Responsive Behavior

  • If the width of the panel is set to 100% (default), the panel and its children are resized responsively, depending on its parent container.
  • If the panel has a fixed defined height, it will take up the space, even if the panel is collapsed.
  • When the panel is expandable, an arrow icon (pointing to the right) appears in front of the header.
  • When the animation is activated, expand/collapse uses a smooth animation to open or close the content area.
  • When the panel expands/collapses, the arrow icon rotates 90 degrees clockwise/counter-clockwise.
  • When the height uses the default property auto, the height of the content area is automatically adjusted to match the height of its content.
  • When the height of the panel is set to a fixed size, the content area can be scrolled through.

properties.name: headerText
properties.description:
This property is used to set the header text of the Panel.
The "headerText" is visible in both expanded and collapsed state.
Note: This property is overwritten by the "headerToolbar" aggregation.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Determines the Panel width.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Determines the Panel height.

properties.name: expandable
properties.description:
Specifies whether the control is expandable.
This allows for collapsing or expanding the infoToolbar (if available) and content of the Panel.
Note: If expandable is set to false, the Panel will always be rendered expanded.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description:
Indicates whether the Panel is expanded or not.
If expanded is set to true, then both the infoToolbar (if available) and the content are rendered.
If expanded is set to false, then only the headerText or headerToolbar is rendered.

properties.name: expandAnimation
properties.description:
Indicates whether the transition between the expanded and the collapsed state of the control is animated.
By default the animation is enabled.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description:
This property is used to set the background color of the Panel.
Depending on the theme you can change the state of the background from "Solid" over "Translucent" to "Transparent".

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description:
Determines the content of the Panel.
The content will be visible only when the Panel is expanded.

aggregations.name: headerToolbar
aggregations.description:
This aggregation allows the use of a custom Toolbar as header for the Panel.
The "headerToolbar" is visible in both expanded and collapsed state.
Use it when you want to add extra controls for user interactions in the header.
Note: This aggregation overwrites "headerText" property.

aggregations.name: infoToolbar
aggregations.description:
This aggregation allows the use of a custom Toolbar as information bar for the Panel.
The "infoToolbar" is placed below the header and is visible only in expanded state.
Use it when you want to show extra information to the user.

Popover will be placed at the right or left side of the reference control but will try to position on the
left side if the space is greater than the Popover's width.

properties.name: HorizontalPreferredRight
properties.description:
Popover will be placed at the right or left side of the reference control but will try to position on the
right side if the space is greater than the Popover's width.

properties.name: Left
properties.description: Popover will be placed at the left side of the reference control.

properties.name: PreferredBottomOrFlip
properties.description:
Popover will be placed to the bottom of the reference control. If the available space is less than the Popover's height,
it will appear to the top of the same reference control bottom border.

properties.name: PreferredLeftOrFlip
properties.description:
Popover will be placed to the left of the reference control. If the available space is less than the Popover's width,
it will appear to the right of the same reference control left border.

properties.name: PreferredRightOrFlip
properties.description:
Popover will be placed to the right of the reference control. If the available space is less than the Popover's width,
it will appear to the left of the same reference control right border.

properties.name: PreferredTopOrFlip
properties.description:
Popover will be placed to the top of the reference control. If the available space is less than the Popover's height,
it will appear to the bottom of the same reference control top border.

properties.name: Right
properties.description: Popover will be placed at the right side of the reference control.

properties.name: Top
properties.description: Popover will be placed at the top of the reference control.

properties.name: Vertical
properties.description: Popover will be placed at the top or bottom of the reference control.

properties.name: VerticalPreferedBottom
properties.description: Deprecated - use sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredBottom type.

properties.name: VerticalPreferredBottom

Popover will be placed at the top or bottom of the reference control but will try to position on the
bottom side if the space is greater than the Popover's height.

properties.name: VerticalPreferredTop
properties.description:
Popover will be placed at the top or bottom of the reference control but will try to position on the
top side if the space is greater than the Popover's height.

symbols.name: sap.m.PlanningCalendar
symbols.description:
Displays rows with appointments for different entities (such as persons or teams) for the selected time interval.

Overview

You can use the PlanningCalendar to represent a calendar containing multiple rows with appointments, where each row represents a different person. You can configure different time-interval views that the user can switch between, such as hours or days, and even a whole week/month. The available navigation allows the user to select a specific interval using a picker, or move to the previous/next interval using arrows. Note: The PlanningCalendar uses parts of the sap.ui.unified library. If the sap.ui.unified library is not loaded before the PlanningCalendar is loaded, it will be loaded after the PlanningCalendar is loaded. This could lead to a waiting time before a PlanningCalendar is used for the first time. To prevent this, applications using the PlanningCalendar should also load the sap.ui.unified library.

Usage

The PlanningCalendar has the following structure from top to bottom:
  • A toolbar where you can add your own buttons or other controls using the toolbarContent aggregation.
  • A header containing a drop-down menu for selecting the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarView PlanningCalendarViews}, and navigation for moving through the intervals using arrows or selecting a specific interval with a picker. Custom views can be configured using the views aggregation. If not configured, the following set of default built-in views is available - Hours, Days, 1 Week, 1 Month, and Months. Setting a custom view(s) replaces the built-in ones.
  • The rows of the PlanningCalendar that contain the the assigned appointments. They can be configured with the rows aggregation, which is of type {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarRow PlanningCalendarRow}.

Responsive behavior

You can define the number of displayed intervals based on the size of the PlanningCalendar using the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarView PlanningCalendarView}'s properties.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Determines the start date of the row, as a JavaScript date object. The current date is used as default.

properties.name: viewKey
properties.description: Defines the key of the PlanningCalendarView used for the output. Note: The default value is set Hour. If you are using your own views, the keys of these views should be used instead.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description: Determines whether only a single row can be selected.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the PlanningCalendar.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Specifies the height of the PlanningCalendar.

properties.name: showIntervalHeaders
properties.description: Determines whether the assigned interval headers are displayed. You can assign them using the intervalHeaders aggregation of the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarRow PlanningCalendarRow}. Note: If you set both showIntervalHeaders and showEmptyIntervalHeaders properties to true, the space (at the top of the intervals) where the assigned interval headers appear, will remain visible even if no interval headers are assigned.

properties.name: showEmptyIntervalHeaders
properties.description: Determines whether the space (at the top of the intervals), where the assigned interval headers appear, should remain visible even when no interval headers are present in the visible time frame. If set to false, this space would collapse/disappear when no interval headers are assigned. Note: This property takes effect, only if showIntervalHeaders is also set to true.

properties.name: showRowHeaders
properties.description:
Determines whether the column containing the headers of the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarRow PlanningCalendarRows}
is displayed.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Defines the text that is displayed when no {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarRow PlanningCalendarRows} are assigned.

properties.name: appointmentsReducedHeight
properties.description: Determines whether the appointments that have only title without text are rendered with smaller height. Note: On phone devices this property is ignored, appointments are always rendered in full height to facilitate touching.

properties.name: appointmentsVisualization
properties.description: Determines how the appointments are visualized depending on the used theme.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description: Defines the minimum date that can be displayed and selected in the PlanningCalendar. This must be a JavaScript date object. Note: If the minDate is set to be after the current maxDate, the maxDate is set to the last date of the month in which the minDate belongs.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description: Defines the maximum date that can be displayed and selected in the PlanningCalendar. This must be a JavaScript date object. Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the current minDate, the minDate is set to the first date of the month in which the maxDate belongs.

aggregations.name: rows
aggregations.description: Rows of the PlanningCalendar.

aggregations.name: views
aggregations.description: Views of the PlanningCalendar. Note: If not set, all the default views are available. Their keys are defined in {@link sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType}.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description: Special days in the header calendar visualized as date range with a type. Note: If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first type will be used.

aggregations.name: toolbarContent
aggregations.description: The content of the toolbar.

aggregations.name: table
aggregations.description: Hidden, for internal use only.

associations.name: legend
associations.description: Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the Appointments. Note: The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

meaning more than the current appointment could be selected.

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event appointmentSelect to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • appointment of type sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointmentThe selected appointment.
  • appointments of type sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment[]The selected appointments in case a group appointment is selected.
  • multiSelect of type booleanIf set, the appointment was selected using multiple selection (e.g. Shift + single mouse click), meaning more than the current appointment could be selected.

methods.name: fireIntervalSelect

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event intervalSelect to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • startDate of type objectStart date of the selected interval, as a JavaScript date object.
  • endDate of type objectInterval end date as a JavaScript date object.
  • subInterval of type booleanIf set, the selected interval is a subinterval.
  • row of type sap.m.PlanningCalendarRowRow of the selected interval.

methods.name: getShowEmptyIntervalHeaders

returnValue.description: Value of property showEmptyIntervalHeaders

methods.description: Gets current value of property showEmptyIntervalHeaders. Determines whether the space (at the top of the intervals), where the assigned interval headers appear, should remain visible even when no interval headers are present in the visible time frame. If set to false, this space would collapse/disappear when no interval headers are assigned. Note: This property takes effect, only if showIntervalHeaders is also set to true. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowIntervalHeaders

returnValue.description: Value of property showIntervalHeaders

methods.description: Gets current value of property showIntervalHeaders. Determines whether the assigned interval headers are displayed. You can assign them using the intervalHeaders aggregation of the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarRow PlanningCalendarRow}. Note: If you set both showIntervalHeaders and showEmptyIntervalHeaders properties to true, the space (at the top of the intervals) where the assigned interval headers appear, will remain visible even if no interval headers are assigned. Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.m.PlanningCalendarRow
symbols.description:
Row in the @link sap.m.PlanningCalendar}.

This element holds the data of one row in the @link sap.m.PlanningCalendar}. Once the header information (e.g. person information)
is assigned, the appointments are assigned.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Defines the title of the header (for example, the name of the person).

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text of the header (for example, the department of the person).

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Specifies the URI of an image or an icon registered in sap.ui.core.IconPool.

properties.name: nonWorkingDays
properties.description: Determines whether the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are from 0 to 6 (other values are ignored). If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days. Note: The non-working days are visualized if the intervalType property of the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarView} is set to Day.

properties.name: nonWorkingHours
properties.description: Determines whether the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are from 0 to 23 (other values are ignored). Note: The non-working hours are visualized if intervalType property of the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarView} is set to Hour.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the selected state of the PlanningCalendarRow. Note: Binding the selected property in single selection modes may cause unwanted results if you have more than one selected row in your binding.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Defines the identifier of the row.

aggregations.name: appointments
aggregations.description: The appointments to be displayed in the row. Appointments that outside the visible time frame are not rendered. Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

aggregations.name: intervalHeaders
aggregations.description: The appointments to be displayed at the top of the intervals (for example, for public holidays). Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered. Keep in mind that the intervalHeaders should always fill whole intervals. If they are shorter or longer than one interval, they are not displayed. Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new PlanningCalendarRow. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: getIntervalHeaders
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation intervalHeaders. The appointments to be displayed at the top of the intervals (for example, for public holidays). Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered. Keep in mind that the intervalHeaders should always fill whole intervals. If they are shorter or longer than one interval, they are not displayed. Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

returnValue.description: Value of property nonWorkingDays

methods.description: Gets current value of property nonWorkingDays. Determines whether the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are from 0 to 6 (other values are ignored). If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days. Note: The non-working days are visualized if the intervalType property of the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarView} is set to Day.

Valid values inside the array are from 0 to 23 (other values are ignored). Note: The non-working hours are visualized if intervalType property of the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendarView} is set to Hour.

symbols.name: sap.m.PlanningCalendarView
symbols.description: View of the {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendar}. The PlanningCalendarView defines the type of the intervals (hours, days, months) and how many intervals are displayed.

properties.name: key
properties.description:
Defines the key of the view. This must be set to identify the used view in the
{@link sap.m.PlanningCalendar}.

properties.name: intervalType
properties.description: Determines the type of the intervals of the row. Note: Not all predefined interval types are supported for this property. For more information, see the descriptions in the {@link sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType CalendarIntervalType} enumeration.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Defines the description of the PlanningCalendarView.

properties.name: intervalsS
properties.description: Defines the number of intervals that are displayed for a {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendar} that is less than 600 pixels wide.

properties.name: intervalsM
properties.description: Defines the number of intervals that are displayed for a {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendar} that is between 600 and 1024 pixels wide.

properties.name: intervalsL
properties.description: Defines the number of intervals that are displayed for a {@link sap.m.PlanningCalendar} that is more than 1024 pixels wide.

properties.name: showSubIntervals
properties.description:
If set, subintervals are displayed as lines in the rows.
  • Quarter hour subintervals for interval type Hour.
  • Hour subintervals for interval types Day, Week and OneMonth.
  • Day subintervals for interval type Month.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.
