symbols.name: sap.m.PopinDisplay
symbols.description: Defines the display of table pop-ins

properties.name: Block
properties.description: Inside the table popin, header is displayed at the first line and cell content is displayed at the next line.

properties.name: Inline
properties.description: Inside the table popin, cell content is displayed next to the header in the same line. Note: If there is not enough space for the cell content then it jumps to the next line.

properties.name: WithoutHeader
properties.description: Inside the table popin, only the cell content will be visible.

symbols.name: sap.m.Popover
symbols.description: Displays additional information for an object in a compact way.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: This is the information about on which side will the popover be placed at. Possible values are sap.m.PlacementType.Left, sap.m.PlacementType.Right, sap.m.PlacementType.Top, sap.m.PlacementType.Bottom, sap.m.PlacementType.Horizontal, sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredLeft, sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredRight, sap.m.PlacementType.Vertical, sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredTop, sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredBottom, sap.m.PlacementType.Auto. The default value is sap.m.PlacementType.Right. Setting this property while popover is open won't cause any rerendering of the popover, but it will take effect when it's opened again.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: If a header should be shown at the top of the popover.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title text appears in the header. This property will be ignored when showHeader is set to false.

properties.name: modal
properties.description: If the popover will not be closed when tapping outside the popover. It also blocks any interaction with the background. The default value is false.

properties.name: offsetX
properties.description: The offset for the popover placement in the x axis. It's with unit pixel.

properties.name: offsetY
properties.description: The offset for the popover placement in the y axis. It's with unit pixel.

properties.name: showArrow
properties.description: Whether Popover arrow should be visible

properties.name: contentWidth
properties.description: Set the width of the content area inside Popover. When controls which adapt their size to the parent control are added directly into Popover, for example sap.m.Page control, a size needs to be specified to the content area of the Popover. Otherwise, Popover control isn't able to display the content in the right way. This values isn't necessary for controls added to Popover directly which can decide their size by themselves, for exmaple sap.m.List, sap.m.Image etc., only needed for controls that adapt their size to the parent control.

properties.name: contentMinWidth
properties.description: Sets the minimum width of the content area inside popover.

properties.name: contentHeight
properties.description: Set the height of the content area inside Popover. When controls which adapt their size to the parent control are added directly into Popover, for example sap.m.Page control, a size needs to be specified to the content area of the Popover. Otherwise, Popover control isn't able to display the content in the right way. This values isn't necessary for controls added to Popover directly which can decide their size by themselves, for exmaple sap.m.List, sap.m.Image etc., only needed for controls that adapt their size to the parent control.

properties.name: enableScrolling
properties.description: This property is deprecated. Please use properties verticalScrolling and horizontalScrolling instead. If you still use this property it will be mapped on the new properties verticalScrolling and horizontalScrolling.

deprecated.text: This property is deprecated. Please use properties verticalScrolling and horizontalScrolling instead. If you still use this property it will be mapped on the new properties verticalScrolling and horizontalScrolling.

properties.name: verticalScrolling
properties.description:
This property indicates if user can scroll vertically inside popover when the content is bigger than the content area. However, when scrollable control (sap.m.ScrollContainer, sap.m.Page) is in the popover, this property needs to be set to false to disable the scrolling in popover in order to make the scrolling in the child control work properly.
Popover detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, or sap.m.ScrollContainer as direct child added to Popover. If there is, Popover will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.

properties.name: horizontalScrolling
properties.description:
This property indicates if user can scroll horizontally inside popover when the content is bigger than the content area. However, when scrollable control (sap.m.ScrollContainer, sap.m.Page) is in the popover, this property needs to be set to false to disable the scrolling in popover in order to make the scrolling in the child control work properly.
Popover detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, or sap.m.ScrollContainer as direct child added to Popover. If there is, Popover will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.

properties.name: bounce
properties.description: Whether bouncing is enabled.

deprecated.text: This parameter is obsolete and has no effect.

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Whether resize option is enabled.

experimental.text: Do not use directly on Popover while in experimental mode!

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: The content inside the popover.

aggregations.name: customHeader
aggregations.description: Any control that needed to be displayed in the header area. When this is set, the showHeader property is ignored, and only this customHeader is shown on the top of popover.

aggregations.name: subHeader
aggregations.description: When subHeader is assigned to Popover, it's rendered directly after the main header if there is, or at the beginning of Popover when there's no main header. SubHeader is out of the content area and won't be scrolled when content's size is bigger than the content area's size.

aggregations.name: footer
aggregations.description: This is optional footer which is shown on the bottom of the popover.

aggregations.name: _internalHeader
aggregations.description: This is the hidden aggregation for managing the internally created header.

aggregations.name: beginButton
aggregations.description: BeginButton is shown at the left side (right side in RTL mode) inside the header. When showHeader is set to false, the property is ignored.

aggregations.name: endButton
aggregations.description: EndButton is always shown at the right side (left side in RTL mode) inside the header. When showHeader is set to false, the property is ignored.

associations.name: leftButton
associations.description: LeftButton is shown at the left edge of the bar in iOS, and at the right side of the bar for the other platforms. Please set this to null if you want to remove the left button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored.

deprecated.text: This property has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead.

associations.name: rightButton
associations.description: RightButton is always shown at the right edge of the bar. Please set this to null if you want to remove the right button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored.

deprecated.text: This property has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead.

associations.name: initialFocus
associations.description: Focus is set to the popover in the sequence of leftButton and rightButton when available. But if some other control neends to get the focus other than one of those two buttons, set the initialFocus with the control which should be focused on.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

methods.name: getBeginButton
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation beginButton. BeginButton is shown at the left side (right side in RTL mode) inside the header. When showHeader is set to false, the property is ignored.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation content. The content inside the popover.

methods.name: getContentHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property contentHeight

methods.description: Gets current value of property contentHeight. Set the height of the content area inside Popover. When controls which adapt their size to the parent control are added directly into Popover, for example sap.m.Page control, a size needs to be specified to the content area of the Popover. Otherwise, Popover control isn't able to display the content in the right way. This values isn't necessary for controls added to Popover directly which can decide their size by themselves, for exmaple sap.m.List, sap.m.Image etc., only needed for controls that adapt their size to the parent control.

methods.name: getContentMinWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property contentMinWidth

methods.description: Gets current value of property contentMinWidth. Sets the minimum width of the content area inside popover. Default value is .

methods.name: getContentWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property contentWidth

methods.description: Gets current value of property contentWidth. Set the width of the content area inside Popover. When controls which adapt their size to the parent control are added directly into Popover, for example sap.m.Page control, a size needs to be specified to the content area of the Popover. Otherwise, Popover control isn't able to display the content in the right way. This values isn't necessary for controls added to Popover directly which can decide their size by themselves, for exmaple sap.m.List, sap.m.Image etc., only needed for controls that adapt their size to the parent control.

methods.name: getCustomHeader
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation customHeader. Any control that needed to be displayed in the header area. When this is set, the showHeader property is ignored, and only this customHeader is shown on the top of popover.

methods.name: getEnableScrolling

returnValue.description: Value of property enableScrolling

methods.description: Gets current value of property enableScrolling. This property is deprecated. Please use properties verticalScrolling and horizontalScrolling instead. If you still use this property it will be mapped on the new properties verticalScrolling and horizontalScrolling. Default value is true.

deprecated.text: This property is deprecated. Please use properties verticalScrolling and horizontalScrolling instead. If you still use this property it will be mapped on the new properties verticalScrolling and horizontalScrolling.

methods.name: getEndButton
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation endButton. EndButton is always shown at the right side (left side in RTL mode) inside the header. When showHeader is set to false, the property is ignored.

methods.name: getFooter
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation footer. This is optional footer which is shown on the bottom of the popover.

methods.name: getHorizontalScrolling

returnValue.description: Value of property horizontalScrolling

methods.description: Gets current value of property horizontalScrolling. This property indicates if user can scroll horizontally inside popover when the content is bigger than the content area. However, when scrollable control (sap.m.ScrollContainer, sap.m.Page) is in the popover, this property needs to be set to false to disable the scrolling in popover in order to make the scrolling in the child control work properly. Popover detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, or sap.m.ScrollContainer as direct child added to Popover. If there is, Popover will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property. Default value is true.

methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association leftButton, or null.

methods.name: getModal

returnValue.description: Value of property modal

methods.description: Gets current value of property modal. If the popover will not be closed when tapping outside the popover. It also blocks any interaction with the background. The default value is false. Default value is false.

methods.name: getOffsetX

returnValue.description: Value of property offsetX

methods.description: Gets current value of property offsetX. The offset for the popover placement in the x axis. It's with unit pixel. Default value is 0.

methods.name: getOffsetY

returnValue.description: Value of property offsetY

methods.description: Gets current value of property offsetY. The offset for the popover placement in the y axis. It's with unit pixel. Default value is 0.

methods.name: getPlacement

returnValue.description: Value of property placement

methods.description: Gets current value of property placement. This is the information about on which side will the popover be placed at. Possible values are sap.m.PlacementType.Left, sap.m.PlacementType.Right, sap.m.PlacementType.Top, sap.m.PlacementType.Bottom, sap.m.PlacementType.Horizontal, sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredLeft, sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredRight, sap.m.PlacementType.Vertical, sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredTop, sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredBottom, sap.m.PlacementType.Auto. The default value is sap.m.PlacementType.Right. Setting this property while popover is open won't cause any rerendering of the popover, but it will take effect when it's opened again. Default value is Right.

methods.name: getResizable

returnValue.description: Value of property resizable

methods.description: Gets current value of property resizable. Whether resize option is enabled. Default value is false.

methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association rightButton, or null.

deprecated.text: This property has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead.

methods.name: getShowArrow

returnValue.description: Value of property showArrow

methods.description: Gets current value of property showArrow. Whether Popover arrow should be visible Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property showHeader

methods.description: Gets current value of property showHeader. If a header should be shown at the top of the popover. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSubHeader
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation subHeader. When subHeader is assigned to Popover, it's rendered directly after the main header if there is, or at the beginning of Popover when there's no main header. SubHeader is out of the content area and won't be scrolled when content's size is bigger than the content area's size.

methods.name: getTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property title

methods.description: Gets current value of property title. Title text appears in the header. This property will be ignored when showHeader is set to false.

methods.name: getVerticalScrolling

returnValue.description: Value of property verticalScrolling

methods.description: Gets current value of property verticalScrolling. This property indicates if user can scroll vertically inside popover when the content is bigger than the content area. However, when scrollable control (sap.m.ScrollContainer, sap.m.Page) is in the popover, this property needs to be set to false to disable the scrolling in popover in order to make the scrolling in the child control work properly. Popover detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, or sap.m.ScrollContainer as direct child added to Popover. If there is, Popover will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property. Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.m.ProgressIndicator
symbols.description:
Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way. To indicate the progress, the inside of the ProgressIndicator is filled with a color.
Additionally, a user-defined string can be displayed on the ProgressIndicator.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Switches enabled state of the control. Disabled fields have different colors, and cannot be focused.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Specifies the state of the bar. Enumeration sap.ui.core.ValueState provides Error (red), Warning (yellow), Success (green), None (blue) (default value).

properties.name: displayValue
properties.description: Specifies the text value to be displayed in the bar.

properties.name: percentValue
properties.description: Specifies the numerical value in percent for the length of the progress bar.

properties.name: showValue
properties.description: Indicates whether the displayValue should be shown in the ProgressIndicator.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the control.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Specifies the height of the control. The default value depends on the theme. Suggested size for normal use is 2.5rem (40px). Suggested size for small size (like for use in ObjectHeader) is 1.375rem (22px).

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options (RTL or LTR). By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ProgressIndicator. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property height. Specifies the height of the control. The default value depends on the theme. Suggested size for normal use is 2.5rem (40px). Suggested size for small size (like for use in ObjectHeader) is 1.375rem (22px). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.name: sap.m.PullToRefresh
symbols.description:
PullToRefresh control. Put it as the first control in contents of a scroll container or a scrollable page. Do not place it into a page with disabled scrolling.
On touch devices it gets hidden by default and when the user pulls down the page far enough, it gets visible and triggers the "refresh" event.
In non-touch browsers where scrollbars are used for scrolling, it is always visible and triggers the "refresh" event when clicked.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional description. May be used to inform a user, for example, when the list has been updated last time.

properties.name: showIcon
properties.description: Set to true to display an icon/logo. Icon must be set either in the customIcon property or in the CSS theme for the PullToRefresh control.

properties.name: customIcon
properties.description: Provide a URI to a custom icon image to replace the SAP logo. Large images are scaled down to max 50px height.

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description:
By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server.

If bandwidth is the key for the application, set this value to false.

events.name: refresh
events.description: Event indicates that the user has requested new data

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.m.QuickView
symbols.description:
The QuickView control renders a responsive popover (sap.m.Popover or sap.m.Dialog)
and displays information of an object in a business-card format. It also allows this object to be linked to
another object using one of the links in the responsive popover. Clicking that link updates the information in the
popover with the data of the linked object. Unlimited number of objects can be linked.

properties.description: This property is reused from sap.m.Popover and only takes effect when running on desktop or tablet. Please refer the documentation of the placement property of sap.m.Popover.

symbols.name: sap.m.QuickViewBase
symbols.description:
QuickViewBase class provides base functionality for QuickView and QuickViewCard.
Do not use it directly.

aggregations.name: pages
aggregations.description:
Displays a page header, object icon or image, object name with short description,
and object information divided in groups

events.name: navigate
events.description:
The event is fired when navigation between two pages has been triggered.
The transition (if any) to the new page has not started yet.
This event can be aborted by the application with preventDefault(),
which means that there will be no navigation.

from.name: from
from.description: The page which was displayed before the current navigation.

fromId.name: fromId
fromId.description: The ID of the page which was displayed before the current navigation.

to.name: to
to.description: The page which will be displayed after the current navigation.

toId.name: toId
toId.description: The ID of the page which will be displayed after the current navigation.

firstTime.name: firstTime
firstTime.description:
Determines whether the "to" page (a control with the ID of the page
which is currently navigated to) has not been displayed/navigated to before.

isTo.name: isTo
isTo.description: Determines whether this is a forward navigation.

isBack.name: isBack
isBack.description: Determines whether this is a back navigation.

isBackToTop.name: isBackToTop
isBackToTop.description: Determines  whether this is a navigation to the root page.

isBackToPage.name: isBackToPage
isBackToPage.description: Determines whether this was a navigation to a specific page.

direction.name: direction
direction.description:
Determines how the navigation was triggered, possible values are
"to", "back", "backToPage", and "backToTop".

events.name: afterNavigate
events.description:
The event is fired when navigation between two pages has completed.
In case of animated transitions this event is fired with some delay
after the "navigate" event.

The event is fired when navigation between two pages has been triggered. The transition (if any) to the new page has not started yet. This event can be aborted by the application with preventDefault(), which means that there will be no navigation.

methods.name: fireAfterNavigate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event afterNavigate to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • from of type sap.ui.core.ControlDetermines the page, which has been displayed before navigation.
  • fromId of type stringDetermines the ID of the page, which has been displayed before navigation.
  • to of type sap.ui.core.ControlDetermines the page, which is now displayed after navigation.
  • toId of type stringDetermines the ID of the page, which is now displayed after navigation.
  • firstTime of type booleanDetermines whether the "to" page (a control with the ID of the page, which has been navigated to) has not been displayed/navigated to before.
  • isTo of type booleanDetermines whether this was a forward navigation.
  • isBack of type booleanDetermines whether this was a back navigation.
  • isBackToTop of type booleanDetermines whether this was a navigation to the root page.
  • isBackToPage of type booleanDetermines whether this was a navigation to a specific page.
  • direction of type stringDetermines how the navigation was triggered, possible values are "to", "back", "backToPage", and "backToTop".
  • isTopPage of type booleanDetermines whether this is a navigation to the top page.

methods.name: fireNavigate

returnValue.description: Whether or not to prevent the default action

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event navigate to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • from of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe page which was displayed before the current navigation.
  • fromId of type stringThe ID of the page which was displayed before the current navigation.
  • to of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe page which will be displayed after the current navigation.
  • toId of type stringThe ID of the page which will be displayed after the current navigation.
  • firstTime of type booleanDetermines whether the "to" page (a control with the ID of the page which is currently navigated to) has not been displayed/navigated to before.
  • isTo of type booleanDetermines whether this is a forward navigation.
  • isBack of type booleanDetermines whether this is a back navigation.
  • isBackToTop of type booleanDetermines whether this is a navigation to the root page.
  • isBackToPage of type booleanDetermines whether this was a navigation to a specific page.
  • direction of type stringDetermines how the navigation was triggered, possible values are "to", "back", "backToPage", and "backToTop".

symbols.name: sap.m.QuickViewCard
symbols.description:
The QuickViewCard control displays information of an object in a business-card format.
It also allows this object to be linked to another object using one of the links.
Clicking that link updates the information with the data of the linked object.
Unlimited number of objects can be linked.

QuickViewPage consists of  a page header, an object icon or image,
an object name with short description, and an object information divided in groups.
The control uses the sap.m.SimpleForm control to display information.

symbols.name: sap.m.RadioButton
symbols.description:
RadioButton is a control similar to CheckBox, but it allows the user to choose only one of the predefined set of options.

Usually, RadioButton is used in a group with other RadioButtons (with the groupName property or by using sap.m.RadioButtonGroup), thus providing a limited choice for the user.
An event is triggered when the user makes a change of the selection.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Specifies if the radio button is disabled.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Specifies the select state of the radio button

properties.name: groupName
properties.description:
Name of the radio button group the current radio button belongs to. You can define a new name for the group.
If no new name is specified, this radio button belongs to the sapMRbDefaultGroup per default. Default behavior of a radio button in a group is that when one of the radio buttons in a group is selected, all others are unselected.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Specifies the text displayed next to the RadioButton

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Options for the text direction are RTL and LTR. Alternatively, the control can inherit the text direction from its parent container.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Width of the RadioButton or it's label depending on the useEntireWidth property.
By Default width is set only for the label.

properties.name: useEntireWidth
properties.description:
Indicates if the given width will be applied for the whole RadioButton or only it's label.
By Default width is set only for the label.

properties.name: activeHandling
properties.description:
This is a flag to switch on activeHandling. When it is switched off,
there will not be visual changes on active state. Default value is 'true'

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Specifies whether the user can select the radio button.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Enumeration sap.ui.core.ValueState provides state values Error, Success, Warning, None

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Specifies the alignment of the radio button. Available alignment settings are "Begin", "Center", "End", "Left", and "Right".

symbols.name: sap.m.RadioButtonGroup
symbols.description:
This control is used as a wrapper for a group of sap.m.RadioButton controls, which then can be used as a single UI element. You can select only one of the grouped radio buttons at a time. The RadioButtonGroup lets you do things like attach a single event handler on a group of buttons, rather than on each individual button. The grouped radio buttons can be arranged within different number of columns. Based on the number of specified columns and the number of radio buttons used, different layout types can be achieved - as a 'matrix', horizontally or vertically aligned radio buttons.
Note: Design guidelines recommend application developers create radio button groups with only one row or only one column.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the RadioButtonGroup.

properties.name: columns
properties.description: Specifies the maximum number of radio buttons displayed in one line.

properties.name: editable
properties.description:
Specifies whether the user can change the selected value of the RadioButtonGroup.
When the property is set to false, the control obtains visual styles
different from its visual styles for the normal and the disabled state.
Additionally, the control is no longer interactive, but can receive focus.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Тhe value state to be displayed for the radio button. Possible values are: sap.ui.core.ValueState.Error,
sap.ui.core.ValueState.Warning, sap.ui.core.ValueState.Success and sap.ui.core.ValueState.None.
Note: Setting this attribute to sap.ui.core.ValueState.Error when the accessibility feature is enabled,
sets the value of the invalid propery for the whole RadioButtonGroup to “true”.

properties.name: selectedIndex
properties.description:
Determines the index of the selected/checked RadioButton. Default is 0.
If no radio button is selected, the selectedIndex property will return -1.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Switches the enabled state of the control. All Radio Buttons inside a disabled group are disabled. Default value is “true”.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: This property specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

symbols.name: sap.m.RangeSlider
symbols.description:
Overview A {@link sap.m.RangeSlider} control represents a numerical interval and two handles to select a sub-range within it. The purpose of the control is to enable visual selection of sub-ranges within a given interval. Notes:
  • The RangeSlider extends the functionality of the {@link sap.m.Slider Slider}
  • The right and left handle can be moved individually and their positions could therefore switch.
  • The entire range can be moved along the interval.
  • The right and left handle can select the same value
Usage The most common usecase is to select and move sub-ranges on a continuous numerical scale. Responsive Behavior You can move the currently selected range by clicking on it and dragging it along the interval.

properties.name: value2
properties.description: Current second value of the slider. (Position of the second handle.) Note: If the value is not in the valid range (between min and max) it will be changed to be in the valid range. If it is smaller than value it will be set to the same value.

properties.name: range
properties.description:
Determines the currently selected range on the slider.

If the value is lower/higher than the allowed minimum/maximum, a warning message will be output to the console.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new RangeSlider. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. symbols.name: sap.m.RatingIndicator
symbols.description:
Is used to rate content. The amount of rating symbols can be specified, as well as the URIs to the
image icons which shall be used as rating symbols. When the user performs a rating, an event is fired.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Value "true" is required to let the user rate with this control. It is recommended to set this parameter to "false" for the "Small" size which is meant for indicating a value only

properties.name: maxValue
properties.description: The number of displayed rating symbols

properties.name: value
properties.description: The indicated value of the rating

properties.name: iconSize
properties.description: The Size of the image or icon to be displayed. The default value depends on the theme. Please be sure that the size is corresponding to a full pixel value as some browsers don't support subpixel calculations. Recommended size is 1.375rem (22px) for normal, 1rem (16px) for small, and 2rem (32px) for large icons correspondingly.

properties.name: iconSelected
properties.description: The URI to the icon font icon or image that will be displayed for selected rating symbols. A star icon will be used if the property is not set

properties.name: iconUnselected
properties.description: The URI to the icon font icon or image that will be displayed for all unselected rating symbols. A star icon will be used if the property is not set

properties.name: iconHovered
properties.description: The URI to the icon font icon or image that will be displayed for hovered rating symbols. A star icon will be used if the property is not set

properties.name: visualMode
properties.description: Defines how float values are visualized: Full, Half (see enumeration RatingIndicatorVisualMode)

associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy

value.name: value
value.description: The current value of the rating after a live change event.

symbols.name: sap.m.RatingIndicatorVisualMode
symbols.description: Possible values for the visualization of float values in the RatingIndicator Control.

properties.name: Full
properties.description: Values are rounded to the nearest integer value (e.g. 1.7 -> 2).

properties.name: Half
properties.description: Values are rounded to the nearest half value (e.g. 1.7 -> 1.5).

symbols.name: sap.m.ResponsivePopover
symbols.description: This control acts responsively to the type of device. It acts as a sap.m.Popover on desktop and tablet, while on phone it acts as a sap.m.Dialog with stretch set to true.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: This property only takes effect on desktop or tablet. Please see the documentation sap.m.Popover#placement.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: This property is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#showHeader and sap.m.Dialog#showHeader

properties.name: title
properties.description: This property is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#title and sap.m.Dialog#title

properties.name: icon
properties.description: This property only takes effect  on phone. Please see the documentation sap.m.Dialog#icon.

properties.name: modal
properties.description: This property only takes effect on desktop or tablet. Please see the documentation sap.m.Popover#modal.

properties.name: offsetX
properties.description: This property only takes effect on desktop or tablet. Please see the documentation sap.m.Popover#offsetX.

properties.name: offsetY
properties.description: This property only takes effect on desktop or tablet. Please see the documentation sap.m.Popover#offsetY.

properties.name: showArrow
properties.description: This property only takes effect on desktop or tablet. Please see the documentation sap.m.Popover#showArrow.

properties.name: contentWidth
properties.description: This property is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#contentWidth and sap.m.Dialog#contentWidth

properties.name: contentHeight
properties.description: This property is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#contentHeight and sap.m.Dialog#contentHeight

properties.name: horizontalScrolling
properties.description: This property is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#horizontalScrolling and sap.m.Dialog#horizontalScrolling

properties.name: verticalScrolling
properties.description: This property is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#verticalScrolling and sap.m.Dialog#verticalScrolling

properties.name: showCloseButton
properties.description: Determines if a close button should be inserted into the dialog's header dynamically to close the dialog. This property only takes effect on phone.

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Whether resize option is enabled.

experimental.text: Do not use directly on ResponsivePopover while in experimental mode!

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Content is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#content and sap.m.Dialog#content

aggregations.name: customHeader
aggregations.description: CustomHeader is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#customHeader and sap.m.Dialog#customHeader

aggregations.name: subHeader
aggregations.description: SubHeader is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#subHeader and sap.m.Dialog#subHeader

aggregations.name: beginButton
aggregations.description: BeginButton is supported by both variants. It is always show in the left part (right part in RTL mode) of the footer which is located at the bottom of the ResponsivePopover. If buttons need to be displayed in header, please use customHeader instead.

aggregations.name: endButton
aggregations.description: EndButton is supported by both variants. It is always show in the right part (left part in RTL mode) of the footer which is located at the bottom of the ResponsivePopover. If buttons need to be displayed in header, please use customHeader instead.

aggregations.name: _popup
aggregations.description: The internal popup instance which is either a dialog on phone or a popover on the rest of platforms

associations.name: initialFocus
associations.description: InitialFocus is supported by both variants. Please see the documentation on sap.m.Popover#initialFocus and sap.m.Dialog#initialFocus

symbols.name: sap.m.routing.RouteMatchedHandler
symbols.description:
This class will attach to the Events of a provided router and add the views created by it to a  {@link sap.m.SplitContainer} or a {@link sap.m.NavContainer} Control, if this is the target control of the route.</br>
If the targetControl is no {@link sap.m.SplitContainer} or a {@link sap.m.NavContainer}, It will only close the dialogs, according to the property value.</br>
</br>
When a navigation is triggered, this class will try to determine the transition of the pages based on the history.</br>
Eg: if a user presses browser back, it will show a backwards animation.</br>
</br>
The navigation on the container takes place in the RoutePatternMatched event of the Router. If you register on the RouteMatched event of the Router, the visual navigation did not take place yet.</br>
</br>
Since it is hard to detect if a user has pressed browser back, this transitions will not be reliable, for example if someone bookmarked a detail page, and wants to navigate to a masterPage.</br>
If you want this case to always show a backwards transition, you should specify a "viewLevel" property on your Route.</br>
The viewLevel has to be an integer. The Master should have a lower number than the detail.</br>
These levels should represent the user process of your application and they do not have to match the container structure of your Routes.</br>
If the user navigates between views with the same viewLevel, the history is asked for the direction.</br>
</br>
You can specify a property "transition" in a route to define which transition will be applied when navigating. If it is not defined, the nav container will take its default transition.
</br>
You can also specify "transitionParameters" on a Route, to give the transition parameters.</br>
</br>
preservePageInSplitContainer is deprecated since 1.28 since Targets make this parameter obsolete.
If you want to preserve the current view when navigating, but you want to navigate to it when nothing is displayed in the navContainer, you can set preservePageInSplitContainer = true</br>
When the route that has this flag directly matches the pattern, the view will still be switched by the splitContainer.
</br>

deprecated.text: use {@link sap.m.routing.Router} or {@link sap.m.routing.Targets} instead. The functionality of the routematched handler is built in into these two classes, there is no need to create this anymore.

views.name: views
views.description: the views instance will create the views of all the targets defined, so if 2 targets have the same viewName, the same instance of the view will be displayed.

config.name: config

rootView.name: rootView
rootView.description: The id of the rootView - This should be the id of the view that contains the control with the controlId since the control will be retrieved by calling the {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.View#byId} function of the rootView. If you are using a component and add the routing.targets do not set this parameter, since the component will set the rootView to the view created by the {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent} function. If you specify the "parent" property of a target, the control will not be searched in the root view but in the view Created by the parent (see parent documentation).

async.name: async
async.description:
@since 1.34 Whether the views which are created through this Targets are loaded asyncly. This option can be set only when the Targets
is used standalone without the involvement of a Router. Otherwise the async option is inherited from the Router.

targets.name: targets

anyName.name: anyName

viewName.name: viewName

viewType.name: viewType
viewType.description:
The type of the view that is going to be created. These are the supported types: {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.ViewType}.
You always have to provide a viewType except if you are using {@link sap.ui.core.routing.Views#setView}.

viewPath.name: viewPath
viewPath.description:
A prefix that will be prepended in front of the viewName.
Example: viewName is set to "myView" and viewPath is set to "myApp" - the created viewName will be "myApp.myView".

viewId.name: viewId
viewId.description:
The id of the created view.
This is will be prefixed with the id of the component set to the views instance provided in oOptions.views. For details see {@link sap.ui.core.routing.Views#getView}.

targetParent.name: targetParent
targetParent.description:
The id of the parent of the controlId - This should be the id of the view that contains your controlId,
since the target control will be retrieved by calling the {@link sap.ui.core.mvc.View#byId} function of the targetParent. By default,
this will be the view created by a component, so you do not have to provide this parameter.
If you are using children, the view created by the parent of the child is taken.
You only need to specify this, if you are not using a Targets instance created by a component
and you should give the id of root view of your application to this property.

controlId.name: controlId
controlId.description:
The id of the control where you want to place the view created by this target.
The view of the target will be put into this container Control, using the controlAggregation property. You have to specify both properties or the target will not be able to place itself.
An example for containers are {@link sap.ui.ux3.Shell} with the aggregation 'content' or a {@link sap.m.NavContainer} with the aggregation 'pages'.

controlAggregation.name: controlAggregation
controlAggregation.description:
The name of an aggregation of the controlId, that contains views.
Eg: a {@link sap.m.NavContainer} has an aggregation 'pages', another Example is the {@link sap.ui.ux3.Shell} it has 'content'.

clearControlAggregation.name: clearControlAggregation
clearControlAggregation.description:
Defines a boolean that can be passed to specify if the aggregation should be cleared
- all items will be removed - before adding the View to it.
When using a {@link sap.ui.ux3.Shell} this should be true. For a {@link sap.m.NavContainer} it should be false. When you use the {@link sap.m.routing.Router} the default will be false.

parent.name: parent

viewLevel.name: viewLevel

transition.name: transition
transition.description: define which transition of the {@link sap.m.NavContainer} will be applied when navigating. If it is not defined, the nav container will take its default transition.

transitionParameters.name: transitionParameters
transitionParameters.description: define the transitionParameters of the {@link sap.m.NavContainer}

targets.description: One or multiple targets in a map.

constructor.description:
Provides a convenient way for placing views into the correct containers of your application.
The mobile extension of Targets also handles the triggering of page navigation when the target control is a {@link sap.m.SplitContainer}, a {@link sap.m.NavContainer} or a control which extends one of these.
Other controls are also allowed, but the extra parameters viewLevel, transition and transitionParameters are ignored and it will behave like {@link sap.ui.core.routing.Targets}.
When a target is displayed, dialogs will be closed. To change this use {@link #getTargetHandler} and {@link sap.m.routing.TargetHandler#setCloseDialogs}.

symbols.name: sap.m.ScrollContainer
symbols.description:
The ScrollContainer is a control that can display arbitrary content within a limited screen area and provides touch scrolling to make all content accessible.

Note that it is not recommended to have nested scrolling areas that scroll into the same direction (e.g. a ScrollContainer that scrolls vertically inside a Page control with scrolling enabled). This is currently not considered a valid use-case of a good UI and the behavior will feel wrong.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
The width of the ScrollContainer.
If not set, it consumes the complete available width, behaving like normal HTML block elements. If only vertical scrolling is enabled, make sure the content always fits or wraps.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
The height of the ScrollContainer.
By default the height equals the content height. If only horizontal scrolling is used, do not set the height or make sure the height is always larger than the height of the content.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

properties.name: horizontal
properties.description: Whether horizontal scrolling should be possible.

properties.name: vertical
properties.description:
Whether vertical scrolling should be possible.

Note that this is off by default because typically a Page is used as fullscreen element which can handle vertical scrolling. If this is not the case and vertical scrolling is required, this flag needs to be set to "true".
Important: it is not supported to have nested controls that both enable scrolling into the same dimension.

properties.name: focusable
properties.description:
Whether the scroll container can be focused.

Note that it should be set to "true" when there are no focusable elements inside or when keyboard interaction requires an additional tab stop on the container.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: The content of the ScrollContainer.

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

methods.name: scrollTo

parameters.name: x
parameters.description:
The horizontal pixel position to scroll to.
        Scrolling to the right happens with positive values. In right-to-left mode scrolling starts at the right side and higher values scroll to the left.
        If only vertical scrolling is enabled, give 0 as value.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description:
The vertical pixel position to scroll to.
        Scrolling down happens with positive values.
        If only horizontal scrolling is enabled, give 0 as value.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
The duration of animated scrolling.
        To scroll immediately without animation, give 0 as value. 0 is also the default value, when this optional parameter is omitted.

methods.description:
Scrolls to the given position.
When called while the control is not rendered (yet), the scrolling position is still applied, but there is no animation.

symbols.name: sap.m.SearchField
symbols.description: Enables users to input a search string.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Input Value.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the CSS width of the input. If not set, width is 100%.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Boolean property to enable the control (default is true).

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Invisible inputs are not rendered.

properties.name: maxLength
properties.description: Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Text shown when no value available. Default placeholder text is the word "Search" in the current local language (if supported) or in English.

properties.name: showMagnifier
properties.description: Set to false to hide the magnifier icon.

deprecated.text: This parameter is deprecated. Use "showSearchButton" instead.

properties.name: showRefreshButton
properties.description: Set to true to display a refresh button in place of the search icon. By pressing the refresh button or F5 key on keyboard, the user can reload the results list without changing the search string.

properties.name: refreshButtonTooltip
properties.description: Tooltip text of the refresh button. If it is not set, the tooltip of the SearchField (if any) is displayed. Tooltips are not displayed on touch devices.

properties.name: showSearchButton
properties.description:
Set to true to show the search button with the magnifier icon.
If false, both the search and refresh buttons are not displayed even if the "showRefreshButton" property is true.

properties.name: enableSuggestions
properties.description: If true, a suggest event is fired when user types in the input and when the input is focused. On a phone device, a full screen dialog with suggestions is always shown even if the suggestions list is empty.

properties.name: selectOnFocus
properties.description: Normally, search text is selected for copy when the SearchField is focused by keyboard navigation. If an application re-renders the SearchField during the liveChange event, set this property to false to disable text selection by focus.

deprecated.text: This parameter is deprecated and has no effect in run time. The cursor position of a focused search field is restored after re-rendering automatically.

aggregations.name: suggestionItems
aggregations.description:
SuggestionItems are the items which will be shown in the suggestions list. The following properties can be used:
  • key is not displayed and may be used as internal technical field
  • text is displayed as normal suggestion text
  • icon
  • description - additional text may be used to visually display search item type or category

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: search
events.description: Event which is fired when the user triggers a search.

suggestionItem.name: suggestionItem
suggestionItem.description: Suggestion list item in case if the user has selected an item from the suggestions list.

refreshButtonPressed.name: refreshButtonPressed
refreshButtonPressed.description: Indicates if the user pressed the refresh icon.

clearButtonPressed.name: clearButtonPressed
clearButtonPressed.description: Indicates if the user pressed the clear icon.

events.name: liveChange
events.description: This event is fired when the value of the search field is changed by a user - e.g. at each key press. Do not invalidate or re-render a focused search field, especially during the liveChange event.

events.name: suggest
events.description:
This event is fired when the search field is initially focused or its value is changed by the user.
This event means that suggestion data should be updated, in case if suggestions are used.
Use the value parameter to create new suggestions for it.

suggestValue.name: suggestValue
suggestValue.description: Current search string of the search field.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Tooltips are not displayed on touch devices. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: New value for property selectOnFocus

methods.description: Sets a new value for property selectOnFocus. Normally, search text is selected for copy when the SearchField is focused by keyboard navigation. If an application re-renders the SearchField during the liveChange event, set this property to false to disable text selection by focus. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

deprecated.text: This parameter is deprecated and has no effect in run time. The cursor position of a focused search field is restored after re-rendering automatically.

By pressing the refresh button or F5 key on keyboard, the user can reload the results list without changing the search string. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.m.SegmentedButton
symbols.description: SegmentedButton is a horizontal control made of multiple buttons, which can display a title or an image. It automatically resizes the buttons to fit proportionally within the control. When no width is set, the control uses the available width.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the SegmentedButton control. If not set, it uses the minimum required width to make all buttons inside of the same size (based on the biggest button).

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Disables all the buttons in the SegmentedButton control. When disabled all the buttons look grey and you cannot focus or click on them.

properties.name: selectedKey
properties.description: Key of the selected item. If no item to this key is found in the items aggregation, no changes will apply. Only the items aggregation is affected. If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used.

aggregations.name: buttons
aggregations.description: The buttons of the SegmentedButton control. The items set in this aggregation are used as an interface for the buttons displayed by the control. Only the properties ID, icon, text, enabled and textDirections of the Button control are evaluated. Setting other properties of the button will have no effect. Alternatively, you can use the createButton method to add buttons.

deprecated.text: Instead use the "items" aggregation.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description:
Aggregation of items to be displayed. The items set in this aggregation are used as an interface for the buttons displayed by the control.
The "items" and "buttons" aggregations should NOT be used simultaneously as it causes the control to work incorrectly.

aggregations.name: _select
aggregations.description: Hidden aggregation that holds an instance of sap.m.Select to be used in some contexts as a representation of the segmented button (for example, in a popover with little space).

associations.name: selectedButton
associations.description:
A reference to the currently selected button control. By default or if the association is set to false (null, undefined, "", false), the first button will be selected.
If the association is set to an invalid value (for example, an ID of a button that does not exist) the selection on the SegmentedButton will be removed.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs, which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs, which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: select
events.description: Fires when the user selects a button, which returns the ID and button object.

button.name: button
button.description: Reference to the button, that has been selected.

id.name: id
id.description: ID of the button, which has been selected.

key.name: key
key.description: Key of the button, which has been selected. This property is only filled when the control is initiated with the items aggregation.

symbols.name: sap.m.SegmentedButtonItem

The SegmentedButtonItem control is used for creating buttons for the sap.m.SegmentedButton.
It is derived from a core sap.ui.core.Item.

This can be an URI to an image or an icon font URI.

symbols.name: sap.m.Select
symbols.description: The sap.m.Select control provides a list of items that allows users to select an item.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name to be used in the HTML code (for example, for HTML forms that send data to the server via submit).

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can change the selection.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets the width of the field. By default, the field width is automatically adjusted to the size of its content and the default width of the field is calculated based on the widest list item in the dropdown list. If the width defined is smaller than its content, only the field width is changed whereas the dropdown list keeps the width of its content. If the dropdown list is wider than the visual viewport, it is truncated and an ellipsis is displayed for each item. For phones, the width of the dropdown list is always the same as the viewport. Note: This property is ignored if the autoAdjustWidth property is set to true.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: Sets the maximum width of the control. Note: This property is ignored if the autoAdjustWidth property is set to true.

properties.name: selectedKey
properties.description: Key of the selected item. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used.

properties.name: selectedItemId
properties.description: ID of the selected item.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The URI to the icon that will be displayed only when using the IconOnly type.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of a select. Possible values Default, IconOnly.

properties.name: autoAdjustWidth
properties.description: Indicates whether the width of the input field is determined by the selected item's content.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the text within the input field.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description:
Specifies the direction of the text within the input field with enumerated options.
By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description:
Defines the text of the value state message popup.
If this is not specified, a default text is shown from the resource bundle.

properties.name: showSecondaryValues
properties.description: Indicates whether the text values of the additionalText property of a {@link sap.ui.core.ListItem} are shown.

properties.name: forceSelection
properties.description: Indicates whether the selection is restricted to one of the items in the list. Note: We strongly recommend that you always set this property to false and bind the selectedKey property to the desired value for better interoperability with data binding.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Defines the items contained within this control.

aggregations.name: picker
aggregations.description: Internal aggregation to hold the inner picker popup.

associations.name: selectedItem
associations.description: Sets or retrieves the selected item from the aggregation named items.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: change
events.description:
This event is fired when the value in the selection field is changed in combination with one of the following actions:
  • The focus leaves the selection field
  • The Enter key is pressed
  • The item is pressed

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given.

parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Attaches event handler fnFunction to the change event of this sap.m.Select. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.Select itself. This event is fired when the value in the selection field is changed in combination with one of the following actions:
  • The focus leaves the selection field
  • The Enter key is pressed
  • The item is pressed

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description: Gets current value of property width. Sets the width of the field. By default, the field width is automatically adjusted to the size of its content and the default width of the field is calculated based on the widest list item in the dropdown list. If the width defined is smaller than its content, only the field width is changed whereas the dropdown list keeps the width of its content. If the dropdown list is wider than the visual viewport, it is truncated and an ellipsis is displayed for each item. For phones, the width of the dropdown list is always the same as the viewport. Note: This property is ignored if the autoAdjustWidth property is set to true. Default value is auto.

symbols.name: sap.m.SelectDialog
symbols.description:
A SelectDialog is a dialog containing a list, search functionality to filter it and a confirmation/cancel button. The control can be used when the user should select one or multiple items out of many.

The list used in the SelectDialog is a growing list and can be filled with a any kind of list item. The search field triggers the events "search" and "liveChange" where a filter function can be applied to the list binding.

After selecting an item in single selection mode or after confirming in multi selection mode, the dialog will be closed and the event "confirm" is fired with the items that have been selected. By default, the selection will also be reset to allow for a new selection when opening the dialog again.

When cancelling the selection, the event "change" will be fired and the selection is restored to the state when the dialog was opened.

NOTE: The growing functionality of the list does not support two-way Binding, so if you use this control with a JSON model make sure the binding mode is set to "OneWay" and that you update the selection model manually with the items passed in the "confirm" event.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Determines the title text that appears in the dialog header

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Determines the text shown when the list has no data

properties.name: multiSelect
properties.description: Determines if the user can select several options from the list

properties.name: growingThreshold
properties.description: Determines the number of items initially displayed in the list. Also defines the number of items to be requested from the model for each grow.

properties.name: contentWidth
properties.description: Determines the content width of the inner dialog. For more information, see the dialog documentation.

properties.name: rememberSelections
properties.description: This flag controls whether the dialog clears the selection after the confirm event has been fired. If the dialog needs to be opened multiple times in the same context to allow for corrections of previous user inputs, set this flag to "true".

properties.name: contentHeight
properties.description: Determines the content height of the inner dialog. For more information, see the dialog documentation.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: The items of the list shown in the search dialog. It is recommended to use a StandardListItem for the dialog but other combinations are also possible.

aggregations.name: _dialog
aggregations.description: The internal dialog that will be shown when method open is called

events.name: confirm
events.description: This event will be fired when the dialog is confirmed by selecting an item in single selection mode or by pressing the confirmation button in multi selection mode . The items being selected are returned as event parameters.

selectedItem.name: selectedItem
selectedItem.description: Returns the selected list item. When no item is selected, "null" is returned. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, only the first selected item is returned.

selectedItems.name: selectedItems
selectedItems.description: Returns an array containing the visible selected list items. If no items are selected, an empty array is returned.

selectedContexts.name: selectedContexts
selectedContexts.description:
Returns the binding contexts of the selected items including the non-visible items.
NOTE: In contrast to the parameter "selectedItems", this parameter will also include the selected but NOT visible items (e.g. due to list filtering). An empty array will be set for this parameter if no data binding is used.
NOTE: When the list binding is pre-filtered and there are items in the selection that are not visible upon opening the dialog, these contexts are not loaded. Therefore, these items will not be included in the selectedContexts array unless they are displayed at least once.

events.name: search
events.description: This event will be fired when the search button has been clicked on the searchfield on the visual control

value.name: value
value.description: The value entered in the search

itemsBinding.name: itemsBinding
itemsBinding.description: The Items binding of the Select Dialog for search purposes. It will only be available if the items aggregation is bound to a model.

events.name: liveChange
events.description: This event will be fired when the value of the search field is changed by a user - e.g. at each key press

value.name: value
value.description: The value to search for, which can change at any keypress

itemsBinding.name: itemsBinding
itemsBinding.description: The Items binding of the Select Dialog. It will only be available if the items aggregation is bound to a model.

events.name: cancel
events.description: This event will be fired when the cancel button is clicked

methods.description:
Fires event confirm to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • selectedItem of type sap.m.StandardListItemReturns the selected list item. When no item is selected, "null" is returned. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, only the first selected item is returned.
  • selectedItems of type sap.m.StandardListItem[]Returns an array containing the visible selected list items. If no items are selected, an empty array is returned.
  • selectedContexts of type stringReturns the binding contexts of the selected items including the non-visible items. NOTE: In contrast to the parameter "selectedItems", this parameter will also include the selected but NOT visible items (e.g. due to list filtering). An empty array will be set for this parameter if no data binding is used. NOTE: When the list binding is pre-filtered and there are items in the selection that are not visible upon opening the dialog, these contexts are not loaded. Therefore, these items will not be included in the selectedContexts array unless they are displayed at least once.

methods.description:

  • itemsBinding of type anyThe Items binding of the Select Dialog. It will only be available if the items aggregation is bound to a model.

  • {@link sap.m.semantic.AddAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.MainAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.PositiveAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.NegativeAction}

  • {@link sap.m.DraftIndicator}

symbols.name: sap.m.semantic.FullscreenPage
symbols.description:
A FullscreenPage is a {@link sap.m.semantic.ShareMenuPage} that supports semantic content of the following types:
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.AddAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.MainAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.PositiveAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.NegativeAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.ForwardAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.EditAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.SaveAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.DeleteAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.CancelAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.FlagAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.FavoriteAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.OpenInAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.DiscussInJamAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.ShareInJamAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.SendEmailAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.SendMessageAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.PrintAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.MessagesIndicator}
  • {@link sap.m.DraftIndicator}

symbols.name: sap.m.semantic.MasterPage
symbols.description:
A MasterPage is a {@link sap.m.semantic.SemanticPage} that supports semantic content of the following types:
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.AddAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.MainAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.PositiveAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.NegativeAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.ForwardAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.EditAction}

  • {@link sap.m.semantic.DeleteAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.CancelAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.MultiSelectAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.FlagAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.FavoriteAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.SortAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.SortSelect}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.FilterAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.FilterSelect}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.GroupAction}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.GroupSelect}
  • {@link sap.m.semantic.MessagesIndicator}

symbols.description:
A semantic button is either a {@link sap.m.Button} or {@link sap.m.semantic.SemanticOverflowToolbarButton} ,
eligible for aggregation content of a {@link sap.m.semantic.SemanticPage}.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: See {@link sap.m.Button#enabled}

events.name: press
events.description: See {@link sap.m.Button#press}

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new SemanticButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: press
events.description: See {@link sap.m.Button#press}

methods.name: attachPress

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.semantic.SemanticButton itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the press event of this sap.m.semantic.SemanticButton. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.semantic.SemanticButton itself. See {@link sap.m.Button#press}

methods.name: detachPress

symbols.name: sap.m.semantic.SemanticPage
symbols.description:
A semantic page is an enhanced {@link sap.m.Page}, that can contain controls with semantic meaning @see sap.m.semantic.SemanticControl.
Content specified in the {@link sap.m.semantic.SemanticPage#semanticControls} aggregations will be automatically positioned in dedicated sections of the footer or the header of the page, depending on the control's semantics.
For example, a semantic button of type {@link sap.m.semantic.PositiveAction} will be positioned in the right side of the footer, and in logically correct sequence order with respect to any other included semantic controls.
The full list of what we internally define for semantic content is:
  • Visual properties (e.g. AddAction will be styled as an icon button)
  • Position in the page (UX guidelines specify that some buttons should be in the header only, while others are in the footer or the "share" menu, so we do the correct positioning)
  • Sequence order (UX guidelines define a specific sequence order of semantic controls with respect to each other)
  • Default localized tooltip for icon-only buttons
  • Overflow behavior (UX quidelines define which buttons are allowed to go to the overflow of the toolbar when the screen gets narrower). For icon buttons, we ensure that the text label of the button appears when the button is in overflow, as specified by UX.
  • Screen reader support (invisible text for reading the semantic type)
In addition to the predefined semantic controls, the SemanticPage can host also custom application-provided controls. It preserves most of the API of {@link sap.m.Page} for specifying page content.
