symbols.name: sap.m.UploadCollection
symbols.description:
This control allows you to upload single or multiple files from your devices (desktop, tablet or phone) and attach them to the application.

The consuming application needs to take into account that the consistency checks of the model during the upload of the file need to be performed, for example, if the user is editing or deleting a file.

properties.name: fileType
properties.description:
Defines the allowed file types for the upload.
The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types.
If at least one file does not fit the file type requirements, the upload is prevented.  Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

properties.name: maximumFilenameLength
properties.description:
Specifies the maximum length of a file name.
If the maximum file name length is exceeded, the corresponding event 'filenameLengthExceed' is triggered.

properties.name: maximumFileSize
properties.description:
Specifies a file size limit in megabytes that prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds the limit.
This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 8 and 9.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description:
Defines the allowed MIME types of files to be uploaded.
The chosen files will be checked against an array of MIME types.
If at least one file does not fit the MIME type requirements, the upload is prevented.
This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 8 and 9. Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

properties.name: multiple
properties.description:
Lets the user select multiple files from the same folder and then upload them.
Internet Explorer 8 and 9 do not support this property.
Please note that the various operating systems for mobile devices can react differently to the property so that fewer upload functions may be available in some cases.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Allows you to set your own text for the 'No data' text label.

properties.name: sameFilenameAllowed
properties.description: Allows the user to use the same name for a file when editing the file name. 'Same name' refers to an already existing file name in the list.

properties.name: showSeparators
properties.description: Defines whether separators are shown between list items.

properties.name: uploadEnabled
properties.description: Enables the upload of a file.

properties.name: uploadUrl
properties.description: Specifies the URL where the uploaded files have to be stored.

properties.name: instantUpload
properties.description: If false, no upload is triggered when a file is selected. In addition, if a file was selected, a new FileUploader instance is created to ensure that multiple files from multiple folders can be chosen.

properties.name: numberOfAttachmentsText
properties.description:
Sets the title text in the toolbar of the list of attachments.
To show as well the number of attachments in brackets like the default text does. The number of attachments could be retrieved via "getItems().length".
If a new title is set, the default is deactivated.
The default value is set to language-dependent "Attachments (n)".

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
Defines the selection mode of the control (e.g. None, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, SingleSelectLeft, SingleSelectMaster).
Since the UploadCollection reacts like a list for attachments, the API is close to the ListBase Interface.
sap.m.ListMode.Delete mode is not supported and will be automatically set to sap.m.ListMode.None.
In addition, if instant upload is set to false the mode sap.m.ListMode.MultiSelect is not supported and will be automatically set to sap.m.ListMode.None.

properties.name: uploadButtonInvisible
properties.description: If true, the button used for uploading files is invisible.

properties.name: terminationEnabled
properties.description:
If true, the button that is used to terminate the instant file upload gets visible.
The button normally appears when a file is being uploaded.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Uploaded items.

aggregations.name: headerParameters
aggregations.description:
Specifies the header parameters for the FileUploader that are submitted only with XHR requests.
Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 8 and 9.

aggregations.name: parameters
aggregations.description: Specifies the parameters for the FileUploader that are rendered as a hidden input field.

aggregations.name: toolbar
aggregations.description: Specifies the toolbar.

aggregations.name: infoToolbar
aggregations.description: Specifies the info toolbar for filtering information. Sorting information will not displayed.

aggregations.name: _list
aggregations.description: Internal aggregation to hold the list in controls tree.

events.name: change
events.description:
The event is triggered when files are selected in the FileUploader dialog. Applications can set parameters and headerParameters which will be dispatched to the embedded FileUploader control.
Limitation: parameters and headerParameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

files.name: files
files.description:
A list of uploaded files. Each entry contains the following members.
fileName	: The name of a file to be uploaded.
response	: Response message which comes from the server. On the server side, this response has to be put within the 'body' tags of the response document of the iFrame. It can consist of a return code and an optional message. This does not work in cross-domain scenarios.
responseRaw : HTTP-Response which comes from the server. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer Versions lower than 9.
status	: Status of the XHR request. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9 and lower.
headers : HTTP-Response-Headers which come from the server. Provided as a JSON-map, i.e. each header-field is reflected by a property in the header-object, with the property value reflecting the header-field's content. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9 and lower.
Since version 1.28.0.

  • files of type object[]A list of uploaded files. Each entry contains the following members. fileName : The name of a file to be uploaded. response : Response message which comes from the server. On the server side, this response has to be put within the 'body' tags of the response document of the iFrame. It can consist of a return code and an optional message. This does not work in cross-domain scenarios. responseRaw : HTTP-Response which comes from the server. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer Versions lower than 9. status : Status of the XHR request. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9 and lower. headers : HTTP-Response-Headers which come from the server. Provided as a JSON-map, i.e. each header-field is reflected by a property in the header-object, with the property value reflecting the header-field's content. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9 and lower. Since version 1.28.0.

methods.name: fireUploadTerminated

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event uploadTerminated to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • fileName of type stringSpecifies the name of the file of which the upload is to be terminated.
  • getHeaderParameter of type functionThis callback function returns the corresponding header parameter (type sap.m.UploadCollectionParameter) if available.

methods.name: getFileType

returnValue.description: Value of property fileType

methods.description: Gets current value of property fileType. Defines the allowed file types for the upload. The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type requirements, the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

methods.name: getHeaderParameters
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation headerParameters. Specifies the header parameters for the FileUploader that are submitted only with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 8 and 9.

methods.name: getInfoToolbar
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation infoToolbar. Specifies the info toolbar for filtering information. Sorting information will not displayed.

methods.name: getInstantUpload

returnValue.description: Value of property instantUpload

methods.description: Gets current value of property instantUpload. If false, no upload is triggered when a file is selected. In addition, if a file was selected, a new FileUploader instance is created to ensure that multiple files from multiple folders can be chosen. Default value is true.

methods.name: getItems
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation items. Uploaded items.

methods.name: getMaximumFilenameLength

returnValue.description: Value of property maximumFilenameLength

methods.description: Gets current value of property maximumFilenameLength. Specifies the maximum length of a file name. If the maximum file name length is exceeded, the corresponding event 'filenameLengthExceed' is triggered.

methods.name: getMaximumFileSize

returnValue.description: Value of property maximumFileSize

methods.description: Gets current value of property maximumFileSize. Specifies a file size limit in megabytes that prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds the limit. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 8 and 9.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.UploadCollection.

methods.name: getMimeType

returnValue.description: Value of property mimeType

methods.description: Gets current value of property mimeType. Defines the allowed MIME types of files to be uploaded. The chosen files will be checked against an array of MIME types. If at least one file does not fit the MIME type requirements, the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 8 and 9. Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

methods.name: getMode

returnValue.description: Value of property mode

methods.description: Gets current value of property mode. Defines the selection mode of the control (e.g. None, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, SingleSelectLeft, SingleSelectMaster). Since the UploadCollection reacts like a list for attachments, the API is close to the ListBase Interface. sap.m.ListMode.Delete mode is not supported and will be automatically set to sap.m.ListMode.None. In addition, if instant upload is set to false the mode sap.m.ListMode.MultiSelect is not supported and will be automatically set to sap.m.ListMode.None. Default value is None.

methods.name: getMultiple

returnValue.description: Value of property multiple

methods.description: Gets current value of property multiple. Lets the user select multiple files from the same folder and then upload them. Internet Explorer 8 and 9 do not support this property. Please note that the various operating systems for mobile devices can react differently to the property so that fewer upload functions may be available in some cases. Default value is false.

methods.name: getNoDataText

returnValue.description: Value of property noDataText

methods.description: Gets current value of property noDataText. Allows you to set your own text for the 'No data' text label.

methods.name: getNumberOfAttachmentsText

returnValue.description: Value of property numberOfAttachmentsText

methods.description: Gets current value of property numberOfAttachmentsText. Sets the title text in the toolbar of the list of attachments. To show as well the number of attachments in brackets like the default text does. The number of attachments could be retrieved via "getItems().length". If a new title is set, the default is deactivated. The default value is set to language-dependent "Attachments (n)".

methods.name: openFileDialog

returnValue.description: To ensure method chaining, return the UploadCollection.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to update with a new version. This parameter is mandatory.

methods.description:
Opens the FileUploader dialog. When an UploadCollectionItem is provided, this method can be used to update a file with a new version.
In this case, the upload progress can be sequenced using the events: beforeUploadStarts, uploadComplete and uploadTerminated. For this use,
multiple properties from the UploadCollection have to be set to false. If no UploadCollectionItem is provided, only the dialog opens
and no further configuration of the UploadCollection is needed.

symbols.name: sap.m.UploadCollectionItem
symbols.description: Items provide information about the uploaded files.

properties.name: contributor
properties.description: Specifies the name of the user who uploaded the file.

deprecated.text:
This property is deprecated; use the aggregation attributes instead.
However, if the property is filled, it is displayed as an attribute. To make sure the title does not appear twice, do not use the property.

properties.name: documentId
properties.description: Specifies a unique identifier of the file (created by the application).

properties.name: fileName
properties.description: Specifies the name of the uploaded file.

properties.name: fileSize
properties.description: Specifies the size of the uploaded file (in megabytes).

deprecated.text: This property is deprecated; use the aggregation attributes instead.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: Specifies the MIME type of the file.

properties.name: thumbnailUrl
properties.description: Specifies the URL where the thumbnail of the file is located.

properties.name: uploadedDate
properties.description:
Specifies the date on which the file was uploaded.
The application has to define the date format.

deprecated.text: This property is deprecated; use the aggregation attributes instead.

properties.name: url
properties.description:
Specifies the URL where the file is located.
If the application doesn't provide a value for this property, the icon and the file name of the UploadCollectionItem are not clickable.

properties.name: enableEdit
properties.description:
Enables/Disables the Edit button.
If the value is true, the Edit button is enabled and the edit function can be used.
If the value is false, the edit function is not available.

properties.name: enableDelete
properties.description:
Enables/Disables the Delete button.
If the value is true, the Delete button is enabled and the delete function can be used.
If the value is false, the delete function is not available.

properties.name: visibleEdit
properties.description:
Show/Hide the Edit button.
If the value is true, the Edit button is visible.
If the value is false, the Edit button is not visible.

properties.name: visibleDelete
properties.description:
Show/Hide the Delete button.
If the value is true, the Delete button is visible.
If the value is false, the Delete button is not visible.

properties.name: ariaLabelForPicture
properties.description: Aria label for the icon (or for the image).

experimental.text: The behavior of the property might change in the next version.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the selected state of the UploadCollectionItem.

aggregations.name: attributes
aggregations.description:
Attributes of an uploaded item, for example, 'Uploaded By', 'Uploaded On', 'File Size' attributes are displayed after an item has been uploaded. Additionally, the Active property of sap.m.ObjectAttribute is supported.
Note that if one of the deprecated properties contributor, fileSize or UploadedDate is filled in addition to this attribute, two attributes with the same title are displayed as these properties get displayed as an attribute. Example: An application passes the property ‘contributor’ with the value ‘A’ and the aggregation attributes ‘contributor’: ‘B’. As a result, the attributes ‘contributor’:’A’ and ‘contributor’:’B’ are displayed. To make sure the title does not appear twice, check if one of the properties is filled.

aggregations.name: _propertyAttributes
aggregations.description: Hidden aggregation for the attributes created from the deprecated properties uploadedDate, contributor and fileSize

aggregations.name: statuses
aggregations.description:
Statuses of an uploaded item
Statuses will be displayed after an item has been uploaded

aggregations.name: markers
aggregations.description:
Markers of an uploaded item
Markers will be displayed after an item has been uploaded
But not in Edit mode

associations.name: fileUploader
associations.description:
ID of the FileUploader instance
since version 1.30

symbols.name: sap.m.URLHelper
symbols.description:
URL(Uniform Resource Locator) Helper. This helper can be used to trigger a native application (e.g. email, sms, phone) from the browser. That means we are restricted of browser or application implementation. e.g.
  • Some browsers do not let you to pass more than 2022 characters in the URL
  • MAPI (Outlook) limit is 2083, max. path under Internet Explorer it is 2048
  • Different Internet Explorer versions have a different limitation (IE9 approximately 1000 characters)
  • MS mail app under Windows 8 cuts mail links after approximately 100 characters
  • Safari gets a confirmation from user before opening a native application and can block other triggers if the user cancels it
  • Some mail applications(Outlook) do not respect all encodings(e.g. Cyrillic texts are not encoded correctly)
Note: all the given limitation lengths are for encoded text(e.g space character will be encoded to "%20").

NOTE: On Windows Phone the URL will be enforced to open in the same window if opening in a new window/tab fails (because of a known system restriction on cross-window communications). Use sap.m.Link instead (with blank target) if you necessarily need to open URL in a new window.

symbols.description:
A string type that represents CSS color values, sap.m.ValueColor or less parameter values.
Allowed values are {@link sap.ui.core.CSSColor}, {@link sap.m.ValueColor} and {String} as a less parameter name.
In case the less parameter color cannot be determined, the validation failed. You need to check if less parameters are supported on control level.
An empty string is also allowed and has the same effect as setting no color.

symbols.name: sap.m.ViewSettingsDialog
symbols.description:
Overview

The {@link sap.m.ViewSettingsDialog} helps the user to sort, filter, or group data within a (master) {@link sap.m.List List} or a {@link sap.m.Table Table}. The dialog is triggered by icon buttons in the table toolbar. Each button shows a dropdown list icon.

The {@link sap.m.ViewSettingsDialog ViewSettingsDialog} is a composite control, consisting of a modal {@link sap.m.Popover Popover} and several internal lists. There are three different tabs (Sort, Group, Filter) in the dialog that can be activated by filling the respective associations. If only one association is filled, the other tabs are automatically hidden. The selected options can be used to create sorters and filters for the table.

Note: If the app does not offer all three sorting, filtering, and grouping functionalities, but only one of these (such as sort), we recommend placing the icon button directly in the toolbar. Do not place sort, filter, or group buttons in the footer toolbar if they refer to a table. Place group, sort, and filter buttons in the footer toolbar if they refer to a master list.

Usage

When to use?
  • If you need to allow the user to sort line items in a manageable list or table (up to 20 columns)
  • If you need to offer custom filter settings in a manageable list or table (up to 20 columns)
  • If you need to allow the user to group line items in a manageable list or table (up to 20 columns)
When not to use?
  • If you have complex tables (more than 20 columns)
  • If you need to rearrange columns within your table (use the {@link sap.m.TablePersoDialog TablePersoDialog} instead)
  • If you need very specific sort, filter, or column sorting options within complex tables (use the {@link sap.m.P13nDialog P13nDialog} instead)
Responsive behavior

The popover dialog appears as a modal window on desktop and tablet screen sizes, but full screen on smartphones.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Defines the title of the dialog. If not set and there is only one active tab, the dialog uses the default "View" or "Sort", "Group", "Filter" respectively.

properties.name: sortDescending
properties.description: Determines whether the sort order is descending or ascending (default).

properties.name: groupDescending
properties.description: Determines whether the group order is descending or ascending (default).

properties.name: filterSearchOperator
properties.description: Provides a string filter operator which is used when the user searches items in filter details page. Possible operators are: AnyWordStartsWith, Contains, StartsWith, Equals. This property will be ignored if a custom callback is provided through setFilterSearchCallback method.

aggregations.name: sortItems
aggregations.description: The list of items with key and value that can be sorted over (for example, a list of columns for a table).

aggregations.name: groupItems
aggregations.description: The list of items with key and value that can be grouped on (for example, a list of columns for a table).

aggregations.name: filterItems
aggregations.description: The list of items with key and value that can be filtered on (for example, a list of columns for a table). A filterItem is associated with one or more detail filters.

aggregations.name: presetFilterItems
aggregations.description: The list of preset filter items that allows the selection of more complex or custom filters. These entries are displayed at the top of the filter tab.

aggregations.name: customTabs
aggregations.description: The list of all the custom tabs.

associations.name: selectedSortItem
associations.description: The sort item that is selected. It can be set by either passing a key or the item itself to the function setSelectedSortItem.

associations.name: selectedGroupItem
associations.description: The group item that is selected. It can be set by either passing a key or the item itself to the function setSelectedGroupItem.

associations.name: selectedPresetFilterItem
associations.description: The preset filter item that is selected. It can be set by either passing a key or the item itself to the function setSelectedPresetFilterItem. Note that either a preset filter OR multiple detail filters can be active at the same time.

events.name: confirm
events.description:
Indicates that the user has pressed the OK button and the selected sort, group, and filter settings should be applied to the data on this page.

Note: Custom tabs are not converted to event parameters automatically. For custom tabs, you have to read the state of your controls inside the callback of this event.

sortDescending.name: sortDescending
sortDescending.description: The selected sort order (true = descending, false = ascending).

groupDescending.name: groupDescending
groupDescending.description: The selected group order (true = descending, false = ascending).

filterItems.name: filterItems
filterItems.description: The selected filters in an array of ViewSettingsItem.

filterKeys.name: filterKeys
filterKeys.description: The selected filter items in an object notation format: { key: boolean }. If a custom control filter was displayed (for example, the user clicked on the filter item), the value for its key is set to true to indicate that there has been an interaction with the control.

filterString.name: filterString
filterString.description: The selected filter items in a string format to display in the control's header bar in format "Filtered by: key (subkey1, subkey2, subkey3)".

methods.name: fireConfirm

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description:
Fires event confirm to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • sortItem of type sap.m.ViewSettingsItemThe selected sort item.
  • sortDescending of type booleanThe selected sort order (true = descending, false = ascending).
  • groupItem of type sap.m.ViewSettingsItemThe selected group item.
  • groupDescending of type booleanThe selected group order (true = descending, false = ascending).
  • presetFilterItem of type sap.m.ViewSettingsItemThe selected preset filter item.
  • filterItems of type sap.m.ViewSettingsItem[]The selected filters in an array of ViewSettingsItem.
  • filterKeys of type objectThe selected filter items in an object notation format: { key: boolean }. If a custom control filter was displayed (for example, the user clicked on the filter item), the value for its key is set to true to indicate that there has been an interaction with the control.
  • filterCompoundKeys of type objectThe selected filter items in an object notation format: { parentKey: { key: boolean, key2: boolean, ... }, ...}. If a custom control filter was displayed (for example, the user clicked on the filter item), the value for its key is set to true to indicate that there has been an interaction with the control.
  • filterString of type stringThe selected filter items in a string format to display in the control's header bar in format "Filtered by: key (subkey1, subkey2, subkey3)".

symbols.name: sap.m.Wizard
symbols.description:
The Wizard control enables users to accomplish a single goal
which consists of multiple dependable sub-tasks.
Each sub-task is provided in the form of a WizardStep.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Determines the width of the Wizard.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Determines the height of the Wizard.

properties.name: showNextButton
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the next button. The developers can choose to control the flow of the steps either through the API (with nextStep and previousStep methods) or let the user click the next button, and control it with validateStep or invalidateStep methods.

properties.name: finishButtonText
properties.description: Changes the text of the finish button for the last step. This property can be used only if showNextButton is set to true. By default the text of the button is "Review".

properties.name: enableBranching
properties.description: Enables the branching functionality of the Wizard. Branching gives the developer the ability to define multiple routes a user is able to take based on the input in the current step. It is up to the developer to programatically check for what is the input in the current step and set a concrete next step amongs the available subsequent steps. Note: If this property is set to false, next and subSequentSteps associations of the WizardStep control are ignored.

aggregations.name: steps
aggregations.description: The wizard steps to be included in the content of the control.

aggregations.name: _progressNavigator
aggregations.description: The progress navigator for the wizard.

aggregations.name: _nextButton
aggregations.description: The next button for the wizard.

symbols.name: sap.m.WizardStep
symbols.description:
The WizardStep is a container control which should be used mainly to aggregate user input controls.
It gives the developer the ability to validate, invalidate the step and define subsequent steps.
Note: The WizardStep control control is supposed to be used only as an aggregation of the Wizard control,
and should not be used as a standalone one.

properties.name: title
properties.description:
Determines the title of the step.
The title is visualized in the Wizard control.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Determines the icon that is displayed for this step. The icon is visualized in the progress navigation part of the Wizard control. Note: In order for the icon to be displayed, each step in the Wizard should have this property defined, otherwise the default numbering will be displayed.

properties.name: validated
properties.description:
Indicates whether or not the step is validated.
When a step is validated a Next button is visualized in the Wizard control.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: The content of the Wizard Step.

associations.name: subsequentSteps
associations.description: This association is used only when the enableBranching property of the Wizard is set to true. Use the association to store the next steps that are about to come after the current. If this is going to be a final step - leave this association empty.

associations.name: nextStep
associations.description:
The next step to be taken after the step is completed.
Set this association value in the complete event of the current WizardStep.

events.name: complete
events.description: This event is fired after the user presses the Next button in the Wizard, or on nextStep method call from the app developer.

events.name: activate
events.description: This event is fired on next step activation from the Wizard.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new WizardStep. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: activate
events.description: This event is fired on next step activation from the Wizard.

events.name: complete
events.description: This event is fired after the user presses the Next button in the Wizard, or on nextStep method call from the app developer.

methods.name: addContent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: the content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some content to the aggregation content.

methods.name: addSubsequentStep

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: vSubsequentStep
parameters.description: the subsequentSteps to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some subsequentStep into the association subsequentSteps.

methods.name: attachActivate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.WizardStep itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the activate event of this sap.m.WizardStep. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.WizardStep itself. This event is fired on next step activation from the Wizard.

methods.name: attachComplete

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.WizardStep itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the complete event of this sap.m.WizardStep. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.WizardStep itself. This event is fired after the user presses the Next button in the Wizard, or on nextStep method call from the app developer.

methods.name: destroyContent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Destroys all the content in the aggregation content.

methods.name: detachActivate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the activate event of this sap.m.WizardStep. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: detachComplete

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the complete event of this sap.m.WizardStep. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.m.WizardStep with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.

methods.name: fireActivate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description: Fires event activate to attached listeners.

methods.name: fireComplete

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mArguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass along with the event

methods.description: Fires event complete to attached listeners.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation content. The content of the Wizard Step.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Value of property icon

methods.description: Gets current value of property icon. Determines the icon that is displayed for this step. The icon is visualized in the progress navigation part of the Wizard control. Note: In order for the icon to be displayed, each step in the Wizard should have this property defined, otherwise the default numbering will be displayed. Default value is .

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.WizardStep.

methods.name: getNextStep
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association nextStep, or null.

methods.name: getSubsequentSteps
methods.description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association subsequentSteps.

methods.name: getTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property title

methods.description: Gets current value of property title. Determines the title of the step. The title is visualized in the Wizard control. Default value is .

methods.name: getValidated

returnValue.description: Value of property validated

methods.description: Gets current value of property validated. Indicates whether or not the step is validated. When a step is validated a Next button is visualized in the Wizard control. Default value is true.

methods.name: indexOfContent

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation content. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertContent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: the content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: the 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a content into the aggregation content.

methods.name: removeAllContent

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description: Removes all the controls from the aggregation content. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeAllSubsequentSteps

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description: Removes all the controls in the association named subsequentSteps.

methods.name: removeContent

returnValue.description: The removed content or null

parameters.name: vContent
parameters.description: The content to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a content from the aggregation content.

methods.name: removeSubsequentStep

returnValue.description: The removed subsequentStep or null

parameters.name: vSubsequentStep
parameters.description: The subsequentStep to be removed or its index or ID

methods.description: Removes an subsequentStep from the association named subsequentSteps.

methods.name: setIcon

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sIcon
parameters.description: New value for property icon

methods.description: Sets a new value for property icon. Determines the icon that is displayed for this step. The icon is visualized in the progress navigation part of the Wizard control. Note: In order for the icon to be displayed, each step in the Wizard should have this property defined, otherwise the default numbering will be displayed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

methods.name: setNextStep

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oNextStep
parameters.description: ID of an element which becomes the new target of this nextStep association; alternatively, an element instance may be given

methods.description: Sets the associated nextStep.

methods.name: setTitle

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTitle
parameters.description: New value for property title

methods.description: Sets a new value for property title. Determines the title of the step. The title is visualized in the Wizard control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

methods.name: setValidated

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bValidated
parameters.description: New value for property validated

methods.description: Sets a new value for property validated. Indicates whether or not the step is validated. When a step is validated a Next button is visualized in the Wizard control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.
